Consist of 10 new cards (with 20 new codenames) in Polish connected to quarantine.

Can be mixed with both regular Codenames (Tajniacy), Codenames Undercover (Tajniacy: Bez Cenzury), Codenames Duet (Tajniacy: Duet) or even Codenames Pictures (Tajniacy: Obrazki) if using mixed Word/Pictures game variant.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: 10 Commandments: A Party Game
description:
"Ten Commandments" is a fun and simple card game. But there is a big difference between this game and all the others: The commandment cards! These commandments make the game different every time you play, and make the players do or don’t do various things to avoid getting penalty points.

How to play:
Each player at their turn must play a card first, and then take a card from the draw pile. The main rule is: You can never play a one-digit card on another one-digit card, and a two-digit card on another two-digit card.

Commandments:
Two commandments always govern the game: 1. Sneezing is forbidden! 2. Saying ‘I’ or ‘Me’ or ‘Myself’ is forbidden! Eight more commandments will be added to the game randomly during the play. Commandment Cards add different rules to each game, making it very competitive and fun. So, all you need to do is to obey the commandments, or delude others into disobeying them!

All players must obey the in-play commandments. Failing to do so must be penalized by one Penalty Token. At the end of the game, the player with the least penalty points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Number, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Communication Limits, Hand Management, Variable Set-up

name: Mixtape Massacre: Myth Expansion
description:
An expansion for both Mixtape Massacre and Mixtape Massacre: Escape From Tall Oaks.

When Mr. Beckman and his friends went out for the annual Tall Oaks Hunt, they never came back. Two days later, a search party found him in the woods, covered in the blood of his friends, rambling about a myth from Tall Oaks lore. He quickly became the prime suspect. Now Kimmy and friends must work together to prove the existence of the Myth and save her father.

To dispel gossip and rumors, the Mayor called in esteemed big game hunter, Duke Morrison. Morrison was given two directives: prove or disprove the Myths’s existence and rid Tall Oaks of their slasher problem once and for all. He gladly accepted.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Gulf, Mobile & Ohio: Franco-German Rails
description:
The steam is up, the drivers engaged, and the first locomotives in Berlin and Paris have started clanking down the brand new tracks. Savvy, wealthy industrialists have scrambled to invest in this exciting new technology, and each hopes to reap untold fortunes from this unique venture. Some will do well, others not so much, but there will be only one that comes out on top.

Franco-German Rails is an expansion for Gulf, Mobile & Ohio that offers two different maps on which to play: France and Germany. These maps feature generic rail lines that start in specific cities with a set of share certificates for each.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Mythwind: Event Card Pack
description: A pack of KS Exclusive Event Cards for Mythwind.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Board Game Circus, Open Owl Studios

name: Slidestone
description:
Slidestone is a simple, abstract game of strategy for two players. It's easy to learn, beautiful to behold, quick to play, and challenging to master.

The rules are simple, they're printed right on the board! Alternate turns. Slide a stone in a single direction ending only at an edge or another stone. The first player to reach the center wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Slide/Push

name: The Punic Wars: The Struggle for the Mediterranean, 264-146 BC
description:
The Punic Wars is a two-player strategy game that takes place from the Roman landing in Sicily in 264 B.C. to the destruction of Carthage in 146 B.C. One player takes the Roman army and the other player takes the Carthaginian army.

Up to three wars can occur during the game. The winner of the game is the player who wins two of the three wars. In history, three wars were fought, but Rome won the first and second Punic Wars, so in game terms, the Roman player is the winner at the end of the second Punic War.

The core of the game is resource points, which represent the ability of both Rome and Carthage to continue the war, and the mobilization of soldiers; as well as card play, which recreates strategy and tactics. The aim is not only to win the war, but also to fight for the next war.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Score-and-Reset Game, Simulation

name: Corrosion: Starting Machines
description:
We prepared a Corrosion Mini Expansion for you to print at home! The starting machines only take up half a piece of A4 paper but changes the game play a lot. From the beginning each player has an individual starting machine to speed up the start of the game. Just go to our website to find the print file and rules in German and English.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Justice & Mercy
description:
Justice & Mercy is an expansion for Vampire: The Masquerade - Rivals that adds two new clans, each on a different path: BANU HAQIM & SALUBRI. The Banu Haqim are judges and lawbringers with both martial and sorcerous tools at their disposal. The Salubri are a clan on the run, simply trying to survive – alone if necessary. Rarest of all the clans, their mending abilities are second to none. You may play these two clans head-to-head or integrate them with your other clans to create new strategies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: The Season: Love & Drama in the Regency Era
description:
Your skirts have been lowered, your hair pulled up, and London is buzzing with activity as more and more families move back to town. Invitations for tea parties, suppers, picnics, and all sorts of social affairs appear almost daily, and all conversations with your dearest friends now include speculation as to which gentleman will be present at this ball or that supper.

As a blooming debutante in the London season, your primary goal is to have the highest reputation points by enhancing your accomplishments, improving your reputation among the social elite, and, most importantly, encouraging proposals and getting married.

You may enhance your accomplishments directly through actions or with choices you make during special events. At the end of the game, each accomplishment point you have translates to one reputation point. Your reputation is improved by socializing and wearing the right outfits at various balls. Debutantes who wear matching dresses and accessories, especially those that match the balls’ themes, receive higher reputation points. You may encourage a suitor to propose by raising a suitor’s affection level to 10 and ensuring you are eligible for that suitor’s dowry and accomplishment requirements.

The lady with the highest amount of reputation points at the end of the game will be the winner of this exciting London season!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Role Playing

name: Lone AstroTank: A Solitaire Sci-Fi Wargame
description:
The AstroTank will be developed in the twenty second century to counter perceived threats from as yet undiscovered Alien species, a threat heightened by the discovery of ‘faster than light’ space travel, the possibility of which had previously been doubted. Finally completed, the AstroTank will be required in the early twenty third century when first contact is made with an aggressive Alien species who want nothing more than to colonise as many planets as possible for their own consumption. Despite some attempt at a peaceful settlement, the Aliens will breach a preliminary agreement and construct a base on our own Moon. As one of Earth’s non-negotiables, it will result in all-out war between the two species. The Earth’s newly formed Astro Defence Force (ADF) will be ordered into combat for the first time.

Lone AstroTank is a hex and counter wargame that puts you in charge of a single AstroTank and its three Crew members as it is dropped onto different planets to assist with the removal of the Alien presence. You will need to manage the Crew to enable them to operate the AstroTank in the most effective way possible, whilst facing dangerous, aggressive and terrifying Aliens in a selection of varied and challenging Missions. Whilst this game is not a ‘narrative driven’ game as such, with a little imagination it will provide memorable stories. Some events are randomly generated, but the Player generally has at least some degree of control over the level of risk they wish to take and how vulnerable they leave their AstroTank and its Crew to these Events.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Keep the Heroes Out!: Boss Battles
description:
Keep the Heroes Out: Boss Battles! will bring more Scenarios, more Monsters, new ways to handle difficulty and, of course, Boss Battles! These big baddies will have their own special deck of abilities to spice things up!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Drawing Fire
description:
Drawing Fire is a pen and paper skirmish wargame for one player. Players lead a small squad of soldiers on a dangerous mission behind enemy lines.

In each game, players draw a map on a piece of paper. The map is then randomly populated with "features" like enemy soldiers, tanks, buildings and rough terrain.

Players move their soldiers around the map, attacking and interacting with features, in order to complete the objectives of the mission.

Players win once they have completed their primary objective. Players lose if they run out of time or all their soldiers are killed.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Beach Day
description:
As you breathe in the cool salty air that gently brushes across your face, the sound of crashing waves fills your ears. The gentle heat of the sun warms your skin while the grit of the warm sand tingles your feet. On the ground seashells and sandcastles are scattered about among puddles of ocean water making a beautiful tapestry in the sand. It's time for your beach day!

In Beach Day, players will draft cards to create beach that is decorated with shells, sandcastles, water, and much more. Players will take the cards and place them as tiles to arrange these objects in optimal formations based on modular scoring cards. The player with the best decorated beach wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Enclosure, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Path of Civilization: Ragnar Promo Card
description:
An additional level 2 Leader card, given out during Essen 2023

Promo card GL-44

Leader II Leader (Military). Immediately gain 1 Builder Cube and 3 Military level.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Path of Civilization: Robin Promo Card
description:
An additional level II Leader card.

Promo card GL-42

Level II Leader (Culture).
While in play: Gain 2 Victory point by Culture development
In cemetery: Gain 2 Victory point by Culture development
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 14 Days: Aerial Combat
description:
It is a dawn of aviation warfare, the Great War of 1914-18.You are one of the freshly pilots, just came from the flight
school. Your expected lifespan on the front is 14 days. Will you be just another name on the tombstone, or will you
became an Ace?

14 Days is a solo wargame, simplified and abstracted to the core, with low number of components, perfect for a
campaign play on the run.

Game Components:
- 6 white d6 dice
- 1 red d6 die
- 5 red wooden cubes
- 4 white wooden cubes
- 3 yellow wooden cubes
- 2 blue wooden cubes
- 2 black wooden cubes
- one meeple in the shape of an airplane
- one bag for the wooden cubes
9 Cards:
- 1 double-sided Aircraft card (Allied/German)
- 1 double-sided Map card
- 1 Dogfight / Events card
- 1 Tables and Charts card
- 5 Terrain cards with randomized DRMs on the back

Object of the game:
Fly and survive all 14 missions of a campaign. Score points for every mission and check how well did you do on the European battlefield. You are encouraged to give some narrative to your achievements, so keeping a diary in a style of an airman on the front line is preferable.

Game Setup:
Basic setup is simple – shuffle all terrain cards in a face down deck. Place all wooden cubes in the bag, except white ones, and set you dice nearby. Choose the Allied or German side of the Aircraft and Map card (following the emblem on the card) and place Tables & Charts and Dogfight/Events cards close by.
Use the Mission log on the back of this rulebook and a pen to write down your mission results.

Mission types and mission end:
There are three types of missions: Patrol, Reconnaissance and Bombing run.
For Patrol and Bombing run you just need to finish with all encounters on the last card and return to base for mission to be successful.

For Reconnaissance is the same, but both you and wingman must return to be base for mission to be successful.

Mission can end in three ways, by returning to base on your accord before reaching the last terrain card in the column (failed mission), by getting shot down from the skies (failed mission), or in case of Reconnaissance your wingman gets shot down (failed mission), or you can finish with the last terrain card and return home (successful mission).

In any case, when returning to base you need to roll on the Landing table, applying all DRMs accordingly. You need 4+ to land successfully.

Remove any white cubes from the bag together with any other used or unused white cubes to have a new supply that will be placed back into the bag during an Aircraft prep stage.

Mission scoring:
If mission is successful – gain number of points as stated on the Map card.
-1 point if wingman has died.
-1 point if your Landing was unsuccessful.
1 point for each enemy plane destroyed.
Points for each special target destroyed (based on the type)*




• Reconnaissance plane = 1 point
• Reconnaissance balloon = 1 point
• Bomber = 2 points
• Zeppelin = 2 points

If mission is unsuccessful – you lose double the amount of points you would get by succeeding the mission. Example: if
you would score 2 points and mission ended in a failure, you wold gain -4 points instead.
Write everything down in your Mission log. If you survive the campaign, final amount of your points will give you a short summary how well you did as an airman in Great War.

Leveling up and Ace status:
It is possible to level up through the campaign.

-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Juntabras
description:
Choose your words, eat letters according to the level and put them together so that the rest of the participants can guess your board. Get clues and help by completing each level, try to reach the end while keeping some clues, but don't fail or you will have to start over.

How to play:

Take the whiteboard and give a marker to each participant,
The wordmixer draws two cards and puts two words together, removing as many letters as the level the group is at, and writes them on his board, then lets the rest guess which words it comes from without giving any more clues.

The more correct words, the more levels the group will advance and the more advantages they will obtain.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Silver Fang
description:
Your village has been overrun by savage werewolves, which are represented by the number on each of the cards that make up your village. To get rid of these fanged fiends faster than the neighboring villages, use your residents' special abilities and your powerful secret weapon: a silver fang.

Call for a vote when you think you have the fewest werewolves, but be careful as everyone else gets one more turn to save their own village first...

Silver Fang is a fast and engaging traditional card game with a werewolf twist! Everyone starts the game with five face-down cards, with each player being able to choose and see two of their cards. Cards are numbered 0-13, with the number showing how many werewolves the character on that card attracts, and each character (number) has a different special power.

On a turn, you draw the top card of the deck or discard pile, then either discard it to use the power of the card (but only if it came from the deck), discard it without using the power (ditto), or replace one or more of your face-down cards with this card; you can replace multiple cards only if they bear the same number, and you must reveal the cards to prove this, being penalized if you're wrong.

Silver Fang can be played as a standalone game or combined with other games in the Silver series by Bézier Games. Each version of the game has different card abilities and a different silver token ability.

Silver Fang is unique because it includes team rules and cards that while they work for individual player games, can be leveraged for team play. The Silver Fang token creates a personal discard pile that can only be accessed by the Fang owner, providing a place for them and their teammate to play cards that only the Fang owner can choose from.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Kinfire Council
description:
Kinfire Council is a competitive game of strategy and politics for 2-6 players. As a member of the Council, you've been charged with rebuilding the great city of Din'Lux and defending it from the dangers of the Starless Nights.

Take turns sending your workers to collect resources, upgrade buildings, and construct new Kinfire lighthouses in the surrounding area, while the Cult of Altan interferes with your plans and undermines your authority. You'll vote on important city policies, arrest cultists, and dispatch your Seeker to thwart threats looming over the final bastion of civilization — the great city of Din'Lux.

While you vie for power among yourselves, you also track the Cult's progress. If they win the game, then the Cult Conspirator ends up being the victor. Will you be a benevolent leader, working together with your fellow Council members, or will your plans take a more sinister turn?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Voting, Worker Placement

name: Floodlands
description:
Heavy rains have caused havoc throughout the region. As one of the apprentice cartographers, it is up to you to use incoming reports to create an updated map of the local infrastructure and landmarks.

The Council will surely reward the apprentice skilled enough to put together the most accurate map, contributing to better run aid efforts.

Floodlands is a roll and write where players draw land and water onto a map, as well as buildings and resources. Each turn players roll three dice. One tells them how much land and water they are drawing, while the total of the other two tell them what buildings or resources they can draw.

Once each players map is full scoring is done, and the player with the highest score is the rewarded cartographer.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid

name: Drop Drive: Limited Promo Pack (2021)
description:
The Death Dodecahedron has come to destroy planets!!

Tweaking the Big Bang stage of the game, players will find the Death Dodecahedron moving at the end of their turns towards the closest planet. If it gets too close, say goodbye to the planet, as all goods on it are spread around the cosmos. Players will find themselves rushing to fulfil their goals and possibly attack this new imposing threat to the Universe as, if the last planet is destroyed, it is game over with no winner.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Events, Push Your Luck, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: ONDA
description: In ONDA, players use cards from their hands to compose wave formations superior to those of their opponents according to the current tide. The goal is to be the first to play all the cards from their hands or try to have the fewest cards possible, as players lose points based on the cards left in their hands. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing

name: Monstererbe: Das Testament des Doktor F.
description:
This new Berlin-based publisher will be presenting Monstererbe – Das Testament des Doktor F (Monster Inheritance – the Will of Doctor F) by Michael Benkendorf.
The goal of the game is to awaken a monster and keep him alive. Here an atmospheric description:

The overlooked, unsuccessful and completely-forgotten-by-the-underworld Doctor F, nephew of a certain Frankenstein, has fruitlessly tried his entire life to follow in the footsteps of his famous uncle. Lonesome and bitter, he writes his last will and testament out one stormy night. He demands from his inheritors that they solve the task that he himself couldn’t: the creation of an artificial human being, often labeled a monster by more ignorant folk. Only he who solves this puzzle will be considered worthy of being awarded the enormous castle and the lands surrounding it. To assist them in their quest, each potential inheritor gets a corpse, a laboratory and the help of Igor.

Setting up the laboratory, finding organs, waking up the monster – it’s as easy as that. You only need to keep a hairsbreadth in front of the competition. Whoever wants to be the inheritor of Doctor F needs skill with trading and auctioning, a little luck with digging, bad weather, and naturally a brain – even better would be two or three.

The players try – with the help of Igor – to find the necessary vital organs as quickly as possible in the graveyard. But a lightning rod and a big switch are required.
And naturally tons and tons of green goo. The most important part is the brain, though. There’s quite a selection: Beethoven, Newton, Marx or maybe Jack the Ripper?
For protection, you can always hang a couple of shrunken heads and a stuffed crocodile in your lab. But what’s the use of all that if the weather’s sunny and devoid of lightning?
Then only James Watt’s mysterious atmospheric steam machine will help.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ancient Brass Dragon Premium Figure
description:
From the publisher:

This fantastic pre-painted premium figure stands several inches tall and towers over all of the other D&D Attack Wing expansion pack miniatures. The perfect encounter for your next adventure, or the perfect ally to your force. The D&D Attack Wing Brass Dragon Premium Figure is a beautiful display piece as well!

The D&D Attack Wing version of the Brass Dragon figure also comes with additional play materials such as Cards, Tokens, Maneuver Dials, and a 6” x 6” D&D Attack Wing base.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Elder Sign: Yog-Sothoth Promo Card
description:
A new, official, Yog-Sothoth Ancient One card given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 16–17 November 2013.

This Yog-Sothoth has a new "gate" symbol on its doom track. When a doom token is placed on a gate space, an Other World card is drawn, but then each investigator must discard a trophy or be devoured.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Modern Wonders (fan expansion for 7 Wonders)
description:
Modern Wonders is a fan print&play expansion for 7 Wonders. Created by and with cooperation of top ranked players from Boardgamearena.com ladder. This expansions aims to provide variety, while maintaining great balance. It uses some concepts from 7 Wonders Cities expansion. Regular update balance patches are scheduled to provide the best experience for the players.
Design & Development was done by 7 Wonders 2021 World Champion - Jan Zalewski.

Wonders included:

New York - Statue of Liberty
Agra - Taj Mahal
Oxford - Oxford University
Paris - Museum the Louvre
Rio de Janeiro - Christ the Redeemer (statue)
Timbuktu - Timbuktu
Moscow - Red Square


—description from the designer

This project is non-profit and it is strictly forbidden to profit of any kind based on this work.
Credits for art used:
Agra - Péter Kovács
Moscow - Nina Valinger
New York - Ray Weiler
Paris - Marc Mons
Oxford - Sofia da Silva
Rio De Janeiro - https://wallpaperaccess.com/christ-the-redeemer
Timbuktu - FRANCOIS XAVIER MARIT/AFP

Link to the printable file:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IVunX0ng2ObnPIVMZGyyYMUuO2y...
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Possessão Arcana
description:
Possessão Arcana ("Arcane Possession ") is a board game for 1 - 6 players, a Dungeon Crawler. And before you go defeat the enemies, you must first decide if you are prepared. A wide variety of demons invade the earth plane, from goblins to supreme lords of the underworld. It is up to you and your mates face these demons together and send back to hell.

But the Arcane Magic is wild and you can be corrupted. Be careful.

In Possessão Arcana, players will struggle with the demons, with magic, they need to find three magical artifacts, but it is not easy, the character has a Possession Arcana level, go to the maximum, the magician must fight with others, but if all artifacts are found, players will face Lord demon.

While exploring the city, a player rolls dice to calculate his attacks and defenses. He keeps check of his life, mana level and Posession Arcana. The demons are controlled by Artificial Intelligence through the Command and Aura cards.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: Cat Ladies of Maple St.
description:
Play as one of 4 quirky, competitive cat ladies.
Build your deck by collecting cards from the market
Use your cards to get the only thing that makes you truly happy... more cats!
The lady with the most cats wins the game!

There are two types of currency in the game, coins and hearts.

On a players turn, they use their hand of cards to play actions, buy cards with coins or adopt cats with accumulated hearts. Their newly purchased cards and cats are put into the players discard pile for use later. Once the pile of 29 cats has been depleted, the game ends immediately and the player with the most cats is the top cat lady!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Antlered Crown
description:
From the publisher:

Middle-earth and The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game are full of adventures, and your road goes ever, ever on. Sometimes, when the mood strikes you—or when your heroes take a wrong turn—you may see that road darken… and then darken again.

Nightmare Decks allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios recast within the darker and deadlier shadows of Nightmare Mode. Each Nightmare Deck introduces new encounter cards that you exchange with specified cards from the adventure's standard encounter deck. The result is a more challenging adventure that comes full of novel and thematic new twists.

Even after they recover Celebrimbor's ring mould, your heroes must continue along their quest, for they have many miles to travel before they can return the mould to Saruman in Orthanc. However, their journey is interrupted in The Antlered Crown when they come upon the battles between warring clans of Dunlendings. In order to successfully complete their task, then, your heroes must battle through waves of hostile Dunland enemies before they can establish a lasting alliance with the Dunlendings who swear their loyalty to Chief Turch.

As the conclusion of The Ring-maker cycle, The Antlered Crown focused heavily on the cycle's Time X keyword, using it to trigger a number of effects, including the reveal of enemy cards from the Raven deck that you create at the beginning of the scenario. The Antlered Crown Nightmare Deck reinforces this focus on the Time X keyword and the Raven deck, so that both of the scenario's signature elements are more challenging and impactful than ever.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Temple of Horrors
description:
A mighty artifact is hidden in a forgotten Temple.
An obscure spell makes it unreachable. The only way to break this arcane magic is to find the tombs of the Evil Champions, which rest in the Temple, evocate them and defeat all of them!
Find the Artifact and escape from the Temple before all Evil creatures dwelling there wake up!
Explore an ancient dungeon, avoid traps, kill monsters, challenge Bosses, grab treasures, gain Experience points, increase your character abilities.

Temple of Horrors is an innovative dungeon crawler game for 1-4 players, which lasts about 90 minutes, where typical Euro game mechanicals mix with the American style.

In ToH, players create the dungeon map directly, choosing which tile place from their available display when their Hero explores a new area. By creating large Rooms of the same type, players will increase their chances to find clues about the Artifact position. Placing or not, particular game Rooms, from Library to Trap Rooms, or Treasure, Healing, Monster Rooms, will determine their chance of survival.
Activating the Tombs Rooms, players will be able to fight mighty Bosses and find Clues. Combining Clues, they will discover the Artefact position, and if they will able to take it and escape from the Temple in time, they will win.
Escape? Not so easy! After entering the Temple, the Entrance collapsed. So players must find a secondary exit. Different in each game, an ancient Map will reveal the path they have to take to find it.
The game can last up to 14 rounds. In every round, the opponents will be stronger and more challenging to win.

You can play the game also in PvP mode. In this case, one or more hidden players will try secretly to win alone, distract the rest of the party on a false path, and grab the Artifact. This kind of game adds a lot of RPG aspects to the game.

Each Hero has their powers and abilities and can improve them during the game, gaining experience points, choosing how: by this way, each Hero is different in every game. Magic Items, potions, weapons will improve and differentiate each character more.

The Lost Artifact is one of the 100 different Adventures of the game! Each Adventure is playable multiple times by players, and each play will always be different!

Are you ready for the challenge?

“This game is my tribute to my wonderful Dungeons and Dragons game sessions. Enjoy it!” (M. Quondam).
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Flick 'em Up!: Giant Edition
description:
Move over! There's a new sheriff in town! Flick 'em Up! – Giant Edition more than doubles the scale from the classic dexterity game Flick 'em Up! Players will be able to relieve the great Western adventure on an epic scale!

Experienced Flick 'em Up! players will immediately recognize the same great gaming elements you're used to, but now on a larger scale! Both new and old players will immediately appreciate the greatly enhanced gameplay due to the larger play surface and components. Further, the components lend themselves to a more accurate representation of one's skill — the size of the pieces serve as a more natural extension for the player.

Flick 'em Up! – Giant Edition comes packaged in a gorgeous leather suitcase tailored to hold all the game's components.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game

name: Carroll County Cake Swap
description:
A card game for baking perfectionists and those who like to sabotage them.

Put on your apron and grab your mixing bowls as you vie for ribbons in the cake decorating contest at the Carroll County Fair. Create the tallest, most beautiful cakes by stacking layer upon layer of frosted sweetness. Will you go slow and steady to create a few cakes with extreme precision? Or rush to submit your cakes ahead of the competition? Draw or draft cards to build cakes up to five layers tall. Elbow your opponents to get the types of cake (chocolate or vanilla) and frosting flavors (five fruits, plus a wild) you need to win ribbons in six categories. Only one player may win each ribbon, so you’ll have to swipe, swap, and squeeze your way to victory. Some ribbons are worth more than others. Choose carefully which ones you go for in this race to outmaneuver other contestants.
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck

name: Mysthea: Volfyirion's threat
description:
The Dragon miniature of Volfyirion can be used both as an expansion for Mysthea and Mysthea: The Fall.

In MYSTHEA:
Its Monster Card is revealed from the first Era, while the Dragon Miniature is placed in the center of the map: this will prevent the Islands from moving.

If the storm card is played, Volfyirion moves towards the Island it is currently facing and attacks it.

During the dragon’s attack, all players are called upon to defense. It is up to each player to stand up to their nemesis or call a retreat and abandon the opponents to their fate!

If Volfyirion is not defeated, it will destroy everything on the unfortunate Island.

Only players who show their courage by facing and defeating Volfyirion are able to retrieve one of the five Qoam crystals placed at the base of the miniature. Crystals can be spent to boost the effects of the cards.

Champions located on the Island will be then cast out and Volfyirion will nest its lair in the Island. Until the end of the Era no type of unit is allowed to enter it.

At the beginning of the next Era the dragon will return to the middle of the five Islands, at the center of the game board, ready to attack again another island!


In MYSTHEA: THE FALL

Mysthea can be merged with Icaion to create Mysthea: The Fall, and Volfyirion has a crucial role in the final chapter of this saga

After The Fall, the balances of Icaion broke irreparably. Ancient forces unleashed from the crystals, wild energies that channeled through the Henakor and started to resonate everywhere. Summoned by these ancestral energies, Volfyirion flew to the Henakor blinded by this immense power.

The dreadful beast is making its growl heard in the depths of Icaion, calling every kind of creature toward the City and the crystal it surrounds.

Volfyirion miniature is placed in the center of the map and replaces the Colossus in this scenario.

Some rules will be different, and introduce a different challenge to the usual Mysthea: The Fall.

The final goal is to defeat the creatures that are destroying the City and obtain all Volfyirion's shards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Medang
description:
Have you ever thought of becoming the greatest builder of the 7th century's most important kingdom? Welcome to Medang, a Hindu-Buddhist civilisation from the Java island, where you'll have to lead one of its five major dynasties and build a temple.

You'll be part of the Samara, the Dharmasetu, the Dharanindra, the Panangkaran or the Rakai dynasty and battle to take control of the temple. Be smart and develop a good strategy because you'll have to collaborate to build the temple, but only the dynasty that places the most tiles will be declared the winner.

In turns, you'll place the tiles to build the temple, activating their special skills if you choose to. All the players will have access to a tile market to replace those that you use to build the temple.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Earth: Abundance
description: Earth: Abundance is an expansion for Earth that allows you to enhance the rich gameplay of that award-winning board game with new player interactions and opportunities to curate your hand.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Follow, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tags, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource
publishers: Inside Up Games, Lucky Duck Games

name: Battleship Captain
description:
From the publisher's webpage:

Battleship Captain is a simulation game depicting ship vs ship combat in the era of the battleship. The game covers warships produced in the pre-dreadnought (1890-1906), dreadnought (1906-1919), and World War II (1920-1945) eras, providing gamers the chance to replay a virtually unlimited number of historical or hypothetical scenarios occurring during the six decade "golden age" of the battleship.
What's Included: Over ONE THOUSAND individually rated warships (light cruiser size and larger) from over twenty of the world's navies, from the three eras represented in the game, on twenty-two counter sheets; 150 generic destroyer and merchant ship counters; 56-page comprehensive rulebook containing standard instructions applicable to each major period, plus separate chapters with "era specific" rules, Ship Rating Index, designer's notes, over thirty scenarios; scenario guidelines folder; over 300 color game markers and playing gauges; and three Reference Cards. This is a full, complete game... nothing else is needed to recreate surface combat over the entire period!
Battleship Captain is a "miniatures" game system with scenarios played on the tabletop or floor, using the rules and ship counters provided. (You may freely substitute metal miniatures if you wish.) The game emphasized playability, as players maneuver their ships and try to defeat the enemy. The counters (measuring 2.5" x 5/8ths inch) are printed in black ink on different colored cardstock, and need to be mounted and separated prior to play. Game scale is seven turns per hour, and 1000 yards per inch. Ships are rated, right on their counter, in the following categories: name, nationality, ship type, year, flotation, stern-broadside-bow fire ratings, movement, armor, and nine "special characteristics" ratings, plus an overhead scale view of the ship's deck.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Chute
description:
Chute is a board game for two players of approximately 25 minutes, which has two teams made up of different players from the "Chutemundo", a fictional world made up of different regions that compete with each other with their own unique players and abilities.

The game resembles a football match, which takes place over 9 rounds (aproximately 25 minutes total), which represent the 90 minutes of the football game, and the objective is to score more goals than the opponent.

With the different cards in your deck you can create combos and extraordinary plays, and use objects to build up and upgrade your team.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Down In Flames: Poland 1939
description:
Poland 1939 is an extension part/ module to the "Down In Flames"-Series - Volume 1: Rise of the Luftwaffe game by GMT. This module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr18.

The German invasion of Poland which began on September 1st, 1939 was the world's first demonstration of "Blitzkrieg", the "lightning war". The sudden onslaught stunned the Poles, who offered little resistance to the Germans' panzer divisions. The invaders quickly penetrated into the into the interior, reaching Warsaw in just over a week. The rapidity of the German troops advance was in large part due to support from the Luftwaffe. Under attack by both air and armor, the Polish army and air force slowly collapsed. On September 17th, 1939, the USSR attacked Poland, shattering the country's morale. The campaign was effectively over in just three weeks, long before France and Britain could fulfill their promises to come to the aid of Poland.

"Down in Flames" series is a card-driven game that simulate WW2 air combat.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Cherubion Stratégiai Gyűjtögetős Társasjáték
description:
An interesting cross between ccgs, rpgs and board games: the game contains a board, cardboard pawns, character cards, dice, cards, but the cards are different in each box. New decks of cards can be bought to increase the variety (in fact the recommended number of cards for a deck of one player is 60-80, but the box itself contains only 50 cards).

The game is set in the world of a series of Hungarian fantasy novels.

At the beginning of the game every player chooses a team of characters. There are cards with the characters' abilities. Then in his/her turn the player rolls two dice, the result is the amont of action points, which can be used to put the characters on the board, move them, draw new cards, or build some kind of energy plant. The energy given by the plants can be used to play cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: DeepWars
description:
GAME OVERVIEW

DeepWars is a 28mm scale tabletop wargame set in an alternate history of Earth in the late 17th century, where fortune seekers and conquerors have discovered a lost land with an underground sea miles beneath the frozen surface of the southernmost continent.

DeepWars is set in the world of ShadowSea, but is meant to be a stand-alone product and is focused on adventure and battle scenarios on the bottom of the Sunless Sea. The game will have multiple types of scenarios, including exploration of wrecks on the seafloor, adventures in ancient cities of cyclopean structures, battles among fields of geothermal chimneys, submarine boardings among others. Adventures within flooded tunnels inside wrecked ships or crumbing cities may be played with “tiles” to represent stretches of passage and chambers, while games in open environments are played with scenic terrain pieces on the tabletop.

OPPOSING FORCES

This shadowy sea holds powerful artifacts from a long disappeared civilization, and the Fortune Hunters' have staked their claim to these treasures, modifying some of the technology they have already recovered to design advanced diving suits and weapons for underwater defense. They are not alone in their quest though, as other forces compete for the same artifacts.

The enigmatic 'Dark Mariners', remnants of the noble lost civilization, have completely devolved, mixing their bloodline with the foulest of undersea life and twisted ether technology to create vicious biomechanical creatures. These forces cruise the depths, carried within monstrous vessels that resemble gigantic sea creatures, gathering artifacts to help them prepare for an assault on the surface lands.

The 'Ancients of Atalán' are the most advanced of all of the forces, for they are the last of the pure relatives of the lost civilization of the Ancients of the Shadow Sea. They are a small group, with a hidden undersea city many leagues away to the North, and have traveled under the ice to recover the technology of their lost kin follow them into the dimensional void.

Other forces will be included in the game, but the three main forces will be the focus of this Kickstarter project and will be the first ones to get miniatures.

GAME FEATURES

Intense combat in the abyssal depths of the Sea. Breach submarines, uncover undersea temples, and dodge torpedoes while recovering artifacts that hold the secrets of the ethereal void.
Combination of 28mm scale miniature tabletop wargame with campaign advancement and a role-playing flavor. Players may customize their warband with different weapons and ether technology items as they become more experienced in battle.
Miniature starter sets for each of three main forces, Fortune Hunters, Dark Mariners, and Ancients of Atalán will be produced. Sets will include five miniatures with stat cards and quickstart rules. Other forces are included in the rules and will be made into miniatures as funds permit.
Rulebooks will be available printed in full color or as downloadable PDFs, and will include multiple game scenarios and a painting guide. There will be a softcover version of the printed book, meant for retail store sale, and a hardcover version with some additional content for direct sale. If project goals are exceeded, we will produce additional miniatures, terrain and supplements and continue growing the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Alien vs Predator: Predator Young Bloods Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

Too young to be adult hunter, too old to not to try. Every Yautja needs to prove himself among other clan members as skilful fighter before can became respected warrior. Every Young Blood goes through same rite of passage - marking itself by acidic blood of killed Xenomorph. Many dies trying, but those who succeed are the ones recognised as equals by other clan members.

Straight from the Alien Versus Predator movie comes new squad of Predators. Each of them is different miniature and unique by design. Almost all are Single Pieced miniatures with no assembly required.

Box consists of:
3x resin miniatures
3x plastic bases
1x stat card
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Каркассон: Солове́й-Разбо́йник & Водяной
description:
Каркассон: Солове́й-Разбо́йник & Водяной (Solovei Razboynik and Vodyanoy) is a little semi-unofficial expansion (2 tiles) for Carcassonne, made by the Russian editor of the Carcassonne game (Hobby World) and was a present for the participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league 2016.

One tile represents Solovei Razboynik "Nightingale the robber" from the Russian folktale "Ilja Muromez". The second tile represents Vodyanoy, a kind of ghost, only living in water.

Solovei Razboynik
If followers occupy a Road that goes through the Solovei Razboynik tile (or they occupy Roads that are connected to that tile later on in the game), players must move them onto the tile. The followers then remain on the tile until the end of the game. In his turns, instead of placing his follower, the player may return 1 follower from the Solovei Razboynik tile into his supply.

Vodyanoy
When a player places this tile adjacent to one or more tiles on the board, all followers from the adjacent tiles are moved onto the Vodyanoy tile. Followers remain on that tile till the end of the game and get 2 points minus.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Peipus Lake 1242
description:
The game is about the battle at Peipus Lake, known as the "Battle on Ice", where armies of the Novogrod defeated the Teutonic Knights.

The game uses rules for the "Medieval" system, with classic "I Go - You Go" mechanics. Units are infantry and cavalry, light, medium and heavy, along with archers and leaders. Cavalry may charge to make their attack more devastating. Russians also have some mounted archer Tatar units.

Morale plays an important role in the mechanics - as the number of friendly losses increases, the stronger the enemy player attacks. Defeated units might be weakened, destroyed or disordered.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Small City around the world #1: Asian Cities
description:
Description from the publisher:

This is the first pack of expansion of Small City that takes place in real cities. It contains 8 Asian Cities with special twists:

Shanghai
Beijing
Seoul
Dehli
Bangkok
OulaanBaator
Tokyo
HongKong
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement

name: Table Battles: Gettysburg
description: This third expansion to the popular Table Battles series focuses its attention on a single day: 2 July 1863, the second day of the Battle of Gettysburg. Famous engagements from throughout the attack each get their own scenario - Little Round Top, the Wheatfield, the Peach Orchard, Cemetery Ridge, and Culp's Hill - while a final scenario zooms out for a "big picture" view of the whole thing. These battles were hard-fought, stubborn, and bloody affairs, often without any decisive result, ending only when both sides were too exhausted to fight any further. That's reflected here, and so it's significantly harder to get a decisive result, and you're more likely to see epic slugfests in which you win only because the other side collapsed an eye-blink sooner.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Shadows: Amsterdam – Tournament Promo Tile #2
description:
Promo tile for Shadows: Amsterdam distributed during tournaments.

Frontside depicting a team of 6 celebrating a victory.
Each team member has a shining golden medal and one member is holding the big trophy above his head.

Backside depicting the silhouette of a signpost and mailbox against the backdrop of a city with orange sky.

Tile can be shuffled in with the other tiles.
categories: Animals, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Party Game, Racing, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Destroy These Cards
description:
Destroy These Cards is a party game where every card features a different real-life challenge. Dare your friends (or the entire group) to do increasingly ridiculous challenges tasks, while trying to keep track of the challenges you’ve already accepted.

Mayhem unfolds as players start adding their own challenges to the deck. Get rewarded for creating good cards. Vote to get rid of the...not-so-good cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Medieval Magic Market
description:
Medieval Magic Market is a card game in which you will assume the role of an adventurous newcomer to the great Flanaghar Market. Your goal is to trade with the loot achieved in your adventures. You must use object cards, action, along with your character's ability to be the one who gets the most gold coins (represented on the object cards) at the end of the game.

During each round, players draw 2 cards and can play any number of Object cards, but only one of Action cards, if an Event card is drawn at the time of drawing cards, it is resolved immediately.

The object cards have different values of gold coins, but it is necessary to discard some of these during the game in order to make moves that grant more Object cards, hence more gold coins. So you should save some of these to score at the end of the game. The Action cards modify the dynamics of the player who plays them in favor of him. Event cards must be played before the start of the turn, they never remain in the player's hand, they modify the game of all the players involved. The players also have a character card with a respective ability in favor of these, In addition there is a card from The Market has Closed that is put into play after the third round and being stolen ends the game, then the points represented in gold coins that each player has in his hand.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Star Wars: Legion – Downed AT-ST Battlefield Expansion
description:
The Imperial All Terrain Scout Transport is a formidable war machine, cutting through Rebel lines as it stomps across the battlefields of the Galactic Civil War. Despite their appearance, however, these intimidating assault vehicles aren’t invincible. With the Downed AT-ST Battlefield Expansion, you can see find out firsthand what happens when one of these towering terrors comes crashing down.

This expansion deepens your immersion in the Star Wars galaxy with a beautifully sculpted downed AT-ST miniature that joins the fabric of the battlefield itself, providing valuable cover for your troops no matter what planet they find themselves on. Additionally, six new battle cards invite you to make your crashed AT-ST a focal point of a two part scenario, bringing even more variety to your games of Star Wars: Legion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Barbarossa Fast, Jun-Dec41
description:
FREE print-and-play VERY fast and family&friends simple/introductory point-to-point game of the Nazi German invasion of Soviet Russia, plays in 40-50 minutes.

Designed as a solitaire game, but as good if not better with live Russian player. Large, 3 (army group) player team 3-piece map table size or small single player(s) 11x17/A3 map (and smaller pieces) "travel" size - with single-sided pieces, VERY easy to assemble.

The base map is the *actual* OberKommando Heeres (OKH) campaign planning map (albeit the 1943-44 edition with corrections made) in the public domain on Ft. Leavenworth's Command and General Staff School's Combined Arms Research Library's Digital Library for anyone to see/use.

7 monthly turns. 6+2 German armies, 10+1 panzerkorps, and the 3 Luftflotten. No peripheral Finnish or Rumanian fronts/forces (so Odessa is left out).

Similar to my more detailed wargame Robot Barbarossa: From the 48 Strong and Weak Russian units, 3 groups - Strong, Medium/"Historical," and Weak - are pre-sorted and only 2 of these unknown groups are selected and mixed. At end of game, compensation victory points are adjusted up or down for the arrays having been found to be Weak or Strong.

OR you can use the un-presorted free Bell Curve selection which usually (as with bell curves) comes out to the average/"historical" but can instead go to extreme extremes!

2 "Siberians" arrive later, and risk arriving sooner than December if Moscow is too threatened too soon.

Has hidden Russian individual and overall strengths with just Strong (1-factor) and Weak units - no armor vs. infantry combat arms differentiation.

Ground combat is (for simplicity and playing speed) DICE-LESS - the unknown units factor giving unpredictability, strategically as well as tactically.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – A Crimson Offering
description:
Dire circumstances have gripped the Emerald Empire, pushing every Great Clan to make desperate choices… and perhaps to call upon dark powers better left alone. Mahō blood magic offers powers for those willing to embrace it—powers that can bring you victory in the struggles for dominance between the clans. But what will you sacrifice to claim this power, and can it possibly be worth the price you pay?

As the Temptations cycle continues with A Crimson Offering, the third Dynasty Pack in the Temptations cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, every Great Clan is pushed to make more difficult choices with the cards that they receive. The new dire keyword rewards you for walking the line of impermanence, granting your characters powerful new abilities that activate when the character has no fate remaining on it. And like the clans of Rokugan, you’ll face the temptation to include powerful mahō cards in your deck, using blood magic to gain any advantage over your opponent.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Tukdatu: Wer überlebt den Dschungel?
description:
Tukdatu is a funny and gripping card game in which the players use clever tactics to collect treasures and fight dangerous creatures. The opponents slip into the role of tourist Tiffany, adventurer Banana Bones or researcher Prof. Dr. Whity. Only those who have enough equipment or who get off in time will survive the expedition.

In this exciting and funny card game, the players become part of this extraordinary group. Only a few items of equipment and the special abilities of the individual characters are available for fighting dangerous living beings. Only those who plan cleverly or get out in good time have a chance of surviving the expedition and collecting treasures on top of that.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: CATAN: Das Duell – Die Big Box
description: CATAN: Das Duell – Die Big Box contains the CATAN: Das Duell base game, the Finstere & Goldene Zeiten ("Dark & Golden Times") expansion, and the Zusatzmaterial für Das Duell – Bonus Box extra material.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Kreta: Operation Merkur
description:
A Battle Study on the German Invasion of Crete

KRETA contains:

* Huge Color 56"x40" Historical Map featuring Maleme battle area, drawn by Tom Repetti
* 120 full color counters
* Chapter OM, that includes rules for new units, terrain types and weapons notes
* Historical Campaign Game
* 7 Historical Map Scenarios
* 10 Geomorphic Map Scenarios
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Myrmex
description:
An ant colony is a place of feverish activity, where workers endlessly toil for the greater good of the superorganism. You are a worker ant, constantly moving detritus and foodstuffs from chamber to chamber. The problem is that other workers are bringing in more goods faster than you can sort out the old stuff! At the end of the day, the best that you can hope for is a chance to do it all over again tomorrow.

Myrmex is an olde style solitaire game for the Decktet. Two Decktets are required to play. The object of the game is to organize all of the cards into 6 piles that share a single suit and are in descending rank order from Crown to Ace.

Myrmex is an engaging and utterly addictive Spider solitaire experience. Don’t play this game if you have something important to do today.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Saladin: The Fall of the Crusader States
description:
Saladin: The fall of the Crusader States is a strategic game on the first crisis of the Crusader States and of Saladin’s rise to glory.

Choose your path and history will deal its judgement to you. Take command of the famous Templar and Hospitaller Knights, the loyal Ghulams and fierce Turcoman Horsemen, the agile Nubian Archers or the notorious Varangian Guardsmen of Byzantium. Fight on the high seas for the Oriental trade with Venetian Galletas, Byzantine Dromons or Egyptian Dhaus. Supply your castles, lay or break sieges or find traitors in the walls. Subjugate the infamous Assassins, convince the Pope or Khalif to support your cause, or bribe greedy tribes to raid your enemies.

Saladin is a game for 2 to 5 players - but best played with 5 - roughly recreating the course of events in the Holy Land and its neighboring areas between the death of the great Zangid ruler Nur-al-Din in 1174 heralding Saladin’s further rise to power and the battle of Hattin in 1187, which resulted in the conquest of Jerusalem by Saladin. Even though prompting the popular 3rd Crusade (1190) - with such prominent figures as the English King Richard I «The Lionheart», the French King Phillip II «Auguste» and the German Emperor Friedrich I «Barbarossa» taking the stage - the preceding events culminating in the Crusader’s loss of Jerusalem were arguably the effective begin of the final decline of the Crusader States.

The graphic design is by Jordi Roca and almost all the artwork by Esteve Polls.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fistful of Lead
description:
A quick play set of Wild West skirmish rules.

The game is designed for fast play, with no record keeping, other than wound and out of ammo markers. When players move is handled by an easy, random card system. Required to play: miniatures, 10-sided dice, a tape measure and a deck of playing cards. This game allows for fast and easy play, players can easily use more than one miniature.

The Fistful of Lead rules has been updated and re-released as Print-n-Play.
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=756

Reimplemented by Fistful of Lead: Reloaded.
categories: American West, Book, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement

name: Mixtapes
description:
Descriptio from the designer:

Producing a mixtape is always creating a new universe, full of memories, friendships, and good vibes. In the game, we are recording our precious k7 tapes, the result of a long wait for the exact moment when that particular song will play on the radio.
Record your favorite songs, create a perfect sequence to give as a gift to someone important to you, conquer a new love or liven up that long-awaited party with the hits of the moment.
The object of the game is to record three mixtapes. For this, you will use your recording device to perform actions that allow you to create these music collections in the best possible way. Whoever has the best mixtapes at the end of the match will be declared the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Clear for Action
description:
World War II Micronaval Miniature Gaming. Uses 1:1200 or 1:2400 scale ship miniatures.
Game Designer: Spencer Martin
Ship Data Charts: John Hugener

Game uses charts for ship classes and detailed damage locations.

Players write orders for movement on paper records as well as for firing guns on targets and estimate ranges (guestimation).

After all players have written orders, orders are carried out by moving the ships as indicated on the orders. Torpedo launches are resolved and gunfire is resolved.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Dawn of Worlds
description: Dawn of Worlds is a game where a group of players take the role of gods creating a fantasy world. The game begins with a basic map drawn on a large piece of paper and one player is assigned to record the changes to the map as the game progresses. Each turn players roll dice to gain points and spend those points to alter the landscape, make creatures or order those creatures to take actions such as build cities or armies. The game moves through three phases where the costs of various actions change, encouraging players to first create a landscape, then populate it, then order the creatures.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Lexicons of Dueling
description:
Lexicons of Dueling is fast to learn, fast to play, and has hundreds of possible variations to the outcome of a battle! The cards are very easy to understand. The tactics are not just in the cards, it involves you learning your opponent’s style, the way they are thinking, and trying to figure out their next move! While they do the same to you! Each card has defense/attack/body positioning and weapon flow represented in such a way that you could even imagine the actions you are performing as you play.

Game Features:

NOT a collectible card game. There are no perfect combos other than the ones your opponent didn't block. There are no super rare cards that will imbalance the game to those who can afford them. Every player has an equal chance to win, if they keep their wits about them, or get the opponent to lose theirs.
Status cards that can increase your chance of victory, but not to the degree that a peasant cannot still best a king, if he plays his cards right. Anybody can win against anybody.
Simple! Addition and subtraction rules; no tokens, no paper, no life counter, no phases, no arguing rules. The deck is all you need to play..... and an opponent. That will help a lot. You can practice with a single deck random solitaire if you want, but it is much more challenging with a thinking opponent.
Tournament Play. They all have them, but not all of them will have the flavor of ours. You fight to gain status, from peasant, squire to knight, and so on. As you win you can fight well in higher status tournaments, and one day, maybe fight for the title of King! There are several characters that you can collect during the tournaments, and each of them can become royalty if you succeed!


As a fighter learns he gets better, as they win they gain status in the society they live in. Each status upgrade gives the player an extra skill to survive battles at higher ranks. They can always fight higher ranks than they are, but they can expect to have more of a challenge. They can fight lesser ranks, but they will receive a lesser reward for fighting below their station. The skills fit the rank: a Squire learns to move quickly so gains a dodge. A Knight learns the use of armor for a time, etc. Status cards represent goals and bragging rights you can prove you earned, and skills learned from battle.

This game includes the following expansions;
- French Rapier
- Two handed Scottish Claymore
- (Introducing) Japanese Katana
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Munchkin: Playmat – Flower Cashes In
description: Munchkin Playmat: Flower Cashes In is a 28"×14" playmat that showcases Flower atop a pile of freshly looted items. It includes spots to keep track of your Class, Race, level, and all your monster-slaying gear, and it features an in-game bonus that gives you extra gold when you sell items each turn...but not forever.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Pug Party
description:
This is a fast, fun and addictive card game

Main Goal: you need to discard all your cards as soon as possible. Loses the one who has the cards on hand.

Game Setup: Shuffle your deck thoroughly and deal three face-down cards in a row to each player. Then deal the same number of cards face up to cover each card that is laying face-down. Now you have six cards before each player: three face-down and three face-up covering them.

You shouldn’t pick that cards up until you shed all the cards from your hand.

Deal each player three cards one more time, that will be player's hands. Place the deck of cards on the table within reach of every player.

Gameplay: the starting player is the one who attended a party recently, closer to the day of the game then other players. Then players are taking turns clockwise. The player lays any card on the table (to start a pick up pile) and then draws card from the deck so they have at least three cards in their hand (unless the deck has run out of cards or they already have three or more cards in their hand). The next player must lay a card equal to or higher in value than the one at the top of the pick up pile. For example: the first player lays 5, the next player can lay 5, or 6, 7, 8, 9, 10. On top of 10 player can lay 10 or 0 (the Poop) or any of the special cards. If a player has no card to cover the the previous card, they must pick up the pick-up pile (put it in their hand) and end their turn, and the next player starts a new round with any card.

A player can lay some cards of the same value in one turn. If a player is able to complete a set in turn (like four-of-a-kind 8*8*8*8) they can do so clearing (burning) and removing the entire pile from play. The player who clears may play another card after.
Special cards (could be placed over any other card):

MegaPug - when played, clears the pick up pile instantly. The player who plays it starts the next round with any card, game is played to increase (the next card may have same or higher value)

BreakDancer - changes the rules from increase to decrease (so the next card may have same or lower value). When played the second time, rules changes back from decrease to increase, and so on.

Poop (0) - resets the game. The next player can lay a card of any value from 0 to 10, game is played to increase.

Game Ending: when the deck runs out, you must play all cards from your hand. When there’s no cards in your hand, you have to play those cards that are laying the face-up in front of you, one by one. Then you play your “Blind” cards, that are laying face-down, one by one - no peeking!
If you have no suitable card - take the pick-up pile in your hand and only when you shed them all you can return to play your cards on the table.

When you have discarded all your cards - congratulations! You banished all your Pug-party animals! So you can chill out watching yours less lucky playmates.

The Pug Party is an entertaining game designed for players from 6 years old. Duration: 10-30 minutes. Simple rules, a dynamic game process, illustrations of a talented artist of Ukraine – this is the formula for the success of the game Pug Party. The first edition of the game was sold out for six months. Because everyone loves funny parties and everyone loves pugs: children, youth and adults are just delighted with these funny little animals. We take an incendiary party, add cute pugs, and get the most explosive and cutest Ukrainian game!
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – The Banshee
description:
Banshee (from Village Attacks, in collaboration with Grimlord Games) adds a reimagined Banshee, a Wind Witch to the game!

This mini-expansion to Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum comes with a Banshee Witch miniature, Witch ID card, Grimoire, 3 Witchcraft Spells, and bonus Creature ID Cards and Summoning cards for Leshy, Wendigo and the Succubus from Village Attacks.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Железници
description:
Players take the roles of entrepreneurs in recently liberated Bulgaria.
At the turn of the 20th century, the knyaz and the government are unanimous that the path to the country's prosperity goes through the construction of a modern railway by the European model.
Adventurers from all over the country are joining the race to build new tracks.
Only one player will achieve the greatest success and become a true ruler of the railway industry!
Take over the management of your company - participate in project tenders, organize your workers, build railway lines and accumulate profits to achieve a glamorous victory.

The game uses a rondel mechanism where you can select one of several actions:

Build
Auction
Profit
Market
Draft/Move


There are three resources used to build railway tracks:

Steel
Dynamite
Money


Players also have a "Respect" rating. Higher respect gives a player better market prices for steel and dynamite, while actions that lose you respect will usually net you immediate short term profits.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Rondel

name: Desert Storm: The Hundred Hour War
description:
A comprehensive simulation of Operation Desert Storm based upon newly declassified archives of the 1991 Gulf War.

Desert Storm: The Hundred Hour War simulates the 1991 Persian Gulf War as a military conflict and also as a political contest prior to and during Operation Desert Storm. Better yet, the rules allow alternative Iraqi strategies that may have theoretically disrupted the Coalition invasion, but similarly allows for alternative Coalition strategies..which includes the possibility of a Coalition advance to Baghdad to remove Saddam Hussein from power. Highly researched and accurate, this game is a complete presentation of the Persian Gulf War on the land, in the air, and sea.

The victory conditions are to achieve a military, political, and diplomatic victory, which is recorded on a map track called the Event Track. Players accomplish this by capturing and/or bombing map objectives, defeating enemy forces, and the skillful play of various event cards throughout the game. The Coalition player can either attempt the historic victory, or even attempt to drive straight to Baghdad and win that way, but fraught with all the difficulties of a longer war.

Game play information:
A two-player game
Easy to learn rules
2 to 4 hours to play
Moderately solitaire
Division scale units
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Dixit Cérémonie
description:
A special adaptation of Dixit, winner of the 2009 As d’Or Game of the Year award. Unique and limited edition of 4900 copies, sold exclusively on the occasion of the Cannes International Game Festival 2024.

—description from the back of the box

The game is a standalone version of Dixit, utilising standard rules. It can also be used as an expansion due to the unique card art. All 84 cards use art from well known table top game covers, and also has unique rabbit meeples for scoring. The voting dials and score track are included as normal.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Tragedy Looper Script Collection
description:
User summary:

A script collection for "Tragedy Looper", from a script creation competition held by Bakafire. Only three scripts are by Bakafire, the rest by competition participants. It contains 30 scripts, and 2 expansion characters, the Illusionist and the Scientist.

The scripts in the collection are for different tragedy sets:

4 scripts are for the First Steps Tragedy set (from the base box)
16 scripts are for the the Basic Tragedy set (from the base box)
8 scripts are for the Mystery Circle Tragedy set (released separately)
2 scripts are for the Haunted Stage Tragedy set (released separately)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer Quest: Shadows Over Hammerhal – Return to Hammerhal
description: A mini-expansion that comprises a story-arc spanning three additional dungeons set in the city of Hammerhal. Includes new Treasure cards, Skill cards, and an Achievement card. Also includes new options for adventurers visiting the city between delves (with an updated options summary card), rules for hiring mercenaries, and two new Hero Cards. Initial dungeon, rules, and cards, featured in the December 2017 issue of White Dwarf.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: Expansion Collection
description:
A compilation of previously released expansions for Ugly Gryphon Inn:


Ugly Gryphon Inn: More Patrons
Ugly Gryphon Inn: Local Dragons
Ugly Gryphon Inn: Innployees
Ugly Gryphon Inn: The Little Beak Guesthouse
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Chaining, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dos Equis Scenario Pack
description:
Advanced Squad Leader scenarios, produced by the Texas ASL Club as part of the 20th Anniversary edition of the Texas Team Tournament held this past June in Austin, Texas.

The scenario pack also goes by the name “Dos Equis XX Scenarios Especial” as shown on the front cover of the scenario pack.

The 20th Anniversary Scenario Pack contains 10 brand new scenarios designed for play with MMP’s Advanced Squad Leader game system, and is a limited production item. It contains the following scenarios:

TX1: Beware the Hare: 10 May 1944, Pugacheny, Romania. Designer: Pete Shelling

TX2: Last Gasp of the Wacht Am Rhein!: 1 January 1945, 30km North of the Ardennes. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX3: Ruined in a Day: 19 November 1942, NNW of Stalingrad. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX4: Corporal Punishment: 7 February 1943, Kharkov, Russia. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX5: Rush Hour: 2 September 1944, Martincourt, France. Designer: Mike Seningen

TX6: Tough Enough: 2 May 1944, Facuti, Romania. Designer: Pete Shelling

TX7: Hit and Run: 6 August 1944, South of Baranov, Poland. Designer: Dan Preston

TX8: House of Cards: 14 April 1945, Grünewalde, Germany. Designer: Dan Preston

TX9: Hell Freezes Over: 14 December 1941, Panovo, Russia. Designer: Dan Preston

TX10: The Middle of Nowhere: 6 March 1943, North of Losovaya, Russia. Designer: Dan Preston
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Raid Boss
description:
Tyr is a fickle god, creating in his image and then forsaking his children when their reflection does not paint him favorably. Among all of the creators, Tyr’s universe is the most volatile, competitive, and in turn, the most interesting. The other divinities searched and have found a way to hide from Tyr’s Judge, each leaving small traces of themselves in his world. This has not gone unnoticed; Tyr allows their interference to enhance his Trials and test the mettle of his creations. Savor your favor, it may not last long.
Raid Boss: Incarnate is a 4-player cooperative boss battle designed to feel like an MMORPG dungeon encounter with all of the teamwork, strategy, and collaboration, but none of the endless grinding!

You control a Hero with a mechanically distinct and heavily themed set of abilities. Each Hero has an Assist that can be used at ANY time -- including other players’ turns! Gather your team to face off against stalwart, quirky, and skill-testing Bosses that come equipped with their own special deck of cards.
Raid Boss has flexibility that allows you to devise incredibly clever skill sequences. Game-ending threats soon become trivial as you experiment and gain experience, allowing you to tackle devious and puzzle-like advanced Bosses.

There are 12 Heroes and 6 Bosses, each lavishly illustrated, giving you a wealth of content and variety of challenges.

—description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: Fury – World War II Tank Combat
description:
Fury is your introduction to the exciting world of Flames Of War, the world’s most popular World War II miniatures game.

Lead your tanks in furious combat.
Use speed and terrain to hit the enemy in their weaker flanks, or trust to your thick front armour and big gun to blow them away.
Pit your wits and skill, and the guns and armour of your tanks, against your opponent in this introduction to Flames Of War, the world’s most popular World War II miniatures game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Game of Energy
description:
In just a few years, the world will be plunged into turmoil. Countries around the world will panic, widespread chaos will ensue, and civilized society will change virtually overnight as citizens cope with the loss of a modern-day vital resource.
