A resource needed for commerce. A resource needed for communication. A resource needed for life-sustaining technology. A resource needed for even simple comfort. The resource… is energy.

But that time is not here yet! Thankfully, you and a handful of other enterprising individuals have seen the writing on the wall, and you know it is up to you to save the world from the upcoming energy crisis! Of course, the recent United Nations Contract request for a global energy provider worth BILLIONS of dollars doesn’t hurt, either…

Compete with other players to win the contract and ensure that your company will become the #1 global energy power for decades to come! Obtain government industry permits by using energy credits allotted by the United Nations Council for aligning yourself to their objectives. Industries you own constantly increase the energy credits you are allotted, but they also increase the terawatt-hours (energy) generated by your company! And it is ultimately out-performing your opponents in this area and hitting the optimal level of terawatt-hours that will win you the U.N. contract, and win you the game!


Each player must make optimum use of their resources and the available hexagonal areas on the board to not only achieve a victory with generating enough terawatt-hours (TWh), but must also generate more TWh than their fellow players. In every round of play, each player will take a single turn. During this turn, you will draw a card, be “paid” in energy credits, allowed to roll the territory die, and either permit industries or take an investment beforehand. If you ever wish to end your turn early, you may draw another grid card. This will end your turn without taking further action. Your choices in actions determine your odds of victory here!

When drawing a grid card, keep it secret, as it can be your secret weapon against your fellow players! Place them face-down in front of you to play later, or play them immediately.

Because you get paid every turn, try to maximize your energy credit return early on in the game so that you can permit multiple, higher TWh industries quicker by amassing enough energy credits. Of course, as you’ll see when you play the game, this plan can be easier said than done!

For an added twist, each player has a unique and special ability with which they can use during the course of the game. This ability is granted by the Captain of Industry card each player selected at the beginning of the game. Use your ability to your advantage and out-maneuver your opponents! Only one player can win the United Nations Contract!

And if you optionally play with the countdown die, you’ll not only be racing other players, but racing time as well… This also makes solo play possible!

When a player reaches the TWh threshold, the current round of play is finished, and the player generating the most TWh wins Game of Energy!
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 1: Goons and Guns
description: The Goons and Guns expansion brings you 5 more drivers, a completely new mechanic of Sidekicks, 10 unique goons to hire as well as a heck load of new weapons including sonic weapons, a host of murder tools with new unique Status Effects like Net and Buildup, as well as a completely unique class of weapons with the Glitch mechanic!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Skytear Horde: Nupten Illusionists & Utsesh Horde
description:
These 2 expansions are a leftover from the Kickstarter. They include:

40 alliance cards, a pre-made Nupen deck all about slowing down the game while you collect the mentalist cards you need to unlock a game-changing combo.
4 horde cards for the common set (Secret Passage, Raise the Dead, Utseshi Swarm, Onikai Legion) that you can mix with the 4 commons from the base box.
21 horde cards, the Nightmares deck made of Mythical monsters such as harpies, golems, and chimaeras. These beasts are able to paralyze entire armies before the terrible arrival of the Utsesh outsider.
6 outsider cards, The Dreaming Mathriarc, the Ancient Outsider, the Silent Ambassador.
4 additional heroes, one per faction: Akimo, Shaidrus, Vorhild, Ixatosk.
2 castles: the Cloud Gate and The Executioner’s Den, respectively for Akhuti and Haburat, the 2 heroes included in the pre-made deck.

-description from publisher's website

This expansion includes two new pre-made decks:

- Nupten Illusionists (Alliance deck) are assassins, rogues and mentalists able to impose their mind over matter, somehow bending parts of reality to their will. Arrogant beyond imagination, they have been the last faction to join the Alliance against the Horde.

- The horde from Utsesh (Horde deck) is made of mythical monsters such as harpies, golems and chimaeras. The few that survived the horde say these beasts are able to paralyze entire armies before the terrible arrival of the Utsesh Outsider, The Mother Sphynx.

This exclusive pack of cards was available during the Kickstarter campaing as part of the Deluxe Pledge and includes "Utsesh Horde Expansion" and "Nupten Illusionists Expansion". It was later made available together on the publisher's website

All decks can be mixed with those included in the retail box to provide additional combinations and customization.

-user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Toğızqumalaq
description:
A game of the mancala family.

Тоғызқұмалақ (toğızqumalaq, sometimes spelled toghyzqumalaq or togyzqumalaq or toguz kumalak, "nine balls") is the Kazakh name of a mancala game also known as toguz korgool in Kyrgyz.
It is played traditionally in Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, parts of Russia (Altay, Khakassia, Tuva), Western Mongolia and in China in regions close to the aforementioned countries.
There are regular toğızqumalaq championships held in Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan and Russia. The first western tournament was in August 2006 at the Mindsports Olympiad (MSO) in London, England. It was won by Aidos Seitzhanov from Kazakhstan.

Rules:

Toğızqumalaq is played board made of two rows of nine holes, plus two kazans ("boilers"), either in the middle of the board or one at each end of it. The players own the kazan at their right, if at the ends, or the one on the other half of their board, if in the middle.
As captures are made by pairs, the holes are usually made in a way so it is evident whether the contents are odd or even.
To begin the game, there must be nine balls per hole, except the kazans, which are empty. That is, 162 balls are needed.

On his turn, a player takes all the balls of a hole on his side of the board, and distribute them anticlockwise, one per hole, on the following holes, starting from the very same hole he has taken them. If the movement is done from a hole containing just a single ball, it is moved to the next hole, leaving the starting hole empty.

If the last ball falls into a hole on the opponent's side…

…and this hole afterward contains an even number of balls, these are captured and stored on the player's kazan.
…and this hole afterward contains precisely three balls, the hole becomes your тұздық, tuzdyq (or түз үй according to Maksat Shotayev, tüz üy, i.e. "sacred place" in Kazakh; or tuz in Kyrgyz which means "salt"), and it is marked as such. ** Each player can only make one tuzdyq in a game.
A tuzdyq cannot be made on the opponent's last hole (ninth, the one on his right).
A tuzdyq cannot be made if it is symmetrical to the opponent's one (if the opponent has his tuzdyq in our first hole, we can not make ours on his first hole).
In the cases a tuzdyq cannot be done, we can finish a movement there, but the hole simply does not become a tuzdyq.
A movement cannot begin from a tuzdyq.
The balls that fall into a tuzdyq are captured by its owner. If it is overcharged, we can take the balls and store them in the kazan.



The game ends when a player cannot move on his turn, because all the holes on his side (except a possible tuzdyq) are empty.
When the game is over, the player who still has balls on his side (except in a possible tuzdyq) gets them and adds them to his kazan.
Both players add the contents of their tuzdyq (the one on their opponent's side) to their kazan.

The winner is the player with more balls in his kazan at the end of the game. If both players have captured 81 balls, the game is a draw.
mechanics: Mancala

name: Formula Dé: Lime Rock Park
description: This is a fan made expansion course for Formula De based on the Connecticut race track of the same name. The files for this track can be found in the file section of Formula De here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/43068.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Konja: Tree Wizard
description: Konja: Tree Wizard is a mini-expansion for the Konja, that includes components for a three-player game, including 3 starting relics for a third player, a rules-of-play card and 2 stickers with alternate Favour and Blessing effects that can be adhered to the reverse side of two of the Ancestor tiles.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: District Commander Kandahar
description:
District Commander: Kandahar simulates the problems facing insurgent and counterinsurgent commanders in southern Afghanistan circa 2009-2010. This is not Brian Train's first or even second game about this conflict, and you might be wondering, what does this one have to offer? We think that the District Commander system - with its emphasis on bluff and deception, scarce resources and shifting operational goals - is an especially good fit for capturing the pace and nature of operations in Afghanistan.

Brian Train's District Commander is a series of operational games on counterinsurgency situations. The players alternate activation of groups of units (stacks) to perform discrete operations (missions) through the expenditure of Task Points (TP). Some missions are Tactical Missions - straightforward military tasks such as performing patrols, ambushing or attacking enemy forces, or moving from one place to another - and these may be performed multiple times by a stack during a turn. Other missions emphasize the "non-tactical" end of the campaign, establishing friendly influence, control, and infrastructure in an area, reducing the enemy's claim to the same, and recruiting or training troops. These missions take more time to perform and so unlike the tactical missions may be the only mission performed by the stack during the turn.

Missions are resolved by play of secretly-held Chance Chits, each with ratings that are better or worse for certain types of operations. Chits are played simultaneously and the ratings compared, modified by units, assets, and the current board state to determine the outcome. Using the right chit at the right time - knowing when to save a good chit for later and when to use it, and trying to determine if your opponent is going all-in or holding back - will require steely judgment in an atmosphere of doubt and deception.

All this is done in pursuit of objectives handed down to you by your superiors (i.e., chosen randomly) and kept secret from your opponent - objectives that may even change over the course of the game. Within this framework, the two sides - Government and Insurgent - play very differently, with the Insurgent player, in particular, depending on bluff and deception to achieve their goals. A large number of variant rules allow you to turn the game into a sandbox for exploring counterinsurgency doctrine and practice.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Events, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Chocim. Potęga Husarii
description:
"Chocim. Potęga Husarii" (Chocim. The might of the Hussars) is a wargame for 2 players, focusing on the epic battle of Chocim, fought in 1621 between the forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and of the Ottoman Empire.

The struggle lasting several weeks and consisting both of pitched battles, as well as of skirmishes and siege actions ended in a stalemate and to a truce. The besieged Polish-Lithuanian forces prevailed and managed to stop a further Ottoman expansion North.

One of the players will take control of the more numerous Ottoman forces and his objective will be to break through the Polish fortifications and take control of the main Polish encampment.

The player controlling the Commonwealth forces will be defending his fortress at all costs at the same time trying to bring down enemy morale to a level at which it will refuse to keep on fighting.

If neither side achieves their objective on the battlefield before the end of the 5th turn the game is decided upon a diplomatic clash when both players will use their diplomacy assets acquired throughout the game.
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Sudden Death Ending, Worker Placement

name: Attacktica
description:
Attacktica is a two player abstract strategy game with dice to show you how to move.
Each player has 4 ships with 20 life points with maximum 6 life points per ship.
There are 2 sea monsters which are used from both sides.


Life points are divided up to each ship, the life points are not visible from the opponent.
Two dice per player, dice one; is for which ship or sea monster is to move and dice two; is for the amount of moves or life points to be taken, depending if it is stage one or stage two of the game.
Stage One; One ship must reach the opponents start port to declare war.
Stage Two, when two opposite ships are aligned, battle can commence.
The two sea monsters play a big role in the game, they can obstruct ships, they can give moves and they can give and take life points, depending on the dice.
The winner is the player with the last ship/ships in the play arena.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ankh: Gods of Egypt – Enigma Sphinx Promo Card
description: A new alternate guardian card for Ankh, "Enigma Sphinx" (instead of Androsphinx), first available through the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Sealed Bid, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Race, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Schnapp die Möpse: Rainbow Wars Erweiterung
description:
Rainbow Wars is the first expansion for the card game Schnapp die Möpse and consists of 54 Game Cards of which 39 are beautifully illustrated.

This expansion you not only get well known action cards but a lot of new aggressor and defense cards along with new "No"-Cards, which help to save your hand against attackers.
You get new "addional cards" which help to play two cards oder make a normal card impenetrable against deactivation.

Really helpful is a new reaction card which allows you to tell a player to play a no-card for you.

In Rainbow Wars we get a common enemy in form of a rainbow cat which is able to steal the unicorm pugs. Distract it with laser pointers or defeat it with the unicorn pug.

Play with up to 7 players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Rainbow Wars ist die erste Erweiterung für das Kartenspiel Schnapp die Möpse und besteht aus 54 Spielkarten, wovon 39 Spielkarten mit schönen neuen Illustrationen ausgeschmückt wurden.

Die Erweiterung zum Grund-Kartenspiel bietet neben einigen wenigen bekannten, eine Menge toller neuer Aktionskarten, mit denen man noch mehr Angriffs-, sowie Verteidigungsmöglichkeiten erhält.
Neben einer neuen "Nein-Karte", gibt es auch diverse Zusatzkarten mit denen man unter anderem gleich 2 Aktionskarten spielen darf, einen Mops mit einem weiteren Mopspunkt ausstatten oder sogar eine Aktionskarte durchboxen kann, damit sie gar nicht erst mit einer Nein-Karte aufgehoben werden darf.

Sehr hilfreich ist eine neue Reaktionskarte mit der man einen beliebigen Möpsemopser dazu zwingen kann eine Nein-Karte zu spielen. Natürlich geht dies nur, wenn er eine zum Ausspielen besitzt.

In Rainbow Wars kommt ein gemeinsamer Gegner ins Spiel: Die Regenbogen Katze. Lenke sie mit Laserpointern ab oder besiege sie mit dem Einhornmops.

Nun kann auch mit bis zu 7 Spielern gespielt werden.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Take That, Tug of War

name: Pub Battles: Gettysburg – Shall I Advance?
description:
The Union desperately fights to stop Robert E Lee in this tense board game on the pivotal battle of the Civil War at Gettysburg.

Patterned and modeled on Kriegsspiel, this game is unprecedented in accuracy and realism in its portrayal of command.

Units realistically sprawl out in road column, resulting in delays, snaking and traffic snarls. Baggage Trains add to the traffic and congestion problems. They have to be protected but also need to be kept close to the action to properly supply the troops. Realistic, chaotic move sequence. Your troops don’t move when you want them to. You don’t know when exactly when your troops or the enemy will move. As the commander, you can only try to speed them up or slow them down. If that fails, you have to react quickly with contingency planning. Realistic Fog of War: blocks hide exact unit strength and type. You can also hide your reserves off board. This forces players to realistically screen and probe. You can never be certain as to how close you are to breaking the enemy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Napoleon Returns: A Scenario Book for Volley & Bayonet Covering the Exciting Waterloo Campaign
description:
(from the manual :)

Napoleon Returns is a Volley & Bayonet scenario book covering history's most famous campaign. It provides:

- historical background on the four battles of Quatre Bras, Ligny, Waterloo & Wavre.
- complete scenarios for all four battles.
- a Campaign System which allows you to re-fight history's most famous campaign.
- a rules update to refine Volley & Bayonet for Napoleonic Warfare.
- an extensive look at all the armies and their uniforms.
- a complete order of battle, and labels for unit bases to allow quick set-up.
- a point system to allow you to design you own scenarios.
- 9 maps, one each for the terrain and deployment for each battle, and a 2 page campaign map.

Volley & Bayonet is the most practical way to fight the great campaigns of 1815. Find out if Napoleon has to meet another Waterloo.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Haar Hoolim Perception Games
description:
This is a collection of games using a set of 36 cards. Each card is a 2x3 grid with the squares colored in black and gold. All possible patterns are included. Some games also use a set of 40 chips in 2 colors.

The basic mechanism used in many of the games is matching the cards according to the square colors.
The multi-player games are listed below. There are also three solitaire games.

Territorial Matching - 2 players
Players match card edges in an effort to get the most on their side of the play area.

Covering Match - 2-4 players
Players match cards by covering sections in an effort to get rid of their cards first.

The Racing Game - 2-4 players
Players match cards edge-to-edge or in blocks of 4 squares in an effort to "move" as far as possible in a given direction.

Rustler's Racing Game - 2 players
Variant of the above where players can capture cards from each other.

The Gold Withdrawal Game - 2 players
Players take cards from the edges of a 6x6 grid in an effort to get cards with the most gold squares.

The Chess Rook Game - 2 players
The cards are assigned to Black and Gold players according to predominant color (with 10 being neutral) and moved rookwise on a 6x6 grid. The object is to capture the most opposing squares.

Surrounding Majorities - 2 players
Players place cards in a 5x7 grid (one card is removed) in an effort to surround cards with a majority of squares of their color.

Keyhole Majorities - 2 players
Similar to the above game, but played with 3 groups of 8 cards each (with holes in the patterns).

Guess the Rule - 2 teams
A very simplified version of Eleusis.

ESP and More - 2-6 players
A guessing and simple deduction game. Correct guesses are paid off based on the number of squares guessed at a time.

The Game of Equidistance - 2-4 players
Cards are played with matching edges. A played card reserves the space on the opposite side of the play area for the inverse card.

Square Casino - 2 players
Casino adapted for this set.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module TR – Tournament Reference
description: If you have Basic Set and T2000, this 64-page module gives you all of the race, weapon, and technology rules you need to play all of the tournament ships and races. These are the most up-to-date rules available anywhere (although of course this covers only part of the entire SFB rules set).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

description:
A collection of 12 ASL scenarios designed for tournament play by the Tampa ASL Group.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader


Contents:
Designer notes and articles. (24 pages)
12 scenarios SP121 - SP132

SP121 - Danger Close!

SP122 - Constant Sorrow
Klingenberg, Germany 1945

SP123 - The Badger's Breath

SP126 - Malignant Mahrattas

SP127 - Bleed Gurkha Bleed!
Near Sittang Bridge, Burma 22 February 1942

SP128 - Rupee Reward
Taunggyi, Burma, 23 April 1942

Lozovaja, USSR, 26 February 1943

SP132 - Timmerman's Bridge
Remagen, Germany, 7 March 1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Rally Point Volume 5: The Thunderbird Pack
description:
Rally Point is a series of scenario packs for Advanced Squad Leader. This issue contains 10 scenarios and is a special study of the U.S. Army's 45th Infantry Division

The scenarios are:

RPT41 Sicilian Debut
Ponte Dirillo, Sicily, 11 July 1943

RPT42 Piccolo Peak
Calore River, Italy, 13 September 1943

RPT43 Thunder in the Valley
Teleset, Italy, 12 October 1943

RPT44 Purple Heart Alley
Venafro, Italy, 4 November 1943

RPT45 Operation Buffalo
Campoleone Station, Italy, 23 May 1944

RPT46 Ghosts of Meximieux
Meximieux, France, 1 September 1944

RPT47 Black Edelweiss
Reipertswiller, France, 16 January 1945

RPT48 Firestorm
Aschaffenburg, Germany, 29 March 1945

RPT49 Spring Cleaning
Bamberg, Germany, 12 April 1945

RPT50 Nazi Town
Nürnberg, Germany, 17 April 1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Unable, unwilling
description:
A light, satirical card game set in a Quaker meeting. Membership has declined so far that you, the players, are all that are left. Unfortunately, the meeting still has over 40 nominated positions, and they all need to be filled by teatime. Can you persuade your Friends to nominate someone else? Or will you be the first to collapse from overwork, resign your membership and write an angry letter to The Friend?

The players each have a handful of cards, comprising nominations for jobs and increasingly-desperate ways of trying to get out of them. The game uses a line mechanic, similar to Family Business or Guillotine, with players eliminated when they succumb to too much work; the winner is the last player standing.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Bronze
description:
The board game Bronze is based on the Windows computer game of the same name from developer Dreamspike Studios and publisher Shrapnel Games.

While the computer game is mostly for solitaire play, Bronze the board game will be for two players. The game will include six civilizations, which will slightly tweaked from their digital versions. Game play requires the capture of fertile land or minerals to fund your expansion and building program. There are 7 different building types in the game each helps you to expand in different ways, however there are a limited number of each building in the game so choosing when and where to build is critical. Each player is randomly allocated one of the 6 civilizations to play and each civilizations has a different selection of buildings available to them and at differing costs. Each civilization will require a different strategy to be successful. The game also includes tiles for different terrain types so each game can be played on new map, sometimes minerals are plentiful, at other times all you see is endless desert.

The computer game is a tile strategy game of area control set in ancient Mesopotamia. Controlling one of twelve historically accurate civilizations of the era – Akkadians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Elamites, Ebla, Egyptians, Gutians, Hittites, Kassites, Mitanni, Nomads or Sumerians – players attempt to dominate the game board by creating farms, towns, embassies, ziggurats, and even armies. Each civilization has its own strengths and weaknesses, and the game has no luck elements.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Flames of War: Normandy Battles – Wargaming D-Day and Beyond
description:
Publisher Blurb:

In the early morning darkness of 6 June 1944, the largest armada of ships the world has ever seen heaves to off the Normandy coastline. Aboard, thousands of Allied soldiers wait in readiness for their date with destiny. Months of planning, training and preparation are now behind them. On this day they will undertake the greatest amphibious assault in history, and on their success or failure hangs the very fate of the liberation of Europe from the jackboot of Nazi domination. D-Day is finally here! Normandy Battles contains the best scenarios from the original D‑Day series of books, as well as the Battlefront Studio's favourite web scenarios, and updates them for the third edition of Flames Of War, and the two D‑Day compilations: Turning Tide and Earth & Steel. Normandy Battles also includes rules for airborne landings and amphibious assaults, allowing your forces to wage war from the land, sea and sky. The revised Total War rules put a new twist on larger games, giving your battalions additional abilities, and allowing you to field entire support companies. Inside You Will Find: History of the D-Day invasion of Normandy and the subsequent battles to liberate France. Airborne assault mission and rules. Amphibious assault mission and rules. 13 of the best Flames of War scenarios covering the Normandy Campaign. Total War rules allowing you to put bigger forces on larger tables, with two Total War missions.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Origin: Ranger Die
description:
Goodie given at those people who bought Origin at Spiel 2013.

Normally when someone has taken away the hunting token from the green grassland region, it's useless to be on that region. With this die, you can roll whenever you end your move on an empty green region. Depending on the roll you will get a orange, violet or tan card, an innovation tile, the hunting token that had been put back into the box, or nothing.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Down in Flames: Dutch Harbor / Aleutians
description:
A Down in Flames Campaign from RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr16.

Contents:
Background and rules
2 Campaign Sheets
2 sheets of Down in Flames aircraft
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Phaeris Promo
description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. 10.000 years and not a grey hair: Phaeris the Mighty is not a dragon to joke about. He has carried the sledge of the Purple Claws Archipelago for more than a month, alone against a full army! But this battle has exhausted him, and he now devotes himself to protect Yugo and his friends. It may be the first time in 10.000 years that a warrior could add a dragon to his body count.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Air Elemental Expansion Pack
description: The Air Elemental Zephrylos is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Elemental Evil. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Taluva: The 5th Player Expansion
description: A 5th player expansion for Taluva Deluxe. Contains 20 huts, 3 temples, 2 towers, 12 tiles, all in black.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Sela's Warbird Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the grand prize for the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Klingon Civil War. It is a D'deridex Class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: The IIONverse
description:
The IIONverse is a competitive, two-player CCG Comic Card game in which players construct decks to prove they lead the ultimate super powered team in Slab City (and beyond)! The players choose Heroes, Villains, or anything in between, along with locations where they can square off to display their prowess or save the day.

Also introducing The Cosmic Threat Which introduces a 1-5 Player cooperative game format, with three distinct play modes: Autopilot, Hard Autopilot, and Piloted. The players will play cooperatively to take on the Giant Alien Ship that is trying to destroy Slab City. Will the heroes and villains work well together and defend their city, or will they fail and allow the menace to destroy their home? You decide!

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers
publishers: IION Games (It's In Our Nature Games)

name: Kiev 1941: Biggest Battle of Encirclement
description:
KIEV 1941 - Biggest Battle of Encirclement is the first battle of KIEV theme wargame. In this game, One player takes the role of the Axis army while another player commands the Russia army. Players attempt to achieve victory by moving their combat units across the game map to attack their opponent’s combat units and occupy as many objectives as possible.

This is an introduction wargame, the game rule are easy to learn and play. Both players will find their leadership and strategic abilities put to the test as KIEV 1941's game systems let you recreate the classic battle of World War II.

COMPONENTS:
1 rulebooks (32 pages)
1 mounted map
1 counter sheet (77 counters)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Dice & Cards Expansion Set
description:
Including 10 more dice plus 10 unique cards:

2 special Dishonour cards - Public Disgrace and Private Shame - which add an element of chance when you act dishonourably!
1 new Injury card - Lingering Wound - means you start the next battle in a bad way!
3 new Quest cards - including Despicable
4 new Skill cards - including Fountain of Blood, Red Mist – which makes you more awesome once wounded – and Vengeance – which kicks in if a friendly samurai is cut down!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Team Yankee: Potecknov's Bears – Soviet Breakthrough Force
description:
Lt. Colonel Yuri Potecknov's motor rifle battalion is preparing to execute its mission in the scientific manner that he had been taught at the Frunze Military Academy and used in Afghanistan. Victory today will bring the world proletarian revolution that much closer.

Contains nine plastic T-72 Tanks, two plastic Mi-24 Hind Attack Helicopters, two plastic tank commander sprues, two decal sheets, six unit cards and one printed cardboard Artillery & Salvo template.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Panzer Grenadier: Horse Soldiers
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Horse Soldiers introduces the U.S. Army's 1st Cavalry Division, in its mounted version, to Panzer Grenadier. The division would eventually be dismounted and sent to the Pacific without its horses, but in the war's early days some of the cavalry generals hoped that their horsemen might ride into action.

An Army at Dawn covers the battles of the other two First Divisions - the 1st Infantry Division and the 1st Armored Division. The 1st Cavalry Division did not accompany them to North Africa; the U.S. Army had prepared itself to provide fuel and maintenance for thousands of vehicles, but not the fodder and care for large numbers of horses.

We're not limited by that harsh reality; in Horse Soldiers the American cavalry rides one more time. Horse Soldiers includes two dozen new, laser-cut playing pieces showing the 1st Cavalry Division troopers in their own special livery, plus a couple of scenarios for their use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Second World War at Sea: Battle Cruisers into Carriers
description:
Golden Journal expansion / variant for Second World War at Sea: Strike South, Plan Z and Coral Sea with counters for conversions of British and US battlecruisers into aircraft carriers.

Part the Second Great War alternative history story arc. Contains 3 variants to existing operational scenarios and 1 new battle scenario.

Comes with 10 long ship counters and 20 aircraft counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Sword and Spear: Fantasy
description:
"This ruleset, Sword & Spear Fantasy, is based on the Sword & Spear ancient and medieval wargames rules which are designed for playing out large battles of the period from about 3000BC to 1500AD. They are an evolution of that ruleset, with rules added to cover all of the required fantasy elements, but at its heart it is the same core mechanisms.

My intention was to make this mainly a game about units of infantry and cavalry (of whatever size and race and type) manoeuvring and fighting on the battlefield. All of the extra features such as magic, heroes, monsters, flying creatures and other exotic troop types add extra flavour and interest, and can impact the battle, but should not dominate it.

My aim with magic (matching the overall philosophy of the rules) was for the outcome to matter, but not the detail. So there are no long lists of named spells to choose from. Instead, just a few main effects are catered for (which on the whole are the same effects that would be covered by a list of lots of different spells) – increasing the effectiveness of friendly units, attacking the enemy and healing or rallying friendly units."

Excerpt from the Appendix
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Schlösser knacken"
description:
Promocard #19 for Aventuria card game. It was available in the "Drachling" box.

It reads:
Schaue dir alle Asudauerkarten eines anderen Helden an. Du darfst eine davon nach den üblichen Regeln spielen, als wäre sie auf deiner Hand.

Roughly translated:
Look at the endurance-cards of another hero. You may play one of those cards as thought it would be in your hand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Zechgelage"
description:
Promocard #21 for Aventuria card game. It was available in the "Drachling" box.

It reads:
Immer, wenn ein Gegner durch eine Aktionskarte Ausdauer erhält, darfst du 1 Karte ziehen.

Roughly translated:
Whenever an opponent gains endurance from an actioncard, you may draw one card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Deity
description:
You are a deity; a god—one among many, perhaps—looking down upon the earth, upon this curious species called humans, and upon their still more curious behaviors. They’re very proud of themselves and their advancements, these humans, and they take themselves very seriously, what with their empire-building and their silly and relentless wars with one another. They have no clue how tiny they seem to you, like clever insects—how thousands of years of their civilization pass for you in a matter of minutes, and how completely subject they are to your whims. But, like them, you’re proud, too, ye god, and you do so very much delight when these humans notice you and praise you and create all these wonderful and diverse religions about you. And your very favorite thing of all is when they marshall their greatest talents, and the earth’s most precious resources, and they build monuments to you and all your glory. After all, where would they be at all if not for your influence and magnanimity?

The object of the game is to score as many points as possible, at the end of five progressive game ages (game phases) by influencing human activities (arranging card tableaus) and encouraging the construction of monuments (collecting suited sets).

The five nations of the game evolve through progressive game ages and through individual technology levels (tech levels). Different ages and tech levels dictate different circumstances and game rules. The five tech levels loosely correspond to the five game ages, but it is important to remember that the tech level of any individual nation might not be the same as the current game age (one or more nations can be “behind the times”).

Any time a nation’s individual tech level advances beyond the current game age, it will cause the game age to advance by one increment. Depending on other circumstances, other nations may or may not advance their own tech levels at the same time. When any nation advances beyond the steel age (V) and into the atomic age (the sixth, unmarked age card), the game ends, and you proceed to scoring.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Mistborn: House War – Promo Card Pack 1
description:
Add even more intrigue with these five promotional cards for use with Mistborn: House War!

This set of promo cards includes:
“The Stallion” card: a very confused kandra whose antics can transform Favor into Disgrace

2 Terris Stewards cards whose efforts yield extra Favor for those who collaborate with their peers

2 Augur cards whose Allomancy allows players to reset their resources at an opportune time.

NOTE: Mistborn: House War Promo Card Pack 1 is already bundled in every copy of the Mistborn: House War Prestige Edition; if you’ve purchased the Prestige Edition, you do not need to also purchase this product.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Messerschmitt Bf 109
description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

The backbone of the Luftwaffe, the Bf 109 was credited with more kills than any other fighter plane.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ideastorm
description:
Ideastorm is a game full of crazy inspirations and imaginations! Players are given plenty of vocabulary, then use their creativity to connect them to one another to create new words or phrases. However, they should always be aware of what other players are thinking, trying to get the same answers as them to win the game. This may sound easy, but Ideastorm is not really that simple!

To play the game, players use the three words writen on each of the two cards in the middle pile to figure out a different word or phrase, then write it down on their own whiteboard. If any player writes the same answer as another, both of them score points. The two cards with words change every turn, so the playing experience is full of surprises and never repeats. Once a player has 25 points or more, the game is over. Whoever has the most points wins.
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Royal Mines
description:
The Royal Mines is a brand new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the Campaign Chapter included, your heroes will be able to infiltrate the dwarf mines, at the borders of the Kingdom of Istarra, and get precious artifacts. But be careful, the expedition will not be easy, and our heroes risk losing some blood there.

The dwarves are a hard-working, meticulous and greedy people. They never stop digging galleries to exploit as many deposits as possible, to trade what they extract from them or to create the best crafts in the world. It is in one of these mines, northeast of the border of the kingdom, called the Royal Mine of Skatten, that legends tell a powerful weapon is hidden.

The mines are heavily guarded. Patrols circulate regularly, because dwarves can never be careful enough. The alert level can rise very quickly, and the mission can fail at the slightest mistake. The mines are real labyrinths where it is easy to get lost. The access is forbidden to slowpokes and it will be important to be like the dwarves: methodical and effective.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Necromagis
description:
Theme
A fantasy post-apocalyptic horror game set in the fantasy world of Dalore. Players take on the role of Necromancers battling for whats left of the living to consume, enslave or corrupt.

Game-Play
A 2-4 player card game where players take it in turns to unearth zombies, feed them to level them up and then attack. You can also cast spells and defend yourself with magical gear cards.

Goal
The winner is determined by last man standing. Players will be eliminated from the game the moment they have no cards left in their deck.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Medieval, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
Welcome to the edge of civilization, where brigands rule and where the shadows are long.

Five Leagues From the Borderlands is a set of solo miniatures rules for fantasy campaign games.

Taking inspiration from gritty "medieval-fantasy" like The Black Company and Harn, this is a world of brutal combat and ever-present danger.

With a handful of miniature figures, your dice and these rules, you can adventure in the war-torn Borderlands, fight tactical battles against evil and hopefuly get a few coins in the process.

Your characters will advance as you go along, find loot and might even make it to the end.

Five Leagues is a descendent of the Five Parsecs series of games, offering a game experience written specifically for Solo Players:

That means that all the mechanics you need are built right into the rules, instead of being an afterthought stuffed in the back of the book.

We've aimed to make the mechanics simple and straight-forward, to make it easier and quicker to play on your own.

And the adventure and encounter tables will do pretty much all the set-up for you.


* *


Please be advised this is a tactical game: You will need miniatures, tokens, markers or something else to represent your characters in combat.

A typical battle will have 8-10 figures on each side.

This game is intended for Solo players, though it can easily be played with a friend: Just split the party between you and enjoy adventuring together!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Deadzone: Nexus Psi Expansion
description:
This exciting expansion features two new campaigns for Deadzone. One introduces solo-play - 'Artificial Stupidity' for a series of games against the Zombie hordes. The second campaign focuses around Nexus Psi and the hunt for the origins of the Plague outbreak.

In addition, there are also two new Elite Army lists, introducing new leaders for the Plague and Enforcers - the mutated Dr. Gayle Simmonds and Enforcer Recon Pathfinder N32-19.

This set contains:

1x Dr. Simmonds Exclusive metal model
10x Plague Zombies
Nexus Psi Source Book
2x Urban Scenery A
1x Urban Scenery Accessories
1x Landing Pad Scenery B
1x Defense Line Scenery A
1x Defense Line Scenery B
1x Expansion Scenery A
1x Expansion Scenery B
1x Connectors
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Morgan, Distraught Father Booster
description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Morgan and Eugene to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your horde.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Combat Commander: Europe – C3i #20 Scenarios
description:
Two scenarios from C3i magazine #20.

Scenario 104: Go For Broke (C3i Magazine #20), German vs American forces, Vosges mountains, Alsace, France, October 28 1944
Scenario 105: La Fiere Counterattack (C3i Magazine #20), German vs American forces, La Fiere Causeway, France, June 6 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Aventuria: The Return to the Inn of the Black Boar
description:
The Return to the Inn of the Black Boar is a mini-expansion for Aventuria: The Inn of the Black Boar.

Do you want to explore with even more people? The Return to the Inn of the Black Boar mini-expansion adds enough specialty cards to allow up to 6 players to head into the Black Boar together. But you’ll want to pick this up even if you play solo or with a smaller group, because it also includes cards and combat scenarios for two new factions you can encounter in the dungeon under the Black Boar: the Black Mages and the Undead Circus!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Slovakia's War: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
Slovakia’s War is an expansion for the Panzer Grenadier series, focused on the battles of the Slovak Army. There are 23 scenarios plus background articles describing the campaigns, and 253 die-cut-and-mounted playing pieces. This is not a complete game; ownership of Fire in the Steppe and Broken Axis is required to play all of the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: WALDAMI
description:
WALDAMI is a pattern recognition card game. Players start with a hand of seven cards, each of which shows a combination of two forms (inner and outer) in two colors. An example is a combination of an inner circle in white and an outer square in black and white.
The goal of the game hereby is to play all cards of ones hand.

Players do this by adding cards to the ones already played down on the table with the following rules:

change a single shape or color (e.g. circle -> square)
change whole pattern (e.g. inner and outer circle -> inner and outer square)
feature inversion (e.g. inner circle and outer square -> outer square and inner circle)
double feature in version (see 3 plus inversion of color)
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: KÖY
description:
KÖY is a 2-player territory building, tile (in this game, card) placement game where you don’t have to shuffle the cards at all, since all the cards are identical.

There are two players, Red and Green. Each player will get points for “squares” with their respective colors, as well as Water squares. Green starts first by placing one of his cards onto the table. Then Red places one of his cards in such a way that at least ONE square of the new card is either on top of or hidden under a previously placed card, and at least one square of the new card remains visible. Players take turns until all of the cards are placed. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Dream: Dreams and Nightmares
description:
Card game and strategy for 2 - 4 players from 8 years of age in which each player must complete their DREAM by creating a row of 6 cards with increasing numbers from 1 to 6, hindering opponents with the NIGHTMARE cards.
Can you complete your dream and make your opponents have nightmares?

OBJECTIVE OF GAME
Complete your Dream row by trying to obstruct your opponents with Nightmare cards.
The winner is the player who creates a row of 6 Dream cards, with an increasing numbering from 1 to 6, without holding any cards in hand.

SPECIAL CASES
When a player no longer holds any cards and there are no more cards on the deck, but in his row there are also Nightmare cards, the opponents can continue playing until they hold no cards in hand. The player with most Dream cards in his row wins.
In the event of a tie the winner is the one who has the most consecutive Dream cards in his row.

PREPARATION
Shuffle the deck and deal out 4 cards to each player. The deck is then left in the centre of game area. The youngest player starts and the game proceeds clockwise.

PROCEDURE
During the game each player must choose between:
Taking one card from the deck and putting it in his hand
Playing a card in his own row or in the row of an opponent
Players can hold up to 10 cards in hand.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Hand Management

name: Starcadia Quest: Patty & Sherry
description:
Patty is a sweet heart. She really is. But don't misinterpret her kindness with weakness. She is anything but weak. In fact, she is really really (really!) tough and rolls more dice for defense than any other Hero. And although half of the successes (rounded up) are considered, there's is still a fair chance that she will leave a fight barely wounded. Not to mention that choosing the right Upgrades may grant her even more defense dice.

Contrary to popular belief, Sherry is not insane (ahm... not clinically insane at least). She is brave, strong, and impulsive. Which makes her throw herself into a fight without measuring the consequences, taking the opponent by surprise but also giving her a few battle scars. When melee attacking, she can choose to take 1 wound to daze the enemy, before they even get the chance to defend themselves.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Nighthaunt
description:
Driven by an all-consuming hatred of living things, these spectral horrors sweep across the realms in great hosts, killing everything in their path. They remember only dim echoes of their past, fragments of the person they were, and half-faded memories of the events that led to their current predicament. This is enough to keep them in a state of perpetual torment, which pleases cruel Nagash. On occasion the Great Necromancer will assemble smaller groups of Nighthaunts in order to achieve a particularly delicate task. Their incorporeal nature and resistance to most physical damage makes the gheists particularly suited to such missions.

Want to play Warcry with a Nighthaunt warband? This is the perfect place to start! This specially-designed warband set contains a variety of Nighthaunt fighters, giving you a versatile and diverse warband out of the box. Fighter cards for every kind of Nighthaunt warrior make expanding your warband simple, while the Abilities card lets you master the sinister powers of the Nighthaunt.

This set contains 13 Citadel Miniatures, including 4 Myrnmourn Banshees, 4 Glaivewraith Stalkers and 5 Grimghast Reapers (with the option to build one as an Extoller of Shyish). It also includes an ability card that provides reference imagery for your fighters and powers they can use on the battlefield, fighter cards for 7 different types of fighter, including the Dreadwarden, Grimghast Reaper, Chainrasp, Spirit Host, Glaivewraith Stalker, Extoller of Shyish and the Myrmourn Banshee. Finally, you'll get 2 double-sided, Nighthaunt-themed token boards, letting you track activations, initiative, treasure, objectives and more.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue Moon City: Theater & Golden Shrine Promo Tiles
description:
The Theater & Golden Shrine Promo Tiles were originally available in Spielbox 6/2006.

They, along with Blue Moon City: Theater & Golden Shrine Promo Tiles, were later made available by Fantasy Flight Games as free download.

Golden Shrine - A player who finishes their turn on the golden shrine may immediate make an offering of crystals to the obelisk in order to place one of their player markers on the obelisk. To do so, they must surrender an additional 1 crystal beyond the lowest numbered box. This player may not use a Pillar card to make additional offerings on this tile.

Theatre - (no special power)
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Helionox: Chronicles
description:
Helionox: Chronicles is a standalone solo/cooperative scenario based deck building board game set in the Helionox universe. In Chronicles, players act cooperatively as the Architects of the future, a far thinking, loosely knit group of individuals that have mastered the art of Cryosleep. This powerful Cryo technology allows the Architects to enter a state of suspended animation for vast periods of time while traveling the solar system in search of new tech, loyal operatives, and answers to the problems devastating the system.
Against the backdrop of a slowly dying sun, a series of events known as the Helionox, Influence is the path to victory and can be gained in many ways. Starting deck builds can be customized at the beginning of the game and used with unique Architects for a vast array of combinations and asymmetric game play offering massive replayability. Travel the solar system placing a multitude of buildings types for strategic infrastructure. Access faction based markets for tech and operatives and add them your deck for powerful combos and unique scoring opportunities.
You and the other Architects must gain more influence than your opponent to lead civilization to a new beginning in the wake of the Helionox…

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Pick-up and Deliver, Resource to Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Promo Pack 2
description:
Promotional pack for organised play
Contents are detailed below. The number before each card is the number of copies of that card in the bundle.

10 Benedito, a Lanterna
10 Bituin
10 Casey Snyder
10 Jacques Rouge
10 Leumeah
1 Una
1 The Ankara Citadel, Turkey
1 Black Metamorphosis
1 Murmur of the False Will
1 Parity Shift
1 Pentex Subversion
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Voting

name: The Stump of Elemental Evil
description:
A card-based expansion for Four against Darkness. Instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.
The deck features a standalone adventure in which the heroes explore a cave hidden under a rotting stump, and attempt to sly the feared Tentacle Worm.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Chute: La Parrilla F.C.
description:
Welcome to the hot city of “Las Brasas” where there is nothing better than the smell of a large grill full of the best cuts of meat to feed a group of friends addicted to playing football. This is well known to Barry Mac, the coach of “La Parrilla F.C” who takes care to keep the barbecue at full fire during the 90 minutes of the game, filling his squad with football spirit.

In your deck of La Parrilla F.C you will find everything you need to feed your team with good cuts and soccer skills. Strategically, use coal and meat cards to improve your players. Knowing when to keep an active meat menu is essential, it is all in the handling of coal.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Bienvenidos a la caliente ciudad de “Las Brasas” donde no hay nada mejor que el olor de una gran parrilla llena de los mejores cortes de carne para alimentar a un grupo de amigos adictos a jugar al balonpié. Esto lo sabe muy bien Barry Mac, el DT de La Parrilla F.C que se preocupa de mantener el asado a todo fuego durante los 90 minutos de partido, llenando de espíritu futbolero a su plantel.

En tu mazo de La Parrilla F.C encontrarás todo lo necesario para alimentar a tu plantel de buenos cortes y habilidades futboleras. Utiliza estratégicamente el carbón y las cartas de carne para mejorar a tus jugadores. Saber cuando mantener una carta de carne activa es fundamental, está todo en el manejo del carbón.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Magna Acies! Fast "battle size" rules for 3D wargame in the Ancient age
description:
MAGNA ACIES! is a three-dimensional wargame ruleset (i.e. played with toy soldiers and on three-dimensional terrain) that aims to reproduce, in a good balance between realism and simplicity, the great battles of the Ancient world.
Its goal is also to bring people who have never tried this beautiful hobby closer to the three-dimensional wargame, which allows you to really "play" with the soldiers that we admire and have always loved. MAGNA ACIES! is therefore designed to remain simple and to immediately put you players in a position to really lead an army of the Antiquity, making you relive the situations that in those days could make the difference between victory and defeat.

You impersonate the commander of the army, who gives orders to the various corps from which the army is constituted: at the beginning of the battle, assign orders to your large units deployed in the field, depending on whether your plan provides that each of them must attack the enemy, or maneuver to reach a more favorable position, or even stand still waiting for the opposing charge or the development of events. Units that receive orders must act accordingly, until they clash with the enemy or until you deem it necessary to change the order for any reason.

In short, you are reproposed for the problems that the leader had to face on the ground and only those; this perspective (which can be defined as "great - tactical") involves simplifying (or automatically managing) certain aspects of detail that are not considered here as they are supposedly left to the initiative of subordinate officers, but allows you to play great battles in limited spaces and in a short time.

MAGNA ACIES! can simulate the battles of Antiquity until the advent of firearms; it was designed with classic age clashes in particular in thought, but works well as long as squares of men and horses predominantly confronted with close combat weapons.

I thought "MAGNA ACIES!" to be practical, fast and playable: in 15mm you can play even on tables less than one meter, the rules are round 25 pages including examples, illustrations and various chatter, the game tables and the "army lists" are included in a single A4 sheet, a 150 point game - army on each side can last an average of a couple of hours , once you learned the rules.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Arcana of Love: Sensual Deck
description:
The Sensual deck helps players overcome shyness and introduces variety into the bedroom. Your romantic life will be even more exciting and full of passion.

This deck is delicate and sensual — a perfect way to get to know each other better, open up, and spend a wonderful evening together, leading to pleasure for both of you.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy deck. Each card is illustrated using fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana Miłości. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: Let's Play, Rebel Sp. z o.o., StarHouse Games

name: Cuban Front, Battle for Cuba (fan expansion for Third World War: Battle for Germany)
description:
Battle for Cuba in the fading days of the Cold War.

The objective is, as the Cuban player, to delay NATO reinforcements to Europe in the Third World War.

Each side has a fixed set of units (counters) to either take over or defend Cuba in the Cold War.

"Cuban Front, Battle for Cuba" is a Fan Expansion based on a wargame published by Game Design Workshop [GDW] in the 80s called Third World War. Third World war covered Europe and the Middle East - we created a brand new region or Front in Cuba.

The Game uses maps dice and counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Attack of the Intergalactic Gherkins!
description:
Attack of the Intergalactic Gherkins is a whacky space-vegetable-themed card game.

Having been sucked through a black hole whilst escaping the terrifying Intergalactic Gherkins, the stranded astronauts must rebuild their ships and return home to their own galaxy.

Players draw cards to move around the four planets of the solar system, collecting missing ship parts and rebuilding their spaceships before escaping.

Opponents can play a variety of action card combinations in order to win, which can either help them or hinder opponents. These might include such cards as Meteor Showers (stops a player moving), Cosmic Ray (take a card from another player's hand) or stealing turns by combining cards to create word-matched 'Conjunctions' such as Pole + Star. Players must also deal with Gherkin Attacks which slow their progress. This could be by using cards such as Antimatter to make them disappear or a Rocket Pickle Jar to send them to another player to deal with.

Card drafting and hand management are crucial in this light-strategy game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: BattleTech: Salvage Box – Shilone Fighter
description:
A secret product, developed as a surprise reward for our Kickstarter campaign backers, the Shilone Fighter miniature has been heralded as a great success and a beautiful first entry for our potential aerospace line of miniatures.

Each Salvage Box contains a single Shilone aerospace fighter, an Alpha Strike card, and a pilot card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel HeroClix: Marvel Studios' What If…? Disney+ Miniatures Game
description:
Experience the events of Marvel Studios What If…? like never before in this smash hit Miniatures Game standalone experience. “What If…?” flips the script on the MCU, reimagining famous events from the films in unexpected ways! Play with your favorites such as Captain Carter, T’Challa Star-Lord, and Party Thor!

Play up to 8 campaign scenarios unique to this Miniatures game for 2 players where results matter from session to session or sit down for a head-to-head single match of raw power! Each of the 10 beautiful ready to play figures comes with two different ways to play for hundreds of different combinations. Excellent point of entry for the first-time miniatures player! Map components are thick double-sided tiles and the box includes everything you need to play!

This miniatures game contains everything 2 people need to play HeroClix:

A meaty multi-session campaign for 2 players that pivots and turns based on the results of the last session
10 Premium Quality Pre-Painted Miniatures each with TWO ways to play for beginner or advanced play
20 Character Cards (one each for beginner and advanced versions)
18 Object, Terrain, and Bystander tokens
8 Campaign Scenario Cards
6 Double-Sided Thick Map Tiles. No folds!
2 Custom six-sided dice with an icon of The Watcher
2 All-new Powers and Abilities Cards with Marvel Studios What If…? imagery
1 Full-Color HeroClix Core Rulebook (2022 edition)

This boxed-set is a great way for 2 players to learn HeroClix or just enjoy a themed gaming experience! Existing players will definitely want to pick up this product to play with their friends or at tournaments!

-description from publisher's website
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Colossus & Magik
description:
Born in Siberia, Piotr Rasputin is a mutant with a skin of steel and a heart of gold. He can transform his entire body into organic metal, granting him superhuman strength, durability, and stamina. Colossus is a gentle giant, however. He is sometimes reluctant to use his physical strength in combat, feeling a responsibility to use his powers to improve the lives of mutants and humankind.

Illyana Rasputin is the younger sister of Colossus. Abducted at a young age by Belasco, the sorcerer and master of the realm known as The Otherplace, Illyana trained in the art of magic and overthrew her captor to become Magik, the Sorceress Supreme of Otherplace! Her mutant ability to teleport herself and others through space and time by using stepping discs, pieces of Limbo that act as a midway point between locations and points in time, allows her to be anywhere and anywhen her mystic power is needed.

This pack gives players the chance to round out their X-Men teams with these powerful characters, beginning with beautifully-detailed, dynamic Colossus and Magik miniatures for them to paint and customize. Already featuring a combination of powerful mutant and mystical abilities, players can unlock even more power from this pair with three Team Tactic cards that allow them to tap into the power of Limbo or throw Wolverine with the famous Fastball Special.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – The Exiled Dead
description:
From the publisher:
- A warband expansion for Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, featuring seven morbid miniatures
- Includes a complete Rivals deck for out-of-the-box play and customization
- Contains over 70 cards, including 20 universal cards and 12 Grand Alliance cards for use by multiple warbands

The vampire Deintalos dwells in the darkness of Harrowdeep – a lurking menace eager to snare those who walk its labyrinthine passages. His experiences with the Force Dynamic – the arcano-electric force he believes animates all things – led to his self-imposed exile from Shyish, where his brand of necromancy is taboo. In Harrowdeep, Deintalos found an ideal place to hide his grisly experiments, aided by his mortal apprentice in necromancy, Marcov. Deintalos animates recovered cadavers with arcane machinery and the Force Dynamic. These Arcwalkers, as Deintalos dubs them, act in eerie unison to tear apart their foes. With their mindless assistance, Deintalos means to dissect every secret of the abyssal labyrinth in which he dwells.

The Exiled Dead are aggressive, but flexible enough to keep your opponents on their toes and play for objectives. Once you get your shambling fighters into a good position, they’ll be tough to tackle. To this end, Deintalos has an ability that will keep them all moving, activating multiple Arcwalkers at once. This box includes a complete Rivals deck, plus loads of extra cards allowing you to try out a few tricks, as well as universal cards and Grand Alliance cards to use with your other warbands.

This set contains:

- 7x push-fit Exiled Dead miniatures – no glue required to assemble, cast in a cadaverous grey to stand out even when unpainted
- 7x fighter cards, one for each warrior in the warband – Deintalos the Exile, the Prentice Markov, the Deadwalker Regulus, and the Arcwalkers Vlash, Bault, Coyl, and Ione.
- 65 cards to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep, including:
– 12x Exiled Dead objective cards
– 10x Exiled Dead upgrade cards
– 10x Exiled Dead gambit spell and ploy cards
– 6x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
– 7x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
– 7x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
– 12x Grand Alliance cards, usable by any warband belonging to the specified Grand Alliance
– 1x Exiled Dead Warband Background / Rivals Deck Card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Perplexus Beast
description: Do you have what it takes to make it through a 3D maze of 100 challenging obstacles? Put your skills to the test with Perplexus Beast! Flip, twist and spin Perplexus Beast 360 degrees to navigate the ball along the numbered track. Maneuver tricky obstacles like the laughing man, tight rope and super spiral without falling off the track! If your ball falls, head back to the start and try again. It’s an intense, bendy challenge you won’t be able to put down!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: CoraQuest: Bob the Blob Promo
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Pack A.

A new enemy for CoraQuest plus a QR code for a linked downloadable quest, a family dungeon crawling game.

Special ability: Every time Big Bob takes damage, spawn one Mini Bob for each damage taken (see quest for details). Mini Bobs can pass through (but not end a Move action on) squares occupied by heroes.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Titans: Titans Power
description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion that contains 25 cards (5 for each nation). That crossover expansion works for Titans and for previous game Valhalla.
Each Titan gets 5 cards with special powers. After each battle, that includes the Titan, player can add one card face-up to his play area – it means that the Titan will slowly grow in Power, unlocking new abilities. Player may use 1 card in each Battle, but each of them have a requirement to be activated – the more powers Titan has, the choice for player in battle is wider. Some Powers are easier to use, other more difficult, and it’s up to each player, how they will use the cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Tribulations at the Tunnel of Terror
description:
Tribulations at the Tunnel of Terror is a dungeon crawl adventure module for Dungeon Degenerates by Erick Bouchard & illustrated by Sean Äaberg. Tribulations at the Tunnel of Terror is a weird wandering in the hideous hole in the Highlands of the Würstreich with the dreadfully distorted Nackt Drek, the Eyeball Kid & his watchful friend as Lord Scrott plots... This adventure uses the Eyeball Kid card which is included with Die Würst #4. But the stats are included in the book.

Tribulations at the Tunnel of Terror comes with the exclusive Drek Stack card for use with Dungeon Degenerates & a full-color map.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Solo Fluxx
description:
A way to play Fluxx for one player from the designer of Fluxx himself, presented as the Looney Labs Holiday Gift in 2022. After removing certain cards (anything that requires more than one player), a single person can experience all the fun of any theme with a solo player version of the card game of ever-changing rules. The list of cards to remove from any given version is provided in multiple formats and a crowd sourced database of player stats lets you compare your score against others in solo mode!

Rule and materials here: Fluxx: Official Solo Rules
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pocket Scifi: A Cyborg Adventure
description:
You take on the role of a prisoner on a remote planet, incarcerated for crimes you didn't commit. However, you soon discover that you're not alone on this planet, as an alien race called the Synth has invaded and taken over the prison facility.
As the cell doors unexpectedly open, you find yourself in the midst of chaos, with Synth soldiers rampaging through the prison halls. Armed with nothing but your wits and your fists, you must fight your way through the Synth forces to survive and find a way off the planet.
The game is a single-player, action-adventure game with RPG elements, set in a sci-fi world. You'll need to scavenge for resources and level up your skills to overcome increasingly difficult enemies and obstacles.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Map Addition, Push Your Luck

name: Wizard: Camelot Edition
description: Wizard Card Game Camelot Edition introduces new strategic dimensions that make gameplay more challenging for experts who have already mastered the Ultimate Game of Trump. In Classic Wizard, Jesters and Wizards bring predictable advantages in both bidding and playing. With Camelot's extra cards: Holy Grail, Excalibur, Merlin, and Morgan le Fay, outcomes are less certain. The four new cards add complexity and must be wisely played. More strategy means extra excitement and fun!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Perilous Pond
description:
Perilous Pond is a game about rolling dice and trying to make the best out of the final result. Doing this is a bit of a spatial puzzle, moving your frog into a position with lots of options for future turns while still keeping safe from the pike. The game is suitable for everyone, a simple and fun mechanic kids easily master and a depth of strategy that gives the game another dimension.

The pond is not a static playing field. As you and your opponents move your frogs around, chasing fireflies, the pond will change. As a frog hops across the pond the lily pads, they will first be submerged and if pushed off of once more sink completely. This makes the pond harder and harder to navigate as the game progresses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Re-rolling and Locking

name: To the Moon: Bestest Memories
description:
To the Moon - Bestest Memories is a tabletop card game for 2-5 players where you play as memory-traversing doctors from Sigmund Corp. to unlock and collect memories with matching emotion orbs.

From the creator of To the Moon, Finding Paradise, and Impostor Factory, Kan Gao and Lannie Neely III collaborate to bring you a competitive card game featuring six fantastic artists from the Freebird team. The To the Moon series’ fondest moments are captured through polished and thoughtfully designed cards.

In this game, you play as memory traversal doctors competing to collect the Bestest Memories. Memories are obtained by exchanging the corresponding Emotion Cards. Choose your memories wisely - they are all valued differently, and some have properties that can be useful in securing your victory!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls – Tapeworm Promo Cards
description:
7 different foil cards for The Binding of Isaac with tapeworm theme.

- 4 treasure cards
- 1 monster card
- 1 character card
- 1 loot card

They were part of the Tapeworm Kickstarter and free for backer.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Dice Rolling, Income, Interrupts, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: FantasyForm
description:
Alchemists study the secrets of transforming their bodies into powerful elemental forms capable of impossible feats. A rival Alchemist seeks to abuse this ability for their own gain. Push your skill to the limits and defeat them before they reach their full power.

FantasyForm is a solo-only game where the player must defeat a rival Alchemist.

Each turn, the player resolves two Encounters (one from the top Outlands row and one from the lower Forge row). These Encounters may earn or cost the player valuable Shards or Essences that can be spent later to acquire helpful Upgrades. They may instead be forced to make a difficult choice or even take damage as they pursue their quarry.

Next the player may buy and sell any Essences from the Ethereal row and spend whatever wealth they have on Upgrades. Artifacts and Companions add powerful abilities and increased damage against the Rival. Forms offer a bit of both, and are necessary to face the Rival.

Each turn advances the clock, bringing the player into direct conflict with their Rival.
