Once the Ethereal Row begins to run out of cards, the Rival acts either by gaining an elemental Form or by dealing damage. If the player’s character survives this initial strike, they may spend Shards to deal damage in return. Damage inflicted persists if the Rival is not defeated, but there are only so many chances to win: each time the Rival acts, they tick down the number of actions they have remaining. The player must deal sufficient damage to the Rival before they use their last action to secure victory!


A fantasy-themed spiritual successor for SpaceShipped, set in the Earthshine universe.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Triplets
description:
It is a dynamic game of observation and speed.

Ideal to play with family or friends.

The objective of the game is to score the most points.

The game has cards with pairs of animals, and there are 3 identical cards from each of those pairs. You have to be careful when and where the cards are repeated because we all play at the same time and whoever reacts correctly first will take the cards.

Look for the repeated card and try to identify it before someone else does! But be careful! Don't make mistakes because they are penalized with a -1 card.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Dixit: Disney Edition – Villain Promo Card
description:
Included in Dixit: Disney Edition – Promo Cards, but it was released/given out as a single card at conventions like Spiel Essen 2023.

Promo card for the game Dixit: Disney Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Woodcraft: Man vs. Meeple Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was originally given as compensation to backers of Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter whom's orders were delayed.

It's a late-game helper (marked HP2/2): Cost: 5 blueberries. Gives you in each income phase 2 production of helpers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: When Nightmares Come
description:
A solo and cooperative skirmish wargame for investigating and battling the supernatural mysteries of the modern world.

When Nightmares Come is a tabletop miniatures wargame about modern day monster hunting and occult investigations. Players will form a team of paranormal vigilantes; self-taught occult specialists and monster hunters who call themselves the Nightwatch. These self-appointed members of the 'watch look to tackle the supernatural horrors and investigate the strange disturbances that plague their city.

The core of the game, using the Action Dice Pool with its multiple die types, is fast and bloody, with tiered enemies, flexible player classes, quick combat resolution, and straightforward mission objectives.

When Nightmares Come also contains a roleplaying element that allows for non-combat challenges and dramatic encounters. This system uses the same dice types as the core game's Action Dice Pool and emphasizes quick resolutions. This narrative system adds a fresh dimension to the core miniatures experience, particularly in longer campaigns where the promise of different foes and new storylines encourages long-term playability.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dual
description:
The celestial spirits are awake, dancing, fighting, always changing. Battle with the spirits, awaken your celestials, and outsmart your opponent to win the skies.

In Dual, cards hold two celestials: one Awake (active) and one Asleep (inactive). These also have different values. While in hand, the top celestial is considered Awake. Observe the back of your opponent's cards to see which they have Awake.
To play a bout (trick), each player plays a card from their hand in order starting with the first player. You must play the same suit if it is Awake in your hand. If you cannot follow suit, cards will be assessed with their Star power (trump). The player that played the lowest card may force a player (including themselves) to flip their whole hand, transforming their Awake suit for their Asleep celestials.
When all cards are played scoring tokens are awarded. Achieve token combos to gain more points.

After five rounds the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: 7 Wonders: Architects Guild Promo Card
description:
At the end of the game, gain 3 victory points for each Purple card in your neighbors’ Cities
This card was originally distributed by boardgame stores and was also in Plato magazine #130 (November 2020).
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Dinosaur Island:  Dice Tower – Sam and Zee Promo Card
description:
This specialist card was part of a three card set given to backers of the 2018 Dice Tower Kickstarter Campaign. The Dice Tower and CoolStuffInc has since started selling the cards individually. Each of the cards are new Specialists (which grant special player powers) which can be purchased by players in the market in Phase 2.

Card text reads:

"When creating a dinosaur, you may place one extra dinosaur in your Paddock, even if you don't have space"
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – As Honor Demands
description:
In every part of the Emerald Empire, noble samurai are pushed closer to destruction by the rapidly changing fortunes of the Great Clans. Though the natural order has been disturbed, there are still clans and samurai who choose to hold fast to their ideals — but will those ideals ultimately lead them safely through the storm or condemn them to devastation?

As with the other dynasty packs of the "Dominion" cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, As Honor Demands puts the focus squarely on your provinces, with the new eminent and rally keywords and an assortment of dynasty events that are played from your provinces. Beyond these themes shared across the entire cycle, this pack in particular offers a host of ways for players to increase their honor, unlocking new paths to victory for the Great Clans.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Atonement
description:
The pursuit of honor lies at the core of samurai life. Though different clans may seek to attain honor in different ways, or even have different definitions of what it means, at least maintaining the appearance of honor is essential to life in Rokugan—and no less essential for your games of Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game.

As the sixth Dynasty Pack in the Dominion cycle, the cards in the Atonement Dynasty Pack command attention with the new eminent and rally keywords, while also giving every Great Clan the tools they need to fight for honor. With a new Dragon stronghold, two new province cards, a World Champion-designed card, and a card created in conjunction with the Legend of the Five Rings community, Atonement is a Dynasty Pack that no fan will want to miss.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Tobruk Expansion Pack 1: Wavell's 30,000
description:
Expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in 1940. Adds 12 scenarios, a sheet of counters and some terrain overlays. Comes in a ziploc bag.

Expands:

Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Florenza: La Musa
description: La Musa is a variant for Florenza, offered through the 2014 Kickstarter project. It merely includes an additional character card that, unlike all the other, 2-sided character cards, does not have a corresponding tile to be drawn from the bag of artists (and Captains of Fortune) passing through town. Instead, the muse is always available to help inspire artists. Whenever you roll for an artist to see how prestigious the resultant artwork is, you may pay 50 fiorini (florins) for an additional roll, then keep the preferred result.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Renaissance
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Intergalactic Ace
description:
You are a hotshot, rookie fighter pilot. You are looking to prove you have what it takes to be the best in the galaxy by being the first of your opponents to get 5 Kills and become an Intergalactic Ace.

In the simple, strategy/chance game, Intergalactic Ace, players compete to be the first to shoot down 5 enemy ships. Upgrade your ship to prepare for battle, take your chances in Dogfights against Enemy Cards, and go head-to-head with other players to steal their hard-earned Kills.

Each game comes with 6 beautiful laser-cut wooden spaceships to keep track of each players' stats and Kill count. Additionally, each game has 50 stat marker pegs, 32 kill markers, 50 cards, and 2 dice.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Race, Resource to Move, Stat Check Resolution

name: Rum & Bones: Saint Seraphina
description:
A KS exclusive captain character that came with copies of Rum & Bones: Iron Inquisition that were ordered through the Rum & Bones: Second Tide Kickstarter.

It comes with a mini, a hero player board and a set of Skill Cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dieson Crusoe
description:
You are drifting on a deserted island because your ship has been wrecked. The weather on the island is fickle and getting worse, and the island is inhabited by dangerous beasts. You must somehow survive and escape from the terrible island!

Dieson Crusoe is a single player dice game. You will have to use your dice wisely to survive on a deserted island and complete your quest. Store food, gather resources, craft tools, and explore the island. But be careful. You'll also need roofs and fences to avoid harsh weather and ward off raids.

The core mechanic is Dice Rondel system. Each day (round) uses 3 dice. Players have to think about what order to use them. The dice value determines both the type of action and the effect of the action. You'll have to figure out which sequence works best for you.

The sequence, also determines the weather and raids of the next day (next round). Actions that are effective today can pay off tomorrow's damage.

Will you pursue efficiency today or safety tomorrow? Will you create your own solution to the dilemma?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hextraction
description:
In Hextraction, players are competing to get their ball from the top to the bottom of the board first. On their turn, a player will (in any order) play a tile and roll a ball. The first player to roll their ball from the top to the bottom wins.

Hextraction is a 3d printed game, and was designed as an open source game, meaning players are allowed and encouraged to design their own tiles and boards for the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Print & Play
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Race, Tile Placement

name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – The Board Game
description:
The follow-up to the highly-rated Monster Hunter World board game, Monster Hunter World Iceborne: The Board Game is a cooperative arena combat game for 1-4 players bursting with all new quests, exciting new gameplay, and a whole new line-up of MASSIVE monsters to hunt!

A mysterious song is echoing over the New World and causing the mass migration of Legiana. Now, the Research Commission needs YOU to investigate. Become a hunter of the Fifth Fleet and head to an uncharted arctic tundra where unknown threats roam wild. Protect the new Seliana basecamp from monsters unlike any you’ve faced before. Claim monster loot from your successful hunts to craft awesome new equipment, so you can hunt bigger and badder beasts until you’ve mastered Hoarfrost Reach!



How it PlaysLike World, Iceborne will plunge you into an open world where monsters won’t sit back and be hunted. Every fight is a boss fight. The monster controls the flow of combat, pushing you and your party to the limit — and each monster is wildly different. It’s crush-or-be-crushed with beasts as mobile as these!

Choose your hunter based on their unique weapon and playstyle. Pick which infamous monster you’ll be hunting across the ice. Track the creature in a quest driven by your decisions, avoiding pitfalls and collecting bonus resources to help you in the challenges ahead.

Then dive into heart-pounding, card-driven combat where teamwork, positioning, and stamina are key, targeting the monster parts you need for the equipment you want to craft — without getting wiped out!


Play multiple epic campaigns with different combos of hunters, monsters, and equipment. The more monsters you slay, the better the weapons you can craft, the bigger the monsters you can hunt!
Short on time? Every monster comes with single session arena quests, so you can plunge right into combat
Want to play solo? No problem! Monster Hunter World Iceborne: The Board Game includes solo mode




What’s New?Iceborne is a standalone board game that takes the highly-rated Monster Hunter World engine and introduces some game-changing Iceborne twists. Hunt a whole new roster of monsters who hit even harder when they’re angry. Navigate frozen terrain. Use your Clutch Claw to get close to the beasts. Find bonus info when tracking to help in the fight ahead. Manage your stamina in a new way. And brace yourself for brutal wind-up attacks!
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction

name: Robotech: Invid Invasion
description:
Weary from the constant battle with the Robotech Masters, the United Earth Forces have fallen to the invasion of the insect-like alien Invid. Lt. Commander Scott Bernard leads a tight-knit team of freedom fighters toward the main base of the alien invaders located at Reflex Point. Their only hope for liberating the Earth is to defeat the Invid aliens and their Queen Regess before Admiral Hunter’s Expeditionary Force returns to raze the planet and end the threat to the galaxy.

Can you can you and the other freedom fighters defeat the Regess and save the Earth?

+++

Robotech: Invid Invasion is a Cooperative game where human heroes must work together to cleanse Reflex Point of the alien Invid Invaders and their Queen Regess before it’s too late.

During the first phase, players will deal out a grid of facedown Invid Cards. Each turn, players will move their hero(es) around the grid, choosing which Invid Cards to flip over to potentially expose enemies, ambushes, or valuable Allies. The heroes must clear a path from one side of the board to the other to reach Reflex Point before the end of six (6) turns.

Once the path to Reflex Point is cleared, the heroes begin the Regess phase. The Regess and her guards are dealt out, along with additional Invid warriors. Our heroes must defeat the powerful Regess within six turns. If they fail, the returning REF will end the Invid threat—and our unfortunate heroes—by bombarding the planet with the dreaded Neutron-S missiles.

To win, the heroes must clear the path to Reflex point and defeat the Regess at Reflex Point before the missiles fall, destroying all life on the planet.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Zendo: Rules Expansion #2
description: Zendo: Rules Expansion #2 consists of ten new rule cards for use with the Zendo base game. The ten cards in this expansion provide a total of 85 new rules — most of which fall in the "difficult" category for those who want a new challenge. Don't look at these cards unless you are ready to moderate a game because the fun is in figuring them out, so please keep the secret rules secret!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Flames of War: Burning Empires – The Battle for the Mediterranean
description:
Flames of War: Burning Empires is a hardcover supplement for the Flames of War World War II miniatures game system. It is about the Early War battles in North Africa in 1940 and 1941. It contains armylists, scenarios, painting guides and background information about the battles that took place.

Included are the army lists that did not make it into Hellfire and Back, for example the Fucilieri, Greeks, and French.

In addition, rules and scenarios are included to fight out small raiding force actions, for example the British Long Range Desert Group and the Italian Sahariana
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Ancient White Dragon Expansion Pack
description: The Ancient White Dragon Arveiaturace is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: La bâtarde
description:
"La bâtarde" (the bastard) is a French card game in the same style as Tarot, Coinche, Belote, a kind of traditional, trick-taking, card games.
Each player plays one card, either following suit of the same color if possible, playing a trump, or otherwise any other card - the card with the highest value scores the point. The unique gameplay is that players don't win by scoring points, you win by announcing how many points you will score, and it can be 0 !

An extract from the beginning of the rulebook :
The Bastard one is a thrilling and mysterious card game.
Some claim that a primitive version originated in the North of India and arrived in Venice via Asia Minor, from where it spread through Europe. It is also told that it owes its name to the illegitimate daughter of a Syldavian prince who introduced it to his father’s court.
Others maintain that three Portuguese sailors brought it back from much further afield.
But nothing is less sure...

In this game, there are no teams, it is every person for themselves.
3 to 8 players can play.

Draw to designate the dealer (highest card). Next round the dealer shifts clockwise.

Deal the cards face down, one by one.
A “rubber” is a set of games made up of several “hands” all dealt in the same way.

After each hand is dealt, the players look at their cards and announce in advance the number of “tricks” that they think they will win. This is called “bidding”.
In this game you never pass. Each player bids on each round.
The bidding system leads all the players to agree on which “suit” is the “trump”, if any.
There are 6 possibilities: all cards are trump, spades are trump, hearts are trump, diamonds are trump, clubs are trump – or there is no trump.
When playing with trump, the order of the cards is different.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Doomlings: Multicolor
description: Multi-Color Expansion - These unique cards count as multiple colors, leading to extra bonuses!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: In the Name of Justice: The Battle of Lewes, 1264
description:
Earl Simon Montfort had gathered an army of dissatisfied rebel barons and, by stealing a march, had surprised the royal forces under King Henry III at the small East Sussex town of Lewes. The Battle of Lewes was the first on English soil in nearly fifty years and was the last "gentlemanly" conflict.

"In the NAME of JUSTICE: The Battle of Lewes, 1264" is a grand tactical wargame simulation of low complexity about this 13th century battle in the "Second Baron’s War". It is regarded as a hallmark in the political evolution of the English monarchy and part of the struggle to limit royal power in England.

Extensive research was done to provide an accurate and historical account of the battle. Unit types include cavalry, infantry, archers and even staff slingers.

Players represent either King Henry III or Earl Simon Montfort and their subordinate leaders. The battle takes place during the hours of May 14th and concludes when King Henry III or Simon Montfort is captured, or a moral victory is declared if Simon evades capture.

The game uses a chit-pull mechanism, which makes for increased replayability and helps simulate the chaos and drama of medieval combat. Many historical and what-if optional rules are included so replay value is enhanced, allowing the battle to be explored in greater detail.

"For what is more right than law, whereby all things are ruled? And what is more true than justice, whereby matters are decided?"
-- The Song of Lewes, 1264 --
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Batman Miniature Game (Second Edition): Core Rulebook
description:
Citizens of Gotham, pay close attention! Things may never be the same again…
Since the release of the Batman Miniature Game five years ago, we’ve seen a lot of changes here at Knight Models. The games has gone from strength-to-strength, with a hardback core rulebook, two expansions, and the successful launch of the Batmatch organized play rules, helping to grow our amazing community around the world.
We are delighted to announce the arrival of the 2nd Edition Batman Miniature Game rules.
This free downloadable PDF rulebook is the culmination of thousands of games, and feedback from our customers.
Fear not: it is still the game you know and love, with its street-level strategic action in Gotham’s darkened alleyways, but we’ve taken the opportunity to streamline the mechanics, making the rules more intuitive and even more fun, and we’ve consolidated a lot of hard-to- find rules and Traits into one mighty tome. We think players new and old will love it!
But that’s not all – far from it! The launch of the new edition is spearheaded by brand new miniatures, representing the pinnacle of our studio’s output. The new models are produced in high-quality, coloured resin. Knight Models was founded on a love of display-quality models, and we think painters and modelers will agree that these new miniatures are the best we’ve ever produced.

The Batman Miniature Game is a skirmish game based on the broad Batman universe. You can command one of the most famous criminal bands in Gotham City to expand your territory and control the underworld, or stop their evil plans with the Dark Knight and his allies.

The game includes the most important characters created by Bob Kane, like Batman himself, Robin, Nightwing, etc. aided by the Gotham City Police trying to stop the gangs led by the most infamous criminals and psychopaths of the DC Comics universe, like The Joker, Penguin, Two-Face and many others.

Knight Models team has created incredibly detailed miniatures to accurately portray these characters and their sidekicks in 35mm scale ready to assemble and paint. This is a licensed and official DC Comics product.

Here are just a few changes to the game for the new 2nd Edition:
Bat Cape (1SC, Passive)
As long as it is able to spend a Special Counter, the model will not take Damage, be Knocked Down, nor become a Casualty as a result of Falling or Jumping. In addition, the model may Leap Down without spending the MC, and without using any of its total movement allowance.
Mixed Combat Style (2SC)
The model may perform a close combat attack action and a free ranged attack action in the same activation this round (no Action Counters are required for the ranged attack).

The actions Run and Spring into the Air are disappearing. This was a difficult decision, because we wanted to limit the number of Movement Actions
and enhance the ones without changes, giving us a set of Movement Actions solid as concrete.
We also bring forward changes that affect Speedsters.
In 2nd Edition, with the new changes shown on older teasers, we believe that more Speedsters will appear in the game board, and will have to manage their Speed Force Counters more accurately.
With this new rule, Action Counters will be determinant in their game:
Fatigue
When a model with the Speedster trait has not any Action Counter, it suffers -1 to Movement and Defense Basic Skills.
With all of this, we thought that Speed Force Master needed a little update:
Speed Force Master
This model can spend up to 2 Speed Power Counters during the round like Action Counters.

These are just a few of the traits that have been improved for the 2nd edition.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pirates of Maracaibo: New Figureheads
description:
Release-Promo for Pirates of Maracaibo.
Available during Spiel23 at the DLP both. Its for free if you get the game at Spiel23.


Two additional Figure Heads for your ship.

Dolphin
Each time the player gains a pearl, they may bury it immediately.

Hydra
Pay 1 fewer doubloon for every gained Improvement or Residence card.
During each Explore action, the player may move 1 extra space
During each Raiding Action, gain 1 extra Raiding Power


Zwei neue Galionsfiguren für euer Schiff.

Delphin
Du kannst nun jede erhaltene Perle sofort vergraben.

Hydra
Erhalte einen Rabatt von 1 Dublone auf den Erwerb von Ausbaukarten und das Errichten von Residenzen.
Du kannst bei jeder Aktion Entdecken, die du nutzt, 1 Feld zusätzlich vorrücken.
Beim Kapern erhältst du immer 1 zusätzliches Schwert.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Multi-Use Cards, Pieces as Map
publishers: dlp games, Ediciones MasQueOca, Game's Up

name: Pull The Rug Out
description:
A variety of plastic objects (ten are supplied) are balanced on top of each other on a special 'rug', the order of which is determined randomly by a spinner. At any time after playing a minimum of two objects, a player may elect to "pull the rug out" from beneath their structure. If any objects fall no points are scored; if no objects fall one point is awarded for each object used.

The first player to twenty points wins the game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Pegleg Pete's Deck of Royal Rogues
description: This is a standard deck of 52 playing cards plus 4 extra cards and 2 jokers. The extra cards are the Serpents of Clubs, diamonds, hearts, and spades. The deck can be used to play any game you can play with a standard poker deck. The entire deck has a pirate motif. All the art is new and original.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Iconica Series #1 Add-on Cards
description: While the base Iconica set contains enough cards for a simple 1 vs. 1 game, additional cards are necessary to provide 2 vs. 2 team play or further variety in play styles in 1v1 games. These Series #1 cards expand the base game by adding additional playable characters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Knights
description:
Knights is a Chess-style boardgame for two players, black and white. There are three types of playing pieces: soldiers, knights and one "knight the first", soldiers are pieces dual color like the pieces of Othello. The board is hexagonal and it has triangular spaces.

Knights and "Knights the first" are placed on triangular squares, soldiers are placed at vertices of triangular spaces (intersections of the lines bounding triangular squares). Knights and "Knights the first" must be always completely surrounded by its own soldiers. Knights and "K.t.f" move from square to square, soldiers move from intersection to intersection. Players use a 4-side dice to move Knights and "K.t.f"and a 6-side dice to move soldiers. Players can move more Knights to run out the score of a dice and so for soldiers.

Important:

players must fully deplete the score of the 4-sided dice but do not necessarily of the 6-sided dice
players at the end of their turn must have all his/her own knights completely surrounded by their own soldiers.


Attack and capture of a knights (or " k.t.f"):

player must bring his/her knight(or " k.t.f") on a triangular square with a common vertex with a triangular square occupied by an enemy knight(or " k.t.f"), then player turns the soldier placed on the common vertex, Soldier thus changes its color and owner.
the attacked knight now has only two soldiers of its color in the two vertex of its triangular square and the third soldier of the opposite color, so it must run away.
a player must use the 4-side dice to escape his/her knight(or " k.t.f") and must use all of the score of the dice to move that knight.
a knight on the run must finish the move in a triangular square where are three soldiers of its color on the vertices or two soldiers of its color on vertices and a soldier of the opposite color on the third vertex, otherwise the knight is captured.


"Knight the first" can attack two knights at the same time.

Objective of the game is to conquer opponent's home-base. Another way to victory is to defeat all opponent's Knights.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pokemon of D
description:
Pokemon of D is a 3-in-1 FREE print and play game (print Pokemon of D and you can play 3 different games with the components).
Pokemon of D is inspired by Slapshot (for Pokemon Tournament concept), Pokémon Trading Card Game (for Pokemon Type/Weaknesss), Pokémon Master Trainer (for the Pokemon Power and Pokemon Adventure concept).

The 3 games you can play in Pokemon of D are:
1. POKEMON TOURNAMENT (A hilarious game for 2-10 Players). The Pokemon Tournament has just begun! Each Player is a Pokemon Trainer, and each Trainer will use 6 Pokemon to compete in the Pokemon Tournament!
2. POKEMON: TEAM ROCKET ! (A quick game for 2-4 Players). Jesse, James and Meowth from Team Rocket have made some plans to disturb the Pokemon world ! The Players are the Pokemon Trainers, and each Trainer will form a Team of Pokemon and the Team will be send to defeat Team Rocket !
3. POKEMON ADVENTURE (An adventure game in the Kanto Pokemon world for 2-5 Players, around 45 minutes if played by 3-4 players, no dice!). The Players are Pokemon Trainers. You will travel across the land, searching far and wide. You will catch Pokemon and Legendary Pokemon, collect Badges, defeat Team Rocket, then at last will face to face with the Pokemon Master in Indigo Plateau.

The complete components:
- 150 Pokemon cards {for PT, P:TR!, PA}
- 18 Team Rocket cards {for P:TR!, PA}
- 1 Map board {for PA}
- 12 Badge Token (4 are empty) {for PA}
- 5 Pokemon Master cards {for PA}
- 5 different Player Pawns, one for each Player {for PA}

If you or your kids like Pokemon, I am sure you will love this.
We have played this for months and we bring this game everywhere we go :D

Download the game for free at: https://www.jackdgames.com/free-games.html
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mayfair Game Variants & Mini-Expansions Set #1
description:
The Mayfair Game Variants & Mini-Expansions Set #1 comprises expansions for 10 Mayfair games:

Nuns on the Run: The Anchorite - This token is used in a game with only 1 or 2 Novices to effectively shrink the size of the board. In a 4 player game it can be used to change the landscape a bit.
Giza: The Great Pyramid: Fast Sleds - This gives players the opportunity to potentially push two sleds on their turn.
Lords of Vegas: Sky Bridge / Building Boom - adds the option to use the 2 provided skybridge tokens.
Atlantis: Boat expansion - A mayfair version of the small expansion which was a free give-away at Essen 2009. This one has cardboard chits instead of wooden ships. The boats function more or less like the bridges in the base game, but you can use other people ships to cross, by paying the correct amount to the bank or half the amount to the player whose ship you use.
Rocket Jockey: Space Port - adds variants to mid game scoring and alternatives when drawing cards.
Urbania: Subsidy Contracts - Adds tokens that can be used either in hiring or as extra workers. Also adds "Italian Politics Variant".
CATAN: Victory Point markers - Victory point chits.
Steam: Five Way Town - This tile adds five track access into one town.
Whitewater: Cranky Beavers - This expansion adds a movable obstacle into play, the Cranky Beaver, and gives options for a Sudden Death Ending and a Rough Rapids variant.
Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant: Charters - This expansion adds ways to enter a city without being closed out.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Extraordinaires Design Studio
description:
The Extraordinaires need your imagination!

Become a product designer and invent wildly imaginative objects for the Extraordinaires. Each Extraordinaire is a larger-than-life character with extraordinary needs. They live in a unique environment, have different physical needs or have an unusual job. It's your job to design the ultimate objects to fit their worlds.

How To Play:


Pick three Extraordinaire from a shuffled deck. There are a range of Extraordinaires available, from a Merman to an Astronaut. Each card has a picture of the Extraordinaire on the front and, when you turn it over, a little more insight into their world.
Pick three Object cards from the deck - this is what your Extraordinaire needs you to create for them. Assign one Object to each character. These Objects could be something to sit on, something to wear and much more.
You also have Think cards in three categories - Research, Design, Improve. You sort these into three facedown piles.
Now choose which Design job you are going to do - pick an Extraordinaire and their Object from the three option.
It is now your challenge to design this object for this Extraordinaire.
Use your Idea Pad and Pen to design the ultimate Object to suit the needs of the Extraordinaire. Describe your ideas using doodles and words. You don't have to be a good artist - good design is about good ideas!
Use Think cards to help you with your design. Good designers ask questions and this is where your Think cards help you.


- The Research cards prompt you to take a closer look at the Extraordinaire's world e.g. What is different about where the Extraordinaire lives or works? - The Design cards introduce different aspects of design like materials, shapes and colours e.g. How will your design be put away when not in use?
- The Improve cards push you to think about your design and make it even better e.g. How can you make your design more friendly to the environment?

Once you're happy with your design, give it a catchy name!
Now it's time to share your ideas - present your idea to a parent or friend. Start with the name of your design and explain why the Extraordinaire needs your product. Describe your concept, your research and what makes your design great! This gives you a chance to rationalise your idea and tie all the aspects of the design together, as well as building up some really great presentation skills.


You can also download an accompanying app that allows you to upload your designs and create a "portfolio".

You can play alone or in multiplayer mode. In multiplayer, each player takes a design job. You can set a time limit on the game allowing the designs to be casual or serious. The designs are named and presented just like single player mode, however there is now the addition of Award cards. After the presentations, each player is dealt an award card e.g. Best Presentation, the player then awards the player they think gave the best presentation and explains why. If you want a more competitive game, play multiple rounds. The person who wins the greatest variety of awards is the winner.

The Extraordinaires gives your imagination and creativity a workout, challenging you to think in new ways.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Shakespeare: Sonhos de um Bardo
description:
Shakespeare: A Bard´s Dreams is a game that lasts 5 rounds, each round to be an act of a play that will be staged by the characters that all players put into play. Each act takes place in a different scenario and characters can perform actions and collect coins. After each act the player with the highest character receives an extra income. As the curtain falls the show ends and players get Victory Points according to the set of characters played. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner.

Shakespeare: Sonhos de um bardo é um jogo que dura 5 rodadas, sendo cada rodada um ato da peça que será encenada pelos personagens que todos jogadores colocarão em cena. Cada ato acontece em um cenário diferente e todas as personagens em cena poderão realizar ações, coletar moedas para o seu cachê e garantir ao seu jogador ícones de suas classes. No final de cada ato o jogador com a personagem de valor mais alto recebe um cachê extra. Ao cair do pano o espetáculo termina, os jogadores somam seus Pontos de Vitória de acordo com a quantidade de ícones em seu elenco e quantia de moedas. O jogador com mais pontos vence a partida.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Golem Arcana: Urugal Elite – Carapace Brute
description:
The Carapace Brute is a true berserker, dropping its armor to gain accuracy and damage as it brings the fight to the enemy.

Shatterheart, the Carapace Brute’s passive ability, causes to the brute to lose armor equal to the amount of damage that it takes whenever it is hit. In return this Titan is granted a boost in accuracy equal to the amount of armor lost for one round. Carapace Brute then Trashes his enemies to a pulp. Thrash will reduce its cooldown by 2 every time it hits. This allows the brute to use Thrash repeatedly, as long as it continues to hit.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Galaxy Defenders Agent: Tritium
description:
Tritium is a Support agent – Support agents are specialists in using devices. The presence of these agents in a team may be the key to winning the battle. Instead of using two weapons, Tritium has an almost endless supply of devices that appear randomly in her secondary weapon slot, so her focus in the game is to support the team with a plethora of high-tech gadgets.

She was available as part of the second Galaxy Defenders kickstarter.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Golem Arcana: Urugal – Ashmogh Colossus
description:
It is said that the bones of the past should have been left alone, but these are desperate times and thus desperate measures were taken.
The Ashmogh was resurrected from the ashes of an Urugal necropolis long buried under the desert sands, and now people wonder if it wasn't buried with good reason.
The reckless indiscrimination with which the Ashmogh destroys both friend and foe in its hunger for destruction leave many Urugal wondering if the old ways were not in fact better left resting in the dark.

The Ashmogh comes with two new Relic Cards:

The Seal of Kanak cripples the magic of enemy or allied Knights to heal the Colossus
The Storm's Eye pulls Golems inexorably closer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: For the Crown: Vanguard Promo Pack
description: The For the Crown: Vanguard Promo Pack is a set of 12 new cards (2 each of 6 different cards) and 20 units (which are mostly the 4 new unit types recruitable with the new cards) for For the Crown. It was initially offered as part of the Sceptered Bundle.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Blood Red Skies: P-51 Mustang Squadron
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of USA P-51 Mustang fighters and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 P-51D Mustang Fighters
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Aircraft Card
6 Aircraft Trait Cards
6 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Markings Sticker Sheet
3 Action Cards

The introduction of the Merlin engine transformed the initially mediocre P-51 Mustang into a world-class fighting machine with the iconic P-51D, all but supplanting other types of fighters used by the United States Eighth Air Force in Britain. By May 1945, Mustangs had flown 213,873 stories and claimed 4,950 enemy aircraft destroyed.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Landleven spel
description:
Every player produces farm products and tries to sell them as well as possible. The more products of a kind a player has on his player table, the higher is the reward from the 'harvest'. Unfortunately, however, a player is often forced to sell his product at dump prices too early. And sometimes a harvest yields nothing at all. The aim of the game is to earn the most coins from the trade in farm products.

During the game, you grow vegetables and farm animals on your fields to earn coins. Each player starts with a hand of random produce cards. Each card has a picture of the product, cow, sheep, cabbage, sunflower etc, and numbers showing how many cards of that type you need to harvest at a time to get that amount of coins. You are not allowed to change the order of the cards in your hand. You play them in that order – unless you can trade them to other players, which is an essential part of the game.
During your turn you place one or two cards on your two fields in front of you, indicated on your personal play board. During the game you can buy a third field for your use. Each field can produce only one product – sheep, pumpkins etc. If you do not have space to do the required action of placing a product on your fields, you must harvest a field to make room for the new arrival. More cards on the field, more coins while harvesting.
Next, you take two cards from the deck and place them open on the table. You can take these cards for your own fields, or you can trade them or give them away – if anyone takes them. You can also trade cards from your hand, but all trading has to be done with the player in turn. No traded cards go back to hand. They all must be played to the fields after trading phase.
Finally, you take three and place them in the back of your hand. In the order you draw them.
The game ends when the draw pile has been used up for the third time. Who ever has the most coins wins.
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Rushin' Roulette
description:
Rushin' Roulette is a high-stakes card game of strategy and luck.

Each player starts with a posse of 3 characters that line up in a hidden order. One-by-one, they’ll take turns “pulling a trigger” hoping nothing is in the chamber. But your partners aren’t completely at the mercy of lady luck because YOU control what’s loaded into the revolver!

In this simplified game of poker, you can load Blanks to save your own team or Bullets to take out your opponents. But be careful! If your strategies are too obvious, your friends might use them against you. The last one standing wins, riding off into the sunset with the rest of their (most likely unconscious) crew.

Each player has a hand of Ammo Cards (Like Blanks or Bullets). They load one of these cards in front of them each turn and try to figure out what opponents loaded. Flip your opponents' cards when you think they're playing it safe (blank) and load dangerous cards (bullets) when your friends trust you too much and think you're playing it safe.

Rushin' Roulette is a bluffing game. You can load safe cards to keep your own characters safe, but if your strategy is obvious, your friends will flip your card to save themselves. So if you think they'll take your card, load a bullet instead. Each character has a Safe and Shot ability that activates depending on the cards you flip. Generally, shot characters go to the grave while safe characters stay in your lineup. The last player with characters in their lineup wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Santorini: Iris Promo Card
description:
Promotional card offered during Gen Con 2018 and SPIEL 2018.

Your Move: If there is a Worker neighboring your Worker and the space directly on the other side of it is unoccupied, your worker may move to that space regardless of its level.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mr. Sneaky
description:
The players have to play different roles in this game. Each player is reading another player's mind and cheating each other. If the rich man hides a treasure tile, he can win. On the other hand, if the thief finds it, he can win. If you acquire 8 gem tokens first, you win.

--Objective--
The Rich Man: Make The Thief face up the predetermined number of cards before The Thief finds the treasure tile.
The Thief: Find the treasure tile before facing up the predetermined number of cards.

--Set up--
The Rich Man put the 8 door tiles. He hides 1 treasure tile in them. (He only knows the place of the treasure tile.)

--Course of play--
1. The Rich Man places a card face up on the door tile.
2. The Thief faces up a door tile.
If the attribute of the door tile is equal to the attribute of the card, the card gives an effect for players.
The cards have several effects. Some cards are advantage of The Rich Man and the other cards are advantage of The Thief.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Travelers of Tryphosa
description:
Embark on an adventure in a mythical land in Travelers of Tryphosa, a fantasy questing board game!


Play team-vs-team game with strong team cooperation.
Decide how you want to overcome encounters: combat, charm, tame, etc.
Influence dice rolls using Tenacity - tokens earned when your character makes a mistake.
Develop and level-up your characters how you see fit.
Determine your fate by visiting camps where creatures and quests wait for you.


Each turn, travel with your adventuring party, complete tasks on your Quest Cards to earn quest points and gold, and purchase items and abilities. In the event phase, you may discover a quest or encounter a friendly or hostile creature - complete the encounter to earn points and loot. Then, level up your characters!

The game ends when a party completes 8 quests and/or creature encounters! After the final round, all parties enters a Battle Royale for extra points. The party with the most points wins the game!

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Promenade: Museum Bonus Expansion
description:
The Museum Bonus Expansion is a set of six cards which add variety to the museum bonus cards that are dealt to the galleries.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: For Science!: Exclusive Bonus Role Cards
description:
Includes 3 new Role Cards to be mixed in with the rest:

Plays a Scientist on TV
Panic Containment Specialist
Egregiously Serene Immunologist


--description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Blokk!
description:
ARCHITECTS ASSEMBLE!

In Blokk! you are the Architect and must build the perfect cube. Test your logic and problem-solving skills by using the game's 360° rotating stand or player mats to construct The Cube - this is a process known as The Build.

The game has 36 unique 3D coloured blocks where Architects can select only one block on their turn. Players must choose one out of three construct modes per game. These modes can be played either solo, or with friends and family in a co-op or versus game:

Free Blokk! - Architects choose a block of their choice on each turn
Dice Blokk! - Architects roll a six-sided dice and play the color rolled per turn
Card Blokk! - Architects draw from the deck and play the block on their card each turn
Card Blokk! is also the versus variant of the game. Architects battle it on player mats, known as the Blue Print to construct their own cube.

A game is complete once the Architects have come as close to a perfect cube as possible.
The Architect with the fewest imperfections wins!

Dare to be square.
-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement

name: La Famiglia
description:
May 20, 1929—It’s the Roaring Twenties! The economy is booming, and new technologies such as the automobile and electricity are now mainstream. Alcohol is still flowing freely, even though Prohibition has banned its consumption. As a result, the mafia’s profits have been soaring from sales of their illegal bootleg liquor, and violent crime is also on the rise.

Al Capone, Chicago’s infamous mafia boss, was just arrested, but there’s more to the story. You receive a request for help from the FBI for their investigation into a gang called La Famiglia who might be even more dangerous than Capone’s Chicago Outfit gang. Can you crack the case?

La Famiglia contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun. It's like two escape room or mystery games with one single purchase.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stymie
description:
Stymie is a classic game of territory control and capture,
played on a 7 x 7 board made up of 24 Perimeter spaces, 24 Prime spaces and the Center space. There are 2 types of pieces, 26 stones (13 Gold and 13 Silver) and the Antipode. The game starts with the Antipode on the Center space Silver side up and an otherwise empty board.

Players take turns putting pieces on the board, moving pieces already in play, or capturing. The first player to occupy 7 Prime spaces with his stones, capture 7 opposing stones, or reduce the number of opposing stones in Prime spaces to 0 wins.
A dominant position can take a losing turn on a single move. The Antipode can't capture, can't be owned and doesn't count toward any victory conditions, but it can be the most pivotal piece in the game.

It seems simple, until you start playing.

—description from Marc White, the designer
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Static Capture

name: Heroes of Stalingrad: War Stories – Otto Carius
description:
War Stories is a series of smaller expansions, much like Heroes of Normandie's Gazettes from before, but with a tighter focus on historical events and soldiers.

Where Gazettes where products designed for die-hard fans, War Stories will be more accessible, requiring less of the massive backlog of previously released expansions. War Stories will mostly be playable with just the core box, and the content of a War Stories issue itself, obviously.

Each issue will focus on a War Hero and will include a biography, his exploits, a dedicated scenario and one or two punchboards to integrate it into your game.

The first issue will be for Heroes of Stalingrad, and focuses on Otto Carius, a German Tiger tank commander who destroyed a total of 150 enemy tanks. This issue will also include a section of T34s for the Russian forces as well as the errata of the Frontoviks from the Heroes of Stalingrad game base box.

Featuring new artwork from Nicola Angius.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Soviet Front
description:
"Soviet Front" is a 1-4 player wargame simulation of the 1941-45 war between the Axis and the Soviet Union which features unusual and unpredictable systems for combat, movement, reinforcements, resources and so on. The purpose of this is to create a 'fog of war' so that a player is not only uncertain of the enemy's actual strength and effectiveness but also his own as well. The time required to play the game varies from the quick single turn Blitzkrieg scenario to the lengthy 48 turn Great Patriotic War. The game consists of a rulebook, counters, map, playsheet, 6 six-sided dice (3 white, 2 blue and 1 red) and a box. 2 opaque cups are also required. The Axis forces are represented by German, SS and allied units (Italy, Romania, Hungary, Finland and other sympathisers) and the Soviet Union by Soviet and Guard units.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Dodgeball: World Tour – Heroes & Heels
description:
Welcome to the Dodgeball World Tour! This game is designed to create an experience akin to Vince Vaughn and Ben Stiller’s movie version of professional dodgeball, but presented as a touring road show, similar to professional wrestling. On the Dodgeball World Tour, an ever-evolving collection of teams travel from city to city, entertaining fans with a nightly program that features an escalating series of matches.

Put together your team, line up on the court, rush for the balls, roll dice to score hits on your opponents and the team with the last player standing wins. Advance on the tour, improve your TV ratings and become the Dodgeball World Tour champion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battlecrest: Whispyr – Hero Set
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

A spirit born from the heart of the Fellwoods, Whispyr was bound to the world by the Dying Guardian. To fulfill her oath she and her familiar, Aura, must protect the Neververse against the corruption of dark magic. Ages of fighting against wraiths have given her a killer instinct and a knack for striking quickly before her victim can retaliate.

Components:

Whispyr Hero set: 1 Hero, 1 Health, 1 Minion, 3 Action cards.
Whispyr AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Titans: Echoes of the Past
description: This expansion adds new type of units to the battlefield - fallen infantry (12 units). It also introduces new battle mechanics with special fallen unit 5 dice and 5 cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Stifling Dark: Nightfall
description:
The Nightfall expansion introduces a new component and mechanic to The Stifling Dark while also adding two investigators, four items, and one cursed item.

The large flashlights cover more ground than the small flashlights included with the base game, but they can't reveal the adversary. The flashlight augments introduce ways to modify your flashlight to perform different functions that either help your fellow investigators or hinder the adversary.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Memory, Negotiation, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Game Harbor, Sophisticated Cerberus Games, LLC

name: Kimbap
description:
In KIMBAP, the players are expert cooks in the preparation of this typical dish of Korean cuisine.

Each of the players/cooks must carry out as quickly and correctly as possible the order of the customers materialized by 2, 3 or 4 dice.

You will have to roll the KIMBAPs thanks to the fabrics and the colored sticks.

You will need to be fast, logical, efficient and precise.

It's up to you and bon appetit!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time

name: Dabula
description:
Dabula is a two-player board game that takes about 3 to 10 minutes to play and offers a great deal of fun and challenge.
- - -
Goal
Your goal is to reach the other side of the board. That seems fairly easy but since your opponent has the same task there are some things that will most likely make it a bit more intricate to forfill.
- - -
How to play
Choose a color and arrange all your tiles facing down before you. That's your stock.
Take 2 random tiles from your stock and place them in the nearest left and right corner of the playing field.
Draw 2 new tiles. You can place the tiles behind, next to or in front of one of your own tiles (you can not place them diagonally).
The symbol on the tile must have at least share one attribute with all tiles that are adjacent to it horizontally and vertically (same symbol and/or same number of dots). These rules also apply to the tiles of your opponent that you encounter and therefor becomes a bit more difficult to place your tiles.

Each turn you can place one tile from your hands onto the game board according to the rules of placement. After that you take a new tile from your supply to replenish your hand to 2, your turn is over.

If you do not have a matching tile in your hand you put the tile beside the bord creating a discard pile and you take a new tile from your supply to replenish your hand to 2, your turn is over (you do not place a tile on the board in this turn).

If you have a tile in your hands that matches exactly (symbol and amount of dots) to one of the tiles of your opponent that is adjacent to one of yours you have the opportunity to take over that position.

You can place your tile on top of the already present tile and make a dabul!

From that moment on only the tile on top of the pile decides who can place tiles adjacent to the pile.

Your opponent can do the same thing again if he also has (or draws) that exact match too. This can end up in a pile as big as 8 tiles! This option is literally a game changer! Within seconds you can interfere in the strategic plans of your opponent and force him to change his offensive playing to defensive, take a detour or even force him to concentrate on another segment of the game board.
- - -
When do you win?
The rule is very simple: if you reach the opposite side, you win.
The tiles do not have to form a continuous path, you just have to reach the opposite side of the playing board first to win. But do not let this simplicity fool you, be careful!

Defending your territory is just as important as crossing over to the other side.

Create barricades to avoid that your opponent has an easy crossing. Take over positions to thwart your opponent and force him to change his plans.

Act quick, keep track of all sides and try to combine your strategy with the (bad) luck you might encounter!
- - -
Expert mode
Whoever reaches the other side first and has a continuous path of tiles in his/her color wins.
It is therefore possible that you are already on the other side, but you still have to reclaim fields in your path that your opponent has taken over.

Tip: there are 4 tiles of each symbol in the game for each player. Sharpen your tactics so that you will have enough pieces left at the end to repair your path.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Sagrada: 2023 Mini-Tournament Pack
description:
Rules allowing up to 4 players to play a series of 3 games against each other.
Each game uses 1 of the 3 Great Facades expansions.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: トリックステークス (Trick Stakes)
description: The horse you are in charge of runs based on the result of the tricks. The hand you decide at the start of the game will be carried over throughout the game, so you will gradually learn about the characteristics of the horse. This is a unique game where you can enjoy the thrills of trick-taking and horse racing predictions at the same time.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Trick-taking

name: Defenders of the Realm: Winds of War
description:
Winds of War is an optional variant for Defenders of the Realm that adds a tracking board and 16 cards to the game. Anytime a Special Hero card is played for its special power, or an "All Is Quiet Darkness Spreads" card appears, it is placed on the tracking board. As soon as the third card is placed, then a Winds of War card is drawn and must be followed. In most cases a negative effect occurs unless the team decides to prevent it by following the demands of the prevention on the card.

The contents of this expansion are included in the second edition of The Dragon Expansion, and the rules for this expansion are contained in the second edition Dragon Expansion rulebook.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Plantations of Karnataka
description:
Karnataka´ coffee production is especially renowned for its classic method of cultivating the seed and the cautious care the farmers pay to bring the best cup of coffee to the table. Are you up for the challenge and maintain the best plantation in the whole state across its different districts?

In Plantations of Karnataka players will be assuming the role of coffee farmers and move around their plantations aiming to harvest as many coffee beans as possible.

AIM OF THE GAME
Maintain the best coffee plantation and harvest the largest number of coffee beans before running out of moves.

COMPONENTS
Printed sheets and pen/pencil for each player. 2 Dice of different colours.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Red Alert: Space Fleet Warfare – Quartermaster's Escalation Pack
description:
The Quartermaster, the fleet’s expert in supply and logistics, provides Red Alert players with 48 additional markers for the Commonwealth and Confederation factions. These unit markers allow you to expand and customize the variety and number of support vessels you may take into battle. Two new units are included in this escalation pack – the Commonwealth Alliance gains guard destroyer squadrons and the Rebel Confederation now fields elite long-range fighter squadrons.

This Escalation Pack contains 1 punchboard of starship tokens and 1 rulebook containing special rules for 2 new unit types and 7 new scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: 6 nimmt! 25 Jahre Schnupperspiel
description:
6 nimmt! 25 Jahre Schnupperspiel is a small, promotional copy of 6 nimmt! 25 Jahre containing 56 cards.
It was part of the game package Stadt Land Spielt! Mini Games 2019.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Ubongo Shimo
description:
Ubongo Shimo follows the Ubongo formula of everyone trying to solve a puzzle quickly.

" Ubongo Shimo " is the latest family game by Grzegorz Rejchtman, creator of the best-selling "Ubongo" series.
This time, all players will try to arrange a pattern on their cards as quickly as possible so as not to cover the indicated special fields.
Four difficulty levels allow you to adapt the game to the age and experience of players.

Each player gets a set of 10 blocks in the color of their choice.
At the beginning of each round, players reveal new cards (4 difficulty levels are possible).
The drawn card indicates which blocks that must be used to solve the challenge.
Then, all players simultaneously try to arrange the pattern as quickly as possible so that all white squares are visible through the holes in the blocks.
The first player to complete the pattern calls out "Ubongo" and turns the hourglass.
The rest of the players have one minute to complete their challenge and score a point.

320 puzzles with 4 levels of difficulty

Number of players: 1-4
Age: 8+
Game time: 25 minutes

Game elements:
40 level 1 cards (green cards)
40 level 1 cards (yellow cards)
40 level 3 cards (orange cards)
40 level 4 cards (red cards)
40 blocks (10 per player)
9 gems (3 yellow, 3 green, 3 blue)
1 hourglass (60 seconds)
mechanics: Grid Coverage

name: Sakura Arms: Yaten Kaishin
description:
Yaten Kaishin (full Japanese name: 桜降る代に決闘を： 第壱拡張　夜天会心 ) is the first expansion for Sakura Arms.

It is adding two new playable Megami to the original game: Hagane (ハガネ) and Chikage (チカゲ).
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Relative Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Veterans Unit Expansion
description:
With instincts honed in the trenches, Rebel veterans are often assigned the hardest and most vital jobs in the war against the Empire. Through the countless hopeless battles on desolate worlds that they have seen, Rebel veterans can always be relied upon to get the job done, to hold the line, or to fight to the bitter end.

With the Rebel Veterans Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion, you can add seven unique unpainted Rebel veteran miniatures to your collection, including a Mark II Medium Blaster Trooper miniature that can be deployed as a detachment, offering valuable fire support to all of your units. Accompanying these miniatures are two unit cards, a selection of upgrade cards allowing you to outfit your veterans with new weapons and gear, and all the tokens you need to add them to your Rebel armies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ultimate College Basketball
description: Arguably the best college basketball game created - the game came in a box reminiscent of Strat-O-Matic, and most of the play was quite similar as well. Each year, however, brought a new batch of rule changes and upgrades, which makes playing cross-era very difficult. Cards are used to drive the action and for rebounding, but shots are taken using dice. A glaring omission is assist ratings for guards, who instead are an integral cog of the offense (without a well-rated guard in the lineup, the team will perform significantly worse).
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Panzer Grenadier: Army Group South Ukraine – Battles in Bessarabia, 1944
description:
Army Group South Ukraine: Battles in Bessarabia, 1944 is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series. There are 10 scenarios, or separate game situations, based on the battles of April 1944 between the divisions of the Soviet 2nd Ukrainian Front and those of the German 8th and Romanian 4th Armies, mostly the elite Grossdeutschland Division.

Army Group South Ukraine is sold BOTH via .pdf download and as a printed booklet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Panzer Korps 04: Red Typhoon
description:
Red Typhoon is the fourth game of the Panzer Korps series.

Red Typhoon covers the situation just after the Panzer Korps 03: Moscow '41 Operation Typhoon game. But, this time the Soviet is the attacker in the early 1942 Russian counter-offensive in front of Moscow that almost destroyed Army Group Center. Can you as the Soviet player complete the destruction or can you as the German player survive the Soviet onslaught.

Red Typhoon is a two player game following an IGO-UGO turn sequence with activation points controlling the movement and attack of each of your formations. This means that some units will not move or attack, some will just move or just attack and some will both move and attack. The players choices of how to use his activations is the most important decision in the game. Combat is fairly traditional with the additions that units are retreated by the attacking player and that retreated units are disrupted. Players able to take advantage of these two factors will be successful.

The game starts with several large Soviet breakthroughs that the German player must skillfully plug and in certain situations counterattack. There are special rules for German panzers, Soviet Airborne and Partisans.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: Not Listed
Hex: 9.3 miles / 15 kilometers
Units: Division to Army


Updated and translated in English as Red Typhoon: The Soviet Winter Counter-Offensive, 1942.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Operations Special Issue #2
description:
Operations Special Issue #2 contains Bravery in the Sand, PanzerBlitz: Carentan and Monty's Gamble: Market Garden – Fortress Holland: 1940.

It contains 2 ASL SK scenarios:

ASL Scenario S33 - Few and far between, Scherpenzeel, Holland 13 May 1940 (medium German infantry assault on a Dutch position)
ASL Scenario S34 - Twilight at Baerendorf, Baerendorf, France 23 November 1944 (armored German counterattack on an American position)


Additionally there is a Series Replay of scenario S33.

Read more: Operations Special Magazine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Blood on the Blade
description:
Blood on the Blade is a micro set of rules for solitaire or co-op skirmish game, set on a fantasy background, but can also be used for non-fantasy games (planned expansions will cover Middle-Ages and Dark Ages, possibly Samurai era).

The “Micro” refers to the small set of rules, the small time required to complete one game session and the small number of miniatures required (4-10 figures being a common range). Many micro-details are left to the player, only the “important” rules are included in the twelve pages of the game.

The game includes nine Scenarios, covering classical wargame scenes like searching for loot, attacking an enemy base, defending your territory, freeing prisoners. Event markers placed on the Map will create the needed Fog of War and randomize the placement of enemies, events and of course loot!

Scenarios can be played individually or as part of a Campaign game: in this case a flowchart will (randomly) determine the next mission; as an example, after a “Scout” mission a bad roll could send your characters on the “Ambush” scenario. Characters on a Campaign will be able to improve their characteristics, but with the improvement of the Reputation Level of your Warband, your enemies will also become stronger.

Activation of units (friendly and enemies) is managed with a pool of activation markers, but you can never be sure that every unit will be activated. When an “Enemy” marker is drawn by the pool you will roll on the ENEMY ACTIVATION table in the current Scenario to determine the unit to activate and its orders.

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #47 – Mokra #1
description:
Blitzkrieg, September 1939 and the 4th Panzer Division has crossed the Polish border is racing towards Warsaw, before it stands the Wołyńska Cavalry Brigade, what chance has cavalry got against tanks?

Your Soldiers are Uhlans of the Wołyska Cavalry Brigade, Poland needs every day to mobilize its’ reserves and for its allies to act. Your missions and objectives will be to stop the Panzers near the village of Mokra for as long as you can.

Warfighter WWII Expansion - #47 Mokra #1 adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Cultists of the Abyss
description:
An Abominable Intellect rises in the Blackstone Fortress, attracting more hostiles from their dark hiding places. Are you ready for the challenge?

These models were originally released in Blackstone Fortress: Escalation. They are perfect for use as hostiles with the Abominable Intellect cards, which increase the difficulty level of your quests in the Blackstone Fortress, or as models in a Warhammer 40,000 Chaos Army. Rules for using these models in Warhammer 40,000 can be found in Blackstone Fortress: Escalation.

Contents:

1 Cultist Firebrand
1 Cultist Champion
6 Chaos Cultists


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Lincoln March
description:
Lincoln March was a candidate for Gotham City Mayor and supporter of Bruces Wayne's vision of a new revitalized Gotham.

This expansion adds the Lincoln March character to the game.

Season 2 expansion.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – The Temptation of the Scorpion
description:
The Temptation of the Scorpion is the fourth Dynasty Pack in the Temptations cycle. It contains cards 67-86.

New crises strain the Emerald Empire to its breaking point, and every Great Clan will be tempted and tested—but perhaps none will be more tested than the Scorpion Clan. The survival of the Emerald Empire hangs in the balance, as does the heart of the Scorpion. Will they, and the rest of Rokugan, succumb to the rising darkness?

The Temptation of the Scorpion follows the pattern of the Temptations cycle, as new dire abilities force every clan to carefully consider how to invest fate in their characters. Will you take advantage of new Shadowlands creatures and Mahō blood magic to taint your deck, or will you rise above these temptations to pursue a path of righteousness?
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Nothing Left to Bomb
description:
Nothing Left to Bomb is a two-player game set in WWII and that recreates the Axis efforts to gain air superiority or even air supremacy in the skies above the pivotal island of Malta, and the British struggle to prevent it.

The game uses a modified system initially devised by Yasushi Nakaguro in his “Operation Pointblank” game (Bonsai Games). Each turn players commit their forces to the different map sectors secretly and then air battles are fought and antiaircraft fire is resolved. The aim of the Axis Player is that of achieving air superiority over Malta. Failing this by the last turn of the Scenario, the British Player wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Murder Mystery Party: The Night Hunter Game
description:
It was more than 20 years ago when The Night Hunter terrified America with a series of disturbing, animalistic murders. He taunted police and wrote strange and bewildering letters to the media. The public breathed a sigh of relief, thinking the reign of terror ended when Bill Mendax confessed to the crimes and was sentenced to life in prison. But now a new murder has taken place, with similarities previously not released to the public. Is it a copycat? Does Mendax have a partner? Or has the wrong person been behind bars with the real killer on the loose all of this time?

The Bureau needs your help to find the truth before The Night Hunter kills again. Join the Bureau in search of clues as you explore over 100 unique pieces of evidence to learn about The Night Hunter's past and solve the murders in the present. It will take lots of evidence and listening to witnesses to catch the murderer.

The game includes over 100 unique components and players are immersed in true crime forensics not seen in other games. The companion website features audio and video evidence where players listen to witness testimonies, check the accuracy of answers, and receive chilling message from The Night Hunter himself.

—description form the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Miremarsh: Rock Goblins
description:
The Rock Goblins have crawled out from under the swap - literally.

Play as one of the dark Rock Goblins as you attempt to rule the land. The Bog Goblins and Rock Goblins don't get along... This could get messy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Petrichor Collector's Pack
description:
The Petrichor: Collector's Edition Kickstarter campaign included several new promo items that will be bundled and sold as a lot to allow for more variety in Petrichor.

The eight tiles are:

Alfalfa Tile
Biodome Tile
Blackberry Tile (comes with 6 bramble tokens)
Cloudberry Tile (comes with 1 growth token)
Snapdragon Tile (comes with 3 bloom tokens)
Sunflower Tile (comes with 5 sunshine tokens)
Venus Flytrap Tile (comes with 4 fly tokens)
Volcano Tile (comes with 1 control token)


Other promos:

Forecast Cards (4 cards: Forecast #21-24)
Extreme Weather Events (8 cards)
Terrain Objects (4 wooden pieces, with stickers for both sides)



A player aid card with rules for Extreme Weather Events on one side and Terrain Objects on the other side


Also called 'Petrichor CE Promos'
