Rules for these promos can be found on:

English: http://mighty-boards.com/petrichor

German: http://schwerkraft-verlag.de/downloads/petrichor

or in the Petrichor: Collector's Edition rule book.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Voting

name: Rolling Realms: Beyond the Realmiverse
description:
Peace had reigned in the Realmiverse for as long as any realm could remember, but the constant arrival of new realms expanded it beyond the confines of the game box and one fateful day it burst. A hole in the fabric of the Realmiverse appeared, connecting it to the Promoverse and all realms were sucked into the ravenous rift. Your task is to guide the realms to safety and bring a united and joyous play experience to the Realmiverse and Promoverse.

Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this replayable 4-chapter solo campaign. Over the course of four chapters, you will draw, mix, and choose realms and complete a series of challenges. Can you navigate the realms through the Hole in the Realmiverse? Can you achieve perfect Synchronicity? Are you up for a battle with the Boss Monster? And can you bring the realms home safely after facing a vicious Swarm?

This campaign brings new adventures and game modes to Rolling Realms, and each playthrough will feel and play differently.

-description from developer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Solo Baloncesto
description:
SOLO BALONCESTO is a two-player boardgame that recreates a real basketball match. Each player is one of the two teams facing-up coaches. Two teams with 10 players each, where you can choose your "starting lineup" on the court:


point guards
shooting guards
small forwards
power forwards
centers



Each player has 5 different skills: Passing - action points - play skill - height - scoring %.
You have full control of the whole team, which will allow you to perform any individual action with any player on the court. A joint action between two players like a screen or a "pick& roll", a team tactic like playing in the zone or a man-to-man defense, faithfully recreating what happens in a basketball game. Thanks to its mechanic, mixes a great realism in the actions with high simplicity. Players move one by one alternating between attacker and defender, not the entire team at once, making play faster. This makes the duration of a turn variable, so you play four quarters like in a real game but not a predetermined number of turns in each quarter.

Passes, rebounds, fouls, two-point shots, lay ups, three-pointers, dunks, freethrows, blocks, pick& roll, steals... any basketball action is possible in this game!
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: MCW M3  Walker – "Rattler / Rattler-Amp / Cobra / Cobra-Amp"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Cobra and Rattler Medium Walkers – otherwise known as the MCW M3 Expansion – offer the Allies more options for armored support. With its anti-aircraft gun, the Rattler is capable of grounding airborne units. When it is not punishing aircraft, the Rattler unloads a wall of machine gun fire that shreds infantry to pieces. Meanwhile, the Cobra uses its Phaser gun to electrify vehicles and troops alike, causing massive amounts of damage to both. Additionally, this expansion includes parts to give your walker the Amphibious Unit skill.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Malifaux: Shadows of Redchapel – Seamus Box Set
description: Seamus loves Terrifying models and heals as opponents fail Wp duels. He is one of the most resilient Resser Masters and can step out from the shadows of Back-Alleys around the board to shooting one of the most devastating guns in the game at unsuspecting foes. Seamus is a serial killer mixing Jack the Ripper with Mr Hyde, summoning more Zombie Ladies of the Night as he hacks them down.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Hexpionage
description:
Hexpionage is an approachable yet intense two-player strategy board game that plays in under an hour. Deploy Agents, gather Intel, and sabotage opponents in this game of tension, strategy, and luck. Hexpionage combines hexagons with the thrill of espionage to create a satisfying abstract strategy game to feud over.

Hexpionage is easy to learn but difficult to master. You can learn the 3 pages of rules in less than 10 minutes, but with endless combinations of agents and board that never stops evolving, it offers a surprising depth of strategy.

The goal of the game is to acquire intel but you'll have to strike a careful balance as intel can also be used to activate the different agent's special abilities. You'll also have to watch out for Honeypots and other dangers as the board changes from turn to turn.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Across the Board Horseracing Game
description:
Enter a horse race, get your "tickets" and let the game begin.
The game is focused on betting on horses, but during the race you can end up betting more, at the end of the race, the accumulated amount will be divided among the people who have 1 of the 4 "tickets" of the winner horse.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Arms & Influence
description:
Arms & Influence is a political strategy card game that puts you and 3 others in a contest to build the world’s most dominant power. Players build a social pyramid and attempt to advance their society to prominence by achieving 7 Victory Points.

On their turn, players choose a total of 2 cards from the Society or Action deck. The Society deck consists of Leaders and Populations; the Action deck has everything else: Advancements, Competitions and Actions.

Once they select their cards, they must take 2 actions. Using a card consists of a turn. If they cannot make a move, they must discard as an action.

With populations, players build their social pyramid in an attempt to have 5 populations. Once achieved they can elect a leader.

Each population gives players one of 4 resources: Military Strength, Equality, Espionage, and Production.

They then use these resources to obtain Advancements such as "Man on Mars", "Nuclear Submarine" etc. (worth one Victory Point). Each which require a combination of 4 resources shown on the card.

Players strategically modify their pyramid, elect new leaders, to obtain new Advancements.

In addition to Advancements, players can earn victory points by winning a Competition. When a competition is played, players compete to have the most resource of a given type by the end of the turn.

The road to victory will not be easy, as players will use Action cards to disrupt each other's rise to power.

The first player to 7 Victory Points wins the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Lobotomy: Possessed Nuns Expansion
description:
This expansion introduces the Possessed Nuns monster type, and includes four miniatures and rules.

The Possessed Nuns Expansion is a Kickstarter exclusive, and was available individually, as well as part of the "Monster Bundle I".
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Dust Tactics: Red Guards Command Squad – "Red Command"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Long behind the Axis and Allies in VK technology and combat walkers, the SSU army of Dust Tactics has relied on the strength of its infantry to endure the war, and Soviet field officers have been no strangers to their nation's suffering. Accordingly, though the Red Guards Command Squad offers SSU players all the standard Command Squad skills, allowing them to reactivate your other units, call in artillery strikes, and help coordinate your attacks, these stalwart veterans arrive at the battlefield better armed than their Axis and Allied counterparts. This squad means business!

These battle-tested soldiers have upgraded their weaponry to better combat any direct threat they might encounter. The Red Guards Command Squad carries UGLs and a PTRS-47 for the times when it's best to lead by example. After all, these soldiers are more than just a group of tough officers and specialists: They are First Red Guards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Custoza, Fields of Doom
description:
"Custoza, Fields of Doom" is the name of the first wargame of a series, using the same rules system, named “Risorgimento”.

The Operational Game System “Risorgimento” simulates the battles and campaigns of the Wars of the Italian Independence (1848 – 1866) at regimental and battalion level. The system does not deal with the tactical formations of the period, instead it highlights the command systems and capacities, the fog of war, and the consequent operational and strategic decisions, keeping the game complexity at middle to low level.﻿

Historical Note:
Custoza is a small town at the edge of low hills between Verona and the Mincio river, an area that always saw the passage, and the fighting, of armies struggling for the domain of Veneto. And the same hills were the theater of two fierce battles between the rising Italian Kingdom and the Austrian Empire.

In July 1848, the battle between the Piedmomtese Army under King Carlo Alberto and the Austrian Imperial Army under Field Marshall Joseph Radetzky signed the turning point of the First Independence War, and the defeat of the Piedmontese dream of an Italian Crusade against Austria.

In 1866, on 24th of June (the recurrence of the Battle of Solferino), a far bigger, but inconclusive, battle was fought between the new Italian Kingdom Army under Vittorio Emanuele II, son of Carlo Alberto, and the Austrian Imperial Army of South led by Archduke Albrecht. The battle started as a meeting engagement, ending in a massive fighting. It was a crushing defeat of the Italian colours, but the Third Independence War still finally gave Veneto to the Kingdom of Italy, because of its alliance with Prussia, who was winning the Austro-Prussian War of 1866.

﻿﻿
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Santa Monica: Dead Reckoning Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Santa Monica to celebrate the release of AEG's Kickstarter Dead Reckoning. With this card, scurvy pirates take away one of your residents or tourists, but if you can then get someone to where X marks the spot, you'll find a treasure trove of sand dollars, the currency in the game.

—description from the publisher

Originally intended as a print and play according to AEG (the manufacturer): “By popular demand, a way to get the printed versions of the print-and-play pirate-themed promo cards we made for other AEG games to celebrate Dead Reckoning.“

This was a Kickstarter exclusive promo card available for add-on purchase, from the Dead Reckoning Campaign.

Print and Play available here:

https://www.alderac.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Santa-Mon...
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker
description:
From the back cover copy:

We all know that money won is twice as sweet as money earned, and there are plenty of books to help you if you want to mortgage the house to take on the $30-$60 table at the Mirage or the Taj Mahal. But most of us are looking for a friendlier species of the game, a chance to test our luck in the company of friends, and, if we are favored with good fortune and they are not, to really, really rub their noses in it. Dealer's Choice is the ultimate guide to the world of low stakes poker, where fun and bragging rights count as least as much as the final tally.

Starting with the elementary principles of the game every beginner will need to know before swimming with the sharks--betting, bluffing, and the hierarchy of hand values--Dealer's Choice features invaluable tips on how to host the perfect poker evening (the relative merits of chips versus coins, what food to serve) and more than 200 varieties of poker, from established favorites like Baseball and Follow the Queen to truly esoteric mutations of the authors' own invention such as Frankenstein, The Lord of the Rings Trilogy, and Hamlet (i.e., Jacks are low, Queens are wild, Kings dead). Renowned illustrator Phil Foglio has enlivened the text with spectacular line drawings.

With worldwide interest in poker at an unprecedented peak, Dealer's Choice gives casual players the chance to re-create, right in their own living rooms, the excitement of the World Series of Poker ... except without the five million dollar jackpot--but pizza and beer aren't bad either.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: General's Handbook
description:
This book expands the Warhammer: Age of Sigmar miniatures war game.

It contains description of the three different ways to play: Open Play, Narrative Play and Matched Play

Open Play:

Battleplans for multi-player games.


Narrative Play:

Path to Glory - campaigns with warbands tables and battleplans
Map campaigns
Tree Campaigns with Battleplans.
Matrix Campaigns


Matched Play

Ladder Campaigns
Rules for Pitched Battles.
6 Battleplans
Pitched Battle Profiles: List of point values for most units and battalions. Including the so called Compendium of the old armies, (i.e. Tomb Kings.)


Allegiance Abilities

for the four Grand Alliances: Order, Chaos, Death and destruction


The Original Rules.

-From the list of contents
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Ignite: The Freeze
description:
Ignite: The Freeze is an expansion for Ignite, the battling deckbuilder.

The Freeze takes everything that you loved about Ignite and takes it to a new level. New races, new terrain, new massive war machines, new devastating Hex cards, new equipment, weapons, abilities, and spells. Even a new type of poisonous damage.

Adds:
- 2 new terrain types: Acid Pools corrupt your equipment, requiring you to discard a card at random. Snow requires an additional point of movement to move into.
- 2 new races: the unbreakable Orcs who require 4 damage to take down, and the Fallen Valkyrie who are experts in blocking both melee weapons and spells.
- 50+ new sets of battle cards, with new spells, weapons, shields, and abilities that can completely change the game.
- Hex cards which will clog up your deck unless you're lucky enough to pass them on to an opponent.
- Poison damage tokens: These green daggers replace the standard damage daggers and will continuously cause your unit damage unless you're able to heal it.
- War machines are now available for purchase, taking time to build but dealing death instantly to those naive enough to be within range once complete.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Telestrations: 80s & 90s Expansion Pack
description: Be kind and rewind to the 80s and 90s with this radical expansion pack for the award-winning game Telestrations, featuring decades-inspired words and phrases that will have you sketching out the tunes, fads, and fashion from the end of the 20th century. Double-sided cards let you easily flip between the two eras and add “da bomb” new sayings to your existing Telestrations game! *This is not a standalone game.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Goblin Skull Bomb" Promo Card
description:
Item

Traits:
Object
Alchemical
Attack
Mythic

Check to Acquire:
Intelligence / Craft 11
OR
Bury an Ally

Powers:
Banish this card to add 1d20 to your combat check. You may additionally expend any number of mythic charges; for each charge expended, add 1d20. If you defeat the bane by at least 5, each character at your location is dealt 1d6 Fire damage. If you have the Goblin trait, bury this card instead of banishing it.

"Can't put it back together, but you can get a new skull."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Archenemy: Assemble the Doomsday Machine
description:
This is a stand-alone one vs. many Magic: The Gathering game.

Assemble the Doomsday Machine is a white-blue-black deck.

Archenemy pits you and your friends against a single powerful foe where you must work together to survive.

Each of the four Archenemy game-packs consists of 20 oversized scheme cards and a 60-card deck.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Red Dracolich Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Red Dracolich Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #7.3: Annihilation and Victory.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Detective: City of Angels – Secret Cabal Promo Cards
description: An additional Grift card (Lawyer Up) and an additional Favor card (Walter Fellini - Paparazzi) for use in Detective: City of Angels. Released as part of a Kickstarter reward for the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast 2018 Kickstarter.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement

name: Detective: City of Angels – Gen Con 2019 Promo Cards
description: An additional Grift card (Convention) and an additional Favor card (Gentle Connie - Confidence Woman) for use in Detective: City of Angels.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement

name: Grind House: Carnival/Cthulhu
description:
Carnival Expansion
Do you have what it takes to survive under the Big Top? Confront your fears in the hall of mirrors, the Wax Museum, the Freak Show and more as you are mercilessly chased by the Carnival’s own Gingersnaps the Clown!

New Thematic Mechanic: Collect Tickets and use them to help you survive the fun house of horrors in... the Grind House: Carnival!

Cthulhu Expansion
Create your own Lovecraftian night of horror with the Cthulhu expansion. Try to survive horrifying rooms inspired by classic Cthulhu mythos stories like Dreams in the Witch House, Shadow over Innsmouth, The Mountains of Madness, and of course The Call of Cthulhu. A brand new Insanity mechanic will ensure your night becomes a true Lovecraftian nightmare that you will never forget!

New Thematic Mechanic: gain madness and watch the world warp around you as things go horribly wrong... as they always do...in Grind House: Cthulhu.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Mystic Monkeys
description:
Welcome to the jungle! Mystic Monkeys is a fast paced, easy to learn two-player showdown. You and your opponent will play as rival monkey clans. Take turns using mind control powers to move your opponent’s monkeys and harvest the mystical powers that the jungle has to offer. Outwit your opponent in battle by using combat tiles earned during the game. Your objective will be to strand or capture all of your opponent’s monkeys. If on your turn you cannot move any of your opponent’s monkeys, you are crowned king of the Jungle… or at least what is left of it!

Happy gaming!
-Patrick & Jeffrey- co-designers
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim – The Adventure Game: 5-8 Player Expansion
description:
Increase your party size in Free Roam! Bring up to 8 people to the table with this add-on which allows up to 8 players to participate in Free Roam modes.

Contains:

4 player boards
extra player token sets
30 cube tokens
10 double-sided character cards
9 custom dice
4 game save boxes
45 equipment cards


Note: while all Free Roam modes are compatible with this increase in players, the standard campaigns are not.

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Banners
description:
Banners is a tactical game that utilizes hand-management, tile-placement, area-control, and a intriguing scoring system. Players will be placing cards from their hands to the table in an attempt to secure location cards at the end of the game. There are five factions vying for power of these locations and each faction consists of six cards ranging in value from 1-6. Player will not know what factions their opponents are making secret alliances with until the big reveal at the end of the game. Each player will end the game with 3 cards remaining in their hand and these will indicate which factions they have made alliances with. All locations are then scored and given to each faction. The player with the most valuable cards for each faction will gain all the victory points for the corresponding locations!

Players will also be attempting to place cards in clever ways as to grab shiny bronze coins, which are also worth victory points. Placing a Hag card allows the player to move the Hag from location to location and then move previously placed cards to a new position on the table, potentially messing up an opponent's plan or bolstering their own. Lastly, the sneaky Troll card can be played to steal a coin from any location and then allow that player to immediately take another turn.

-description from designer
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Dominations: Empire Pack
description:
Exclusive Mastery cards: These 24 Mastery cards allow you to gain Knowledge points during your opponents’ turns when they produce a certain amount!

The Bunuments: the Bunuments are back by (very) popular demand! These rabbit-themed Monuments replace the vertical elements of the standees for The Glorious Library, The Mausoleum, The Great Pyramid and The Colossus.

Capitals: This mini expansion allows you to turn your Cities into Capital Cities to increase your power and Influence!

Traits : This mini expansion allows you to bestow specific traits on your Civilization, giving asymmetrical starting conditions and additional Objectives to complete.

The Domination Token: This module allows you to gain additional points at the end of the game, by betting on how many Objectives you’ll be able to fulfil!

The Stranger Domination card: This mysterious character gives a helping hand to any player who is not able to claim a Domination card at the end of an Age.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Age of EON
description:
Age of EON is a strategic duelling card game for two players. You and your opponent represent one of four ancient empires in the mystical Land of EON, Infernia, Tikan, Aten or Yonashiro, and battle for control of the Eternal Stone. Whoever has the Eternal Stone will wield the power of Time to restore their lost legacy.

Each empire has a deck that includes 3 powerful demigods and 10 attack cards. Unleash your character’s mighty force to enhance combat strategies.

The goal is to defeat all your opponent’s characters in a series of battles and claim the Eternal Stone.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Victory: World War II – Second Edition
description:
The classic World War 2 sandbox game updated and with improved mechanics, more unit types, and streamlined gameplay!

Victory is a fast-paced strategy game of World War 2 combat using the popular Columbia Block System where each unit is facing the player, but not the opponent!

This "fog-of-war" aspect allows for feints, bluffs, and outright surprises not found in many other wargames!

Victory is a combined arms wargame where you command a variable force of army, navy, and air units all with different strengths and abilities.

And now, by popular demand, Columbia Games has re-released Victory with the Elite Units (which have since been tweaked and modified) included with the main game! This gives Victory even more depth with torpedo bombers, engineers, supply units and more!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Broken Axis: The Invasion of Romania, 1944 – A Panzer Grenadier Game
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Having driven the Hitlerite invaders out of Soviet Ukraine, the Red Army turned its sights on Axis-allied Romania in the spring of 1944. Powerful mechanized armies were met by German and Romanian forces along carefully-prepared defensive lines, which initially held off the attacks. But by late summer the Red Army had broken through, and Romania left the Axis to join the Allies in the liberation of Eastern Europe.

Broken Axis is a complete boxed game in the Panzer Grenadier series based on these battles. You do not need any other game to play any of its 50 scenarios. Design is by Mike Perryman, creator of our Kursk: Burning Tigers game. You can play those scenarios individually, or in one of four "battle games" that link them together for an intense campaign experience.

The Germans bring strong armored forces to the party, including Tiger and Panther tanks, Panzer IV medium tanks and the usual array of assault guns. At least that's what they have when they show up instead of leaving the fighting to the Romanians. The Romanian Army has been rebuilt from its 1941 and 1942 disasters, with German-made tanks and modern Romanian-made anti-tank guns. The Germans do provide the elite Grossdeutschland Division, and its epic stand at Tirgu Frumos is a centerpiece of the game’s scenario set.

The Red Army is powerful: the new JS-2 heavy tanks are in action, along with the first examples of the T34/85. These are the first large-scale battles fought outside the pre-war borders of the Soviet Union, and the Red Army is eager to take the fight to the Romanian “mush eaters.”

The game includes four semi-rigid mapboards, with art by Guy Riessen. The maps are fully compatible with all others in the Panzer Grenadier series (and those from Panzer Grenadier (Modern) and Infantry Attacks, too). Plus 517 playing pieces: silky-smooth and die-cut piece, a joy just to hold in your hands. And 50 scenarios with four battle games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: BANG!: The Walking Dead – Lucille & Katana
description:
Two bonus cards for use with BANG!: The Walking Dead.

Lucille - On a successful attack, the injured player loses 2 Health.

Katana - When you play an attack, draw a card from the deck.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Zombies
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Frostgrave: Dark Alchemy
description:
From the publisher:

Dark Alchemy is an ebook only mini-expansion for Frostgrave that includes a three-scenario campaign which can be played by either solo by one player or by two players working co-operatively. It also includes an expanded potions table, with numerous new magical elixirs, as well as new rules for the buying, selling, and creation of potions.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Brith Expansion
description:
This expansion for The Order of Vampire Hunters includes:

2 Miniatures
• Brith
• Burst Brith
2 Elder ID Cards
1 Rules Sheet

From Daniel Stoica’s Hunt Journal, added to the Book of Brith in June 2016:

I managed to clear the Den just as night was falling. I had taken a few scratches, but was still ready to fight. All I had to do was empty the cellar and it was over.

As I lifted the trapdoor and jumped down, I knew something was off. It wasn’t just a root cellar. There were many rough hewn exits and the room was huge, maybe 10 feet high. I felt the earth shake before I heard or saw it. Turning, the great beast was already upon me. My instincts took over and I had my sword deep in its belly before I realized I was fighting the legendary Elder, Brith. I killed him with the first blow, or so I thought. Then it screamed, more like joy than pain and its skin tore open with a sickening wet ripping sound. Three massive tentacles snaked out, fatter than my thighs, and clawed at my wrist.

All I remember is that I ran. I don’t know how I got out. Or what became of Brith. The Den was empty when I went back the next day. Cold and quiet like a grave.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Alien Artifacts: Alien Base Promo
description:
Alien Base is a set of 4 double-sided tiles. On one side of each tile, you have a picture of a fragment of a base. If you put these tiles face down, they together form a big alien base.

On the other side of each tile, there is an alien threat you must fight. Spyware threat blocks your technology cards, Alien contamination threat blocks your ships and Mysterious plague will affect your planets…

With this promo in game players have a choice – instead of attacking Alien system card, they may attack Alien Base, choose one of the tiles, flip it face up and fight it. You never know which part of the base you will have to deal with. They are a mystery. They are a risk. They are a threat!

But the award is there. On score 2, 3, or 4 you will gain Victory Point.

Save humanity. Fight Alien Base.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Kampf gegen das Spießertum: Shot Erweiterung
description: 100 brand new cards for Kampf gegen das Spießertum. 20 Cards are alcohol themed and marked, if one of them is played, everyone has to drink.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Russian Boots South: Conquest of Central Asia
description:
Russian Boots South: Conquest of Central Asia The game system is based on the previously published S&T games: They Died with Their Boots On, Volumes 1 & 2, Julian, and Sepoy Mutiny.

Russian Boots is a two-player wargame simulating the Russian conquest of Central Asia during the 1850s to 1890s. There are two opposing players: Russian Empire and Khanates. The Russian Empire player represents the theater command of an autocratic empire. The Khanate player represents the various independent kingdoms and tribes of the region, with the possibility of intervention from forces on the periphery. Victory conditions are asymmetrical, with the Russians trying to conquer Central Asia and the Khanates trying to prevent this.

There are three scenarios, each representing a different situation. Each game turn (GT) represents a from one to six years, depending on the pace of operations. Each hexagon on the map represents 80 to 90 kilometers (53 miles). Each Russian unit represents one or two battalion-sized grouping of companies or squadrons. Other units represent brigade or division-sized units, along with corresponding logistics, as well as groupings of tribesmen or other fighters ranging between 1000 to 5000 fighters. Generals represent key commanders, their staffs, and an elite guard.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters.

Published in S&T #338
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Quatermain
description:
Hunter. Adventurer. The greatest marksman to ever live. You are Allan Quatermain, searching for wealth deep in colonial era Africa. Grab your gun and wisely choose your allies as you compete in this deck building adventure game. 2-4 players will go on adventures, hunt in the veldt, and trade for new additions to their decks. Try to amass the most wealth, but beware, your allies will determine how many wealth cards you can score at game end.

Each turn consists of four steps:
- Upkeep, if applicable
- Play up to one adventure card
- Go hunting in the veldt
- Make up to one trade for new cards

As you gain new adventure cards, they will open up additional actions, plus you can get upgraded guns to aid in hunting, and allies which remain in play. During Upkeep you select one gun and one ally to journey with you that turn. The game continues until the veldt runs out of animals, at which time whoever can score the most wealth wins.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #6
description:
Contents:

• 1 punchboard with new NCOs (with possibilities of specialisations), “Shaked” markers and “Routed” markers for moral rules.

• Two 6-page booklets (one in English, one in French) containing:

- 2 short stories about moral
- Scenario « More bridges? » – US (1020 pts) against Germans (1050 pts) (need the Battleground set, the River set, the US Army box, the German Army box and the Devil Pig News #1)
- Scenario « So, what’s next, chief? » – US (depending of the previous scenario) against Germans (depending of the previous scenario) (stuff required, see previous scenario)
- New rules about moral, linked to officers and NCOs presents on the Battlefield.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Down In Flames: Kuban Bridgehead
description:
An add-on to the Rise of the Luftwaffe series, depicts the battle for the Kuban Bridgehead, over the river Kuban, it was the last German holding in the Caucasus.

This module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr #11 and is available for download from here.

Expands:

Rise of the Luftwaffe
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simulation

name: Unicorn Overlord: Official Card Game
description:
Strategize your epic game night against your friends with the official Unicorn Overlord Card Game available exclusively in the physical Monarch Edition!

Game is played against each other between 2-4 players.

Players will purchase items, units and territories then deploy them for might.

Players with the most might at the end of the round earn renown, and the player with the most renown over 5 rounds will be crowned the new Unicorn Overlord.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Belgium 1831
description:
Belgium 1831 is a political and social-economic influence board game set in the troubled Kingdom of Belgium after their Independence Revolution in 1830.

During the game, players will represent the growing Belgian bourgeoisie and they'll industrialize the Belgian provinces, buying materials to build factories to obtain greater economic power, will vote in the National Congress seeking to increase their political influence, will expand its social mass and will send, to the provinces under their dominion, at the highest authority, King Leopold I of Belgium, to revise the provinces in the pursuit of their own interests.

•••

Belgium 1831 es un juego de mesa de influencias políticas y socioeconómicas ambientado en el convulso Reino de Bélgica tras su Revolución de Independencia de 1830.

Durante el juego, los jugadores representarán a la creciente burguesía, industrializando las provincias belgas, comprando materiales para construir fábricas y así obtener el mayor poder económico, votando en el Congreso Nacional buscando incrementar su influencia política, expandiendo su masa social y enviando a la máxima autoridad, el Rey Leopoldo I de Bélgica, a revisar las provincias bajo su dominio en pos de sus propios intereses.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simulation

name: Sine Tempore: Kyrone
description:
The band of Kyrone Guards has landed on Primaevus V to reclaim the territories conquered by Achab and crew! In this fantastic box you’ll find the well-known Kyrone, 3 Guards, Centaurs set on defending the sacred locations of Primaevus V and 5 Broods, creatures originally from Primaevus V that Kryone and his centaurs have trained to back their cause.

With the arrival of this box, the influence of the Primaevi will increase significantly and the Genesis crew will need to find a way to contain their fury and shrewdness. As usual, in addition to the miniatures you’ll find everything you need to play these new enemies. Therefore, in addition to the Kyrone box (Nemesis cards included!) you’ll find all the enemy cards, tokens and an extra themed game board.

Content: 1 Kyrone, 3 Centaur, 5 Hounds, 6 Enemy cards, 2 Wounds cards, 10 Token, 1 Nemesis mission card, 16 Prey action cards, 1 Tile.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Itchy Monkey: Licence to Kill
description:
The lice have acquired a licence to kill.

In Itchy Monkey: Licence to Kill, players receive three new lice who can infiltrate monkeys of an opponent. If a spy louse jumps (or bumps) to a monkey containing lice of an opponent, all of the lice will stay on that monkey. From now on that "spy louse" counts towards the number of worker lice on that monkey. A monkey may contain only one spy louse at a time.

This expansion also gives you a new game mode in which you control a species of monkeys. (Yes, you won't be playing as lice.) The goal of this game mode is to be the first player to get rid of all of the lice colonizing your monkeys.

—description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: AFTERSHOCK: A Humanitarian Crisis Game
description:
AFTERSHOCK: A Humanitarian Crisis Game is a boardgame that explores the interagency cooperation needed to address the emergency and early recovery phase of a complex humanitarian crisis. It is intended both for hobby play and for use in professional education about humanitarian assistance and disaster relief.

The game is set in the fictional country of Carana, but is loosely modeled on disasters such as the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami and the 2010 Haiti earthquake. It explores approximately three months of humanitarian operations, including both the initial emergency and a later period of early recovery. Because Carana is a fragile, conflict- affected country, relief and reconstruction efforts may also involve issues of social unrest and political instability, especially during the early recovery stage once the initial shock of the crisis has worn off.

The primary objective of all players is to address the urgent humanitarian needs of the local population (thereby scoring "relief points"). However, players also need to maintain public and political support for their organizations ("operations points"), whether to govern (Carana), sustain the relief mission (HADR-TF), or secure financial support (UN and NGOs).

"At-Risk" cards indicate the current emergency needs for food, water/sanitation, medical, or shelter supplies in each district of the capital. Players must bring the necessary supplies into the country, and allocate aid teams to deliver them in time. Aid teams might also be engaged in rescue operations, aid coordination, needs assessment, infrastructure repair, public relations or other key tasks. Event cards inject many of the numerous challenges associated with relief operations into game play, but also indicate the self-help efforts of the local population as they struggle to survive and recover.

Game play is cooperative, but it is possible for some, all, or no player to win.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Flames of War: Turning Tide – The Allied Invasion of France June-September 1944
description:
Sourcebook with Allied Armylists for the invasion of France in the period of June - September 1944. Included are the following armylists which are new versions for the superseded rulebooks.

6th Airborne Division

3rd British "Monty's Ironsides" Division

5th Ranger Battalion

US Arsenal

Supersedes
