Mysterious secret missions will also be unlocked, giving you additional points at the end of the game if you complete them.

Whoever collects the most valuable deck of cards wins the game!"

—description from the publisher (translated)

Original (Hungarian) description:
"A játék mechanizmusa egyszerű: minden kör elején fel kell csapjatok eggyel több lapot, mint ahányan játszotok, és az aktuális kezdőjátékostól kezdve mindenki választ belőle egyet. Sokféle kártya kerül az asztalra, amiből pontokat tudtok összegyűjteni, és nagyon fontos, hogy milyen típusú és színű lapokat gyűjtötök össze magatok elé.

A célotok az lesz, hogy minél ügyesebb kombinációkat komponáljatok történetünk szereplői, lovai, tárgyai és helyszínei megjelenítésével. A kezdőjáték során nagyon gyorsan és könnyedén elsajátíthatjátok a játék alapjait, amit később a haladó módban mélyíthettek el plusz kártyák és újabb kombinációk segítségével. Előkerülnek a rejtélyes titkos küldetések is, amelyekkel további pontokra tehettek szert a játék végén, ha teljesítitek őket.

Aki a legértékesebb kártyasort gyűjtötte össze, az nyeri a játékot!"

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Contracts, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Battle of Brandywine
description:
The Battle of Brandywine is a two player Tactical level wargame about the American Revolutionary War battle, designed to be a low complexity game but also offers enough optional rules to give the game more complexity for the die-hard wargamer.

The game sets up quickly with both sides commanding roughly 30 units each and several leaders per side, you can set up the game and finish the battle in under two hours.

The unique aspect of the game is the turn sequence and the ability to resolve combat without a combat results chart. All combat is resolved by rolling a D6 per unit. Units that move first receive fire first.

The game includes several scenarios and optional rules and advanced rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Fastplay Wargames, Superior Print On Demand (POD)

name: Forest of the Spider Queen
description:
In this card-based expansion for Four against Darkness, instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.

The deck contains:
17 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards
2 unique monster cards
2 unique magic item cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: メトロックス (MetroX): Sapporo & Kobe & Kyoto
description:
In MetroX, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with ◯s in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices. Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

MetroX: Sapporo & Kobe & Kyoto includes three different maps to use with the rules in MetroX. Various gimmicks also appear, such as Kyoto with the largest number of lines, Sapporo with a ring road, Kobe with a huge station...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Number, Puzzle, Trains
mechanics: Bingo, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Black Powder Red Earth 28mm
description: A skirmish game with optional longer campaign structures, Black Powder Red Earth 28mm is designed to be fast, violent and streamlined. Games take around 15-20 minutes, and the action begins from turn one — survival is not guaranteed. Bloodshed is.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Ghost Dragons
description:
Shen Fang’s elite assassins are fearsome melee opponents, masters of the martial arts and ready to pounce at a moment’s notice.

Flame skill greatly increases their havoc potential, but watch out, those flames can affect everyone, not just their opponents.

These fiery dragons are swappable with elite characters in the following core box Adventure Mode missions: "To Sink a City", "Suicide Escape", and "Like Father Like Daughter".

They are also fully recruitable in Versus Mode.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle of Baton Rouge Game
description: The Battle of Baton Rouge is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Spanish attack against the British redoubt at Baton Rouge in 1779 during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Spanish forces and the other player commands the British forces.
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: The Librarians: Jenkins Character Pack
description:
Jenkins is now a playable hero! Complete with a suggested starting deck of all new cards ready to play out of the box. For those looking forward to building your own decks, the expansion has 3 new generic disciplines (groups of 7 cards) that can be included in any hero's deck, so it really opens up the deck building possibilities for all your heroes!

Jenkins is a kickstarter exclusive expansion and will not be available at retail.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management

name: The Wonderful World of Güs
description:
In this boardgame for 4 players, you take a role of a critter - the Güs, whose goal is to collect precise combination of healing crystals and use their power to heal the forest creatures.

You collect crystals from different parts of the magical forest and use the powers of other helpers who trade you crystal, double it, or give you the one you need to complete the recipe. There are also creatures in the forest trying to thwart your effort by blocking the specific part of the forest, stopping for short time, or destroying a crystal in your collection.

The player who heals the most forest creatures wins the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Movie Movie Game
description:
In Movie Movie Game, you and your friends test your knowledge of popular movie titles in the stupidest way possible. Movie Movie Game forces its players to bend and twist their brains in ways hitherto unseen by modern humankind. Anyone can name a movie based on a loose outline of its plot, but Movie Movie Game combines titles in such a way that you'll be dying laughing as your friend struggles to find the right way to say "Saving Private RyAnnihilation." Pro-tip: The trick is to really let them squirm...

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Мандалорец: Грогу и лягушачьи бега (Mandalorian: Grogu and the Frog Race)
description:
Welcome to the planet Sorgan! While the Mandalorian teaches the villagers to protect their homes, baby Grogu is resting on the farm, amusing children and chasing for the frogs. You can play with him too!

Before starting the game every player receives 1 random goal card which shows what frogs will give them most points.Then they take 3 cards from the jump deck.

On your turn you play 1 jump card and move frogs that pictured on it, after that move Grogu twice. When Grogu moves in a place with frog - remove that frog from the board. Continue until only 4 frogs left.

Count your score using your goal card with frogs that is left on board when game ended.
mechanics: Hand Management, Race

name: Photophantom: The Young Detective and the Shy Ghost
description:
Tommy is a young detective who specialized himself in very peculiar cases.

Despite his age, he is not afraid to explore old abandoned castles, armed only with a camera, looking for scary ghosts. However, Tommy is looking for a very shy ghost, which tries to deceive the young detective with tricks.

Will you help him?

Each round, a trick card is revealed. To score the card, players have to solve the trick. They compare the revealed card’s element with the upmost one on the trick card pile. The fastest player wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Recognition

name: Borderland
description:
Borderland is a game that combines Hex-like connective goals with Go-like territorial goals. The objective is to create a border with pieces by combination of placement and movement so that your territory occupies more than half of the board.
This game was inspired by Dale Walton’s Make Muster (2019).

COMPONENTS
・Regular hexagonal board (91 hexes) 6hexes per side
・Sufficient number of stones in two colors

OBJECTIVE
A border is an unbroken group of same-colored pieces that connect non-adjacent sides of the board.

When the board is divided into two or more areas by the creation of your border, all but the area containing the most opponent pieces becomes your territory.

The player who has more than half of the board as his/her territory wins.

SETUP
First, one player places one piece of each of the two colors in the desired position. Next, the other player decides which color to play (Pie Rule). White is the first player.

GAMEPLAY
The turn player can perform up to two actions that are consist of any combination and order of these actions: placing one of your pieces and moving one of your piece.

However, placement cannot be done twice in one turn. Also, a player cannot move a placed piece or move the same piece twice in the same turn.

When placing a piece, it must be at least one step away from all of your pieces and at least two steps away from all of your opponents' pieces.

You may skip one of the actions, but you may not pass an entire turn.

EMERGENCY FHASE
If one player makes a border but fails to achieve the win condition, the game moves to the Emergency Phase. In this phase, players can place their pieces one step away from the opponent's stones and can move the same piece twice in the same turn player.

The Emergency Phase is canceled when there are no more borders on the board by moving a piece that forms a border.

-description from designer
mechanics: Connections, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Operation Holland: Alternate Battles of the Bulge
description:
Operation Holland: Alternate Battles of the Bulge is a two-player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the operational parameters that would have been in place during the first eight days of fighting across northern Belgium and southeast Netherlands had Hitler decided to launch his massive counteroffensive toward Antwerp from there instead of the Ardennes. Such a German effort, if maximally successful, would likely have caused a three-to-four-month delay in the historic timeline of the Anglo-American advance into Germany.

In turn, that would have allowed Hitler to concentrate greater forces in Poland to seriously slow or defeat the Soviet offensive there in January, causing a similar delay in the Red Army’s seizure of Berlin.

Each game turn represents 12 hours. Each hexagon on the map is three km (1.86 miles) from side to opposite side. The maneuver units for both sides are primarily divisions, but also include some separate brigades, regiments, battalions, and companies. Allied air supremacy is (just as it was historically) hampered by the winter weather prevalent across the fighting front for most of the period covered by the game, and it is therefore represented only abstractly regarding those effects. This game is the second volume of a series of four games, the Alternative Battles of the Bulge Series. Each game uses a situationally adapted version of the same overall system to collectively cover all the various plans Hitler considered historically for his winter counteroffensive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Andor Junior: Mini-Erweiterung – Die Steine Des Schicksals
description:
An official PnP mini-adventure for Andor Junior, available on the Legends of Andor website.

Diese Mini-Erweiterung enthält ein neues, fantastisches Abenteuer für "Andor Junior“. Einfach ausdrucken und losspielen!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Trail up!
description:
Players are about to start a trail running race, taking place in a mountain valley.

First player to reach the finish line wins.

In the valley, there are different terrains : forest, grass, rocks and snow. Throughout the race, players will have to choose their own path according to their own abilities on each terrain.

They must manage their effort : tiredness will slow them down.

Players can improve their abilities, restore their stamina and slow down their opponents through playing cards, picked at aid stations.

There are 3 game modes :

competitive (2-4 players)
2vs2
solo
mechanics: Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Coup: Bureaucrat Promo Card
description:
A pack of 12 cards containing 5 Bureaucrat cards, 1 reference card, and 6 base cards.

The Bureaucrat replaces the Duke, and has the Cooperation ability of the Farmer in G54. Cooperation lets you take 3 coins from the Treasury, but you must give one of those coins to another player.

This promo was available as part of the KickStarter edition of Coup: Rebellion G54.
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: 한글날 (Hangulnal)
description:
Hangulnal ("Hangeul Day") is a game where you look at picture cards and make words associated with them. 'Hangeul' means Korean characters.
If you create associated words, you can get additional points and tiles.
Look at picture cards and combine consonant and vowel tiles to create associated words to get a lot of points.

Set Up

Place the board in the center of the table.
Each person selects the color of the meeples and get the same number of meeples as the number of participants. Then place one at each load start point on the board.
Make a deck of picture cards as many as the number of people participating in the game, and place them next to each load with the back side facing up so that the front side is not visible. (4 decks for 4 people, 3 decks for 3 people, 2 decks for 2 people)
The tiles are divided into consonant and vowel pockets,


mixed well, and then each gets 10 consonant tiles and 8 vowel tiles.

Playing the Game

Players all shout “one, two, three,” and flip the top card from the card deck in front of you so that the front of the card is visible.
All players select one of the open picture cards to create a word associated with that card. The word must be at least


2 characters long. (The words on the picture card or the English pronunciation of those words cannot be created.)

You can create words until the last person to create the words comes up, and the person who created associated words should shout “Hangeul Day!”.
From the first player who shouted 'Hangeul Day', each player one by one reveals the associated words that they created, and moves the meeples one block from the load with corresponding picture card. (If other player think the associated words don't fit at all, they can nullify with a majority vote.)
After moving meeples, take the same number of tiles from the pocket as the number of icons displayed in the stopped


column and finish your turn. Taking additional tiles makes the game easier because there are more possible characters to create as the game progresses.

You can replace the 3 tiles you have until the end of the game (consonants, vowels, or consonants+vowels) with 1 tile of your choice.

When first person's turn ends, the second person to shout “Hangeul Day” takes the turn, and the next person to shout take the next turn.
If you created the another word on the same load as the previous player in your turn, move it to the nearest blank space from that location. (Multiple meeples cannot be in the same column.)


If you select load and create words that are same as the previous player, only the person who originally created the word will be recognized and you will not be able to move your meeples.

End of the Game
The game ends when three meeples arrive at the final destination point of 10 points, and the person with the most points win by adding up the points written in the space where each meeple is placed.


Contact Publisher



MAGICBEANGAMES(Republic of Korea)
e-mail : magicbean@magicbeangame.com

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kockázat
description:
Kockázat (Battle of Dice Armies) is a quick, fun 2 player asymmetrical fantasy skirmish game. Players select a tribe ( Humans, Elfs, Orks, Gnomes, Dwarves, Undead, Fire and Ice ) and assemble an army using different dice ( d4,d6,d8,d10 and d12 ). Dices will be the units that the player activates to move on the square grid board or attack the opponent's units. You start the game with all your dice set to it's highest value ( e.g a d6 starts on 6 ).
During a standard game you have an army of 100 points - each die in your army uses points equal to its highest value - so 5 pieces of d10 will use 50 points.Each tribe consists of 5 cards, one for each type of dice - these cards define what actions you can take.

On a player's turn he/she activates one group of dice ( by tapping the related card ), and performs 2 actions with each dice: Move, Attack, Rest and Special Action paying the cost of activation by reducing the dice's value. Whenever a dice's value reaches zero it is removed from the board. You can not activate a group again until you have activated all of your groups.
Some of the abilities will place status effects on a unit ( Bless, Curse, Burning, Shield, etc. ) - these are marked by putting colored discs under the dice.

You win the game by eliminating all of your opponents dice.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Maglev Metro: Promo Passenger Cards
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

4 new goal cards:

2/Robots on Stations
5/Each set of 7 types of passengers
2/Commuter on stations
1/Passenger on stations
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero 2
description:
ガニメデ戦記Zero 2 (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero 2) is a two player card game from Japan in which Mechs are enhanced with transparent cards.

In 209X, Nigaleos, who was contracted for development by the Veil Army, was developing two types of Mechs, one specialized in attack and one specialized in defense. The airframe was built at both the research base and the production base.
The introduction of this 'Mech to the front line should have brought the battle on Ganymede to an end quickly. MEC engineers believed so and continued development. But Nigaleos executives had a different idea.

Ganymede Senki Zero2 is a standalone expansion for ガニメデ戦記Zero. You can play with it alone or mix it with ガニメデ戦記Zero and play with up to 4 people.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Parley of Pirates
description:
Parley of Pirates is a pirate-themed game where the goal is to obtain the most booty (treasure). Players take turns playing different cards to either obtain booty or thwart other players' attempts. Play continues in rounds until all of the booty from the communal pile is exhausted. The player with the most booty at the end of the game is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bribery, I Cut, You Choose

name: Dead End
description:
Dead End is a dark-humored, action-packed solo game of thematic, turn-based survival that plops players in the stinky boots of three-armed anti-hero, Bobby Butcher.

Players utilize Action Point, Hand Management, and Hero Defense mechanics as they fight off an onslaught of unique, unrelenting enemies trying to sacrifice them to the Nexus.

Dead End is the core game in A. R. Curry’s Deadverse, and each game in the Deadverse offers bonus content compatible with Dead End. Because of this, Dead End is an expansion-driven game that will continue to grow and evolve along side the Deadverse.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Verrotwood
description:
The skies over the Verrotwood have turned a sickly grey. The hopes of men have withered as fast as the crops. Desperate for salvation the people have begun to turn to the long forgotten and unspeakable things that rest in slumber somewhere deep in the forest.

Pagan cults clash in the name of their gods. They do awful things to gain their favor, in the hope that they can awaken their gods.

Verrotwood is a grimdark fantasy miniatures agnostic skirmish game. The game's core rules are designed to be simple to pick up and play. It uses a ten sided dice pool system that helps to speed up play by removing the need for math at the table.

A simple but versatile cult customization system allows you to pick from a large list of unique rituals to cast upon your enemies. As you play through the competitive campaigns, your cult will gain power and grow stronger with an easy to follow leveling system. In-between games your cult will explore all of the horrifying things that the Verrotwood have to offer in a random event system.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Orochi
description:
Orochi is a connection game with a somewhat quirky goal.

Each player is in charge of one of the two colors, but can also place a piece of the opponent's color through the game. If, after your placement, there is a piece adjacent to a stone of the same color in four directions, you may exchange that piece for a piece of the opposite color and get an additional turn.

Play until there is only one space left on the board, and the player with the larger group adjacent to the last space wins.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal" set.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Hexagon Grid

name: Queen of 12: Die Spionin, die Sammlerin & die Heerführerin
description:
A Promo pack containing 12 cards for the base game and the expansion.
The army commander in the expansion: Tick 1 more square in all rows and columns with at least 4 crosses. Not in abundance!
The Collector: Take all dice with 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6.
The Spy: If neither Mountain Guard nor Jungle Guard has been played, take two dice from each tray.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Sagnir
description:
At the beginning of time, there was the Island. It existed in balance with all things. One by one Mythical Beings arose from the depths, created from one of the four Elements of Fire, Air, Earth or Water. The Mythical Beings prospered, in harmony with the Elements and each other. After eons, the Elements themselves became restless and chaotic, breaking the fine balance of the Island as each Element tried to conquer the others. The Mythical Beings were forced into hiding and elemental chaos reigned.

You are one of the Protectors, your task is to establish the balance of nature so the Mythical beings can return and thrive in harmony. In the end, only the most successful Protector can become the ultimate Guardian of the Island.

Sagnir is a tile laying game for 2 - 4 players, ages 14 and up. It can be played with younger players.

Throughout the game, players will draw Mythical Being cards that show a certain arrangement of the five different Landscape tiles.

The players’ aim is to arrange the Landscape tiles on the table to create the pattern shown on the Mythical Beings’ card. Then players need to move their pawn onto a tile of this pattern to activate the Mythical Being card, scoring poi9nts that are counted at the end of the game.

The game ends when any player has activated a certain number of Mythical Beings, according to the number of players. The player with the highest score wins.

All Mythical Beings in the game are based on Icelandic & Nordic folklore. Descriptions and stories of each Being can be found in the separate Mythiopedia booklet.

Sagnir is replacing a previously published game from 2019, Mythical Island.

Part of The Nordic Heritage collection from Gamia games; Vedur, Runir & Sagnir.

—description from designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Me Enganei
description:
Don't fool yourself! You must play your highest card in the round, but you only score if you bluff, or catch who is bluffing... or who made a mistake, as the numbers in this game tend to want to change value! Pay close attention not to get caught in the deception.

Each round each player needs to show the higher card of a hand of three. But this can be a bluff.

Each player simultaneously can check if another is bluffing or not, you get points for catching someone bluff, however they score points if they were telling the truth. If nobody bluffed the value of a successful bluff increase.

Number in constant change: every round some number can exchange value with another, become the higher or lower, add with another.. so the player needs to pay attention in order to not get confused.

The game ends when someone scores 12 or more points.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Trick-taking

name: Mythic Commander
description:
Mythic Commander is a fast-paced two-player wargame that allows each general to lead an army of warriors, monsters, mages, and siege weapons in a clash of blades, arrows, and magic.

Build your army from an array of different choices and test your tactical skill against an opponent on the battlefield. Achieve victory by outwitting your enemy and destroying their forces.

Issue orders to control your forces and unleash powerful magics using the game’s Command and Spell Cards.

Customise your army by mixing your choice of 7 factions with 6 civilisations, each of which contains different upgrades that alter the abilities of your army’s soldiers on the battlefield.

This game comes complete with a double-sided map and army tokens to get you playing right away – you just need some six-sided dice. Mythic Commander is also compatible with any fantasy miniatures you have – bases all the way up to up to 40mm can be used on the maps provided, but any size is possible on your own battlefield by following the guidelines included in the rulebook.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling

name: Battlecrest: Deluxe Hero Pack #2
description:
Deluxe Hero Pack #2 is a set of Hero and Minion cards in alternative color palettes so you can pit them against themselves using two sets of hero cards.

Contains one alternate card for each of the following Heroes/Minions:

Korvu
Pavl
Hype
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sakura Dice
description:
Art is an integral part of Japanese culture. Not only in martial arts, music, painting or drama, but also in horticulture, they have developed their skills to a very high level. That is why gardeners are said to be artists in their field. It was their job in imperial times to design gardens so meticulously and to care for the trees so carefully that the emperor would always be pleased. Harmony and balance were two of the most important aspects of growing a tree. By the time of SAKURA the trees were bursting with beautiful flowers, celebrating renewal, beauty and peace.

In this game you play as Japanese gardeners and your task is to grow the most balanced cherry tree possible, so that by the time the cherry blossoming called SAKURA begins, your tree is the most beautiful.
mechanics: Bingo, Connections, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Race

name: All Hoomanz Are Dead
description:
All Hoomanz Are Dead is a cooperative dungeon-crawling adventure board game for 1-5 players ages 12+, where each person plays as a cybernetically enhanced animal against a common enemy called S.I.M.O.N., the ultimate Artificial Intelligence that turned against its creators and decimated the entire human scientists from a high-tech lab with a genetically engineered VIRUS.

The game objective is to stop S.I.M.O.N. before time runs out, which requires players to cooperate, gain skills and equip the best weapons found throughout the game. The game lasts for about 1.5 hours of tension, action and adventure, as the board gets revealed piece by piece ("room" tiles), each step bringing a surprise consequence. Fight monsters, gather treasures, survive random events, but at all costs avoid allowing S.I.M.O.N. to take over the world!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Exploration, Humor, Maze, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Tile Placement

name: Final Girl: Don't Make a Sound
description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

It was a quiet day in a barren one horse town when gravity pod landed near a sheep farm on the outskirts of town. Gravity pod is just my name for what it was, since it was entirely alien. The pod contained a ravenous being born and bred by a higher intelligence for one purpose: to clear a planet of current life so that it could be terraformed. Devoid of eyes, The Eyeless uses heightened sensory faculties to seek and destroy anything and everything that makes noise.

Welcome to Utopia! Jokingly called "nowhere" by the rest of the state's residents, Utopia is a desert town where the people are outnumbered by... well just about anything else you can think of. Little do the residents know, but they are about to be set upon by a brood of giant sand snakes, each as large as a tractor trailer, that were nested just below the town almost a million years before. The million year molting period.

- description by the publisher
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: But Then She Came Back
description:
"It hurt so much when she died — but then she came back, and it hurt so much more."

In the solitaire horror game But Then She Came Back, a loved one has returned from the dead. But she's not as she was – parts of her are missing. Changed. Twisted. You need to protect her, while feeding the ravenous ugly thing inside of her – finding her fresh victims. If you come up short, you'll need to sacrifice your friends and family, cutting yourself off from your support network. And if she is still hungry, you'll cut off pieces of yourself – an arm, a leg, your eyes, and finally, when you have nothing left to give, your heart.

Each day, you'll go out to get the things you need: blood, to feed her; knives, to protect her; and locks, to protect yourself from her. Each day, you'll lose a piece of her as the thing inside her continues to grow and hunger – demanding more and more from you, even as you're able to do less and less. Desperation gives way to despair as the promises you made when she was alive threaten to swallow you up.

The game will end in one of two ways: either you'll die, or you'll let her down. And you don't know which is worse, and which is kinder. And you pretend you don't know which one you'd prefer.

This is a game about horror and heartbreak, grief and exhaustion. It is for mature audiences.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Track Movement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Enquêtes Express: Panique à Dinopark
description:
EN

Welcome to Dinopark! In this new individual investigation, find out together who wreaked havoc during the opening of the famous dinosaur park, by daring to steal the egg of a mother triceratops.

During a game, players first read and observe as many cards as possible within a limited time. However, each player is forbidden to look at cards of his or her own color. Then, together, they take the time they need to share and cross-check their information to answer a series of plot-related questions. The more correct the answers, the higher the rank of investigator.

FR

Soyez les bienvenus à Dinopark ! Dans cette nouvelle enquête express, découvrez ensemble qui a semé la pagaille pendant l'ouverture du célèbre parc à dinosaure, en osant voler l'oeuf d'une maman tricératops.

Pour chaque enquête, d'abord les joueurs lisent et observent un maximum de cartes dans un temps limité. Il est toutefois interdit, pour chaque joueur, de consulter les cartes de sa couleur interdite. Puis ils prennent ensemble le temps nécessaire pour partager et recouper leurs infos afin de répondre à une série de questions autour de l'intrigue. Plus ils accumulent les bonnes réponses, plus ils accèdent à un rang d'enquêteur élevé.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory

name: Caravanserai
description:
Playing as a local stable boy who works in the Caravanserai, you have the privilege of being allowed into the restricted inner courtyard. This opens up a unique opportunity for you to make some money by doing your own business with the travellers, and acquiring the merchandise much sought after by local traders outside, who have no access to the area. Your starting resources are modest and you should use them wisely. Sometimes you will need to borrow money to carry out your actions, but supplying the local traders with the goods they want, you should earn enough to invest more, in addition to paying off your debt. The first player to accumulate 32 dirhams triggers the final round of the game, but the player with the most savings wins.

You have two optional actions per turn, and each must be preceded by a mandatory move along the courtyard path. A move can cover 1-3 spaces, and once in a turn you can chose to roll in the hope of making a longer move – but never longer than what you have rolled. Each space offers an action: you can borrow money from the money changers; buy, sell or exchange goods at the pavilions and merchants’ stalls; or trade goods directly with the travellers. However, there is a unique fountain in the centre of the courtyard, which rotates each time when certain transactions are made, and this can affect your income!

The local traders will give you minor or major orders for the goods they need; completing these orders will not only earn you money, but also help you pay off your debts, increase your savings and obtain ability cards that will give you additional benefits during or at the end of the game. It is worth completing as many major orders as you can, as the order cards are collectible and the sets are worth additional points.

Caravanserai is an easy-to-learn trading and resource management game that is fun for the whole family. It involves sufficient luck factor to help beginners catch up, but it is also a fairly strong strategic and tactical challenge.

Hungarian description:

A karavánszeráj zárt terület, oda nem juthatnak be kívülről a helyi kereskedők, pedig szívesen vásárolnának a karavánok által szállított mesés portékából! Ezt használják ki az ott szolgáló szemfüles lovászfiúk (a játékosok), akiknek bejárása van a falak közé. Titokban, a saját zsebükre üzletelgetnek a megpihenő karavánokkal, majd a megszerzett árut némi haszonnal tovább értékesítik odakint, a helyi kereskedőknek. Az üzlet olyan jól megy, hogy már konkrét megbízásokat is kapnak, és ebből saját vagyonkájukat is gyarapíthatják. A játékosok a szerény kezdő lehetőségeik ügyes kihasználásával igyekeznek minél több megbízást szerezni és teljesíteni. Az akciók kivitelezéséhez néha kölcsön felvételére is rászorulnak, de szerencsére a helyi kereskedők kiszolgálása elegendő pénzt hoz ahhoz, hogy abból az adósság törlesztésén túl újabb befektetésekre is jusson. Aki a leghamarabb gyűjt össze 32 dirhemet, kiváltja a játék utolsó körét, de a győztes az lesz, aki végül a legnagyobb vagyonnal rendelkezik.

Mindenkinek két opcionális akciója van körönként, és minden akciót mozgásnak kell megelőznie. A játékosok 1-3 lépést tehetnek bármilyen irányban, de körönként egyszer rábízhatják magukat a dobókockára. Ekkor azonban legfeljebb annyit léphetnek, amennyit dobtak. Minden mezőhöz tartozik egy akció: kölcsönt vehetnek fel a pénzváltónál, nemesfémet, drágaköveket vásárolhatnak, eladhatnak és elcserélhetnek a standoknál vagy pavilonoknál, de üzletelhetnek közvetlenül is a megpihenő utazókkal. Az udvar közepén azonban áll egy különleges szökőkút, amely bizonyos akciók során fordul egyet, és ez hatással lehet a játékos bevételére!

A helyi kereskedők kisebb vagy nagyobb megbízásokat adnak. Ezek teljesítése nemcsak a játékosok jövedelmét növeli, de biztosítja a tartozásaik rendezését is, és értékes képességkártyákhoz juttatja őket, amelyek a játék folyamán – vagy a végén – változatos előnyöket nyújtanak. Érdemes minél több nagy értékű megbízást teljesíteni, ugyanis ezek gyűjtése további pontokat hoz a játék végén.

A Caravanserai szórakoztató, kereskedős és erőforrás-menedzselős játék, amely bátran ajánlható családok számára is: szabályai könnyen tanulhatók, a szerencsefaktor enyhíthet a kezdők hátrányán, emellett erős kihívást jelent stratégiai és taktikai oldalon is.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Contracts, Loans, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Mindbug: First Contact – Future Eric Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack Druid from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

3 power

SNEAKY
Play: Put 2 random cards from outside the game on the bottom of your draw pile without looking at them.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Carrera acuática
description:
The rain has stopped, and the stream is brimming with water, awaiting an exciting race where cunning, memory, and wit will be your best allies. Take command of your boat and make crucial decisions as you adapt to changes in the currents.

This is an exclusive game for two people where you'll take turns playing your cards to strategically place your boat card on the anchor card.

Let the adventure begin!
Dare to conquer this aquatic race.

—description from the designer

La lluvia terminó y el arroyo está rebosante de agua te espera una carrera llena de emoción, donde la astucia, la memoria y el ingenio serán tus mejores aliados. Comandá tu barco y toma decisiones importantes a medida que te adaptas a los cambios de las corrientes.
Un juego exclusivo para dos personas en el que jugaran por turnos sus cartas para lograr colocar su carta de barco sobre la carta de ancla.
¡Que la aventura comience!
¡Atrévete a conquistar esta carrera acuática

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Nautical, Racing
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Movement, Pieces as Map, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Balconia
description:
Life in an apartment complex can be hectic at times! Every resident has their own preferences: some dabble in gardening and would like nothing more than to be surrounded by flowers, some are obsessed with cats and are always happy to see one on the balcony next to theirs, and some just want to take a nice long nap. How do you keep everyone happy?

In Balconia, two players build an apartment complex, block by block, by filling a 5х5 grid. Each building block has four sides with different faces, and on a turn one player draws a token to determine which block to place, then chooses which two sides of the building block they might get and which two sides will be left to the opponent — then the other player decides where to place that block. They then swap roles for the next turn. Try your best to fulfill the conditions on the balconies facing you. Who will gain more points by game's end?
mechanics: Connections, I Cut, You Choose
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: The Adventures of Conan
description:
Let your blade be sharp and your heart unyielding, for in the fray, only the bold claim victory!

The Adventures of Conan is an asymmetrical dice game of exploration, sorcery and glorious combat set in the Hyborian age. Players will use a pool of custom dice to control the actions of Conan, his allies, and his Foes as they travel the lands in search of adventure and power.

During a game of The Adventures of Conan you will travel through kingdoms controlling the heroic barbarian Conan, one of his powerful allies, or a scheming foe. Using your custom dice you will pray to the gods for power, explore the world seeking combat and training, and carry out adventures and encounters to unlock bountiful rewards.

Each role brings new challenges and routes to victory. Conan and his ally must work together, but prioritize their own personal goals in their search for victory, all while the Foe plots their downfall - setting traps for the adventurers on their travels.

All of the characters, adventures, and art are drawn from the Dark Horse Comics line of Conan titles, including Conan, Conan the Cimmerian, Conan the Slayer and more.

Are you ready to seize your destiny and leave your mark on this epic saga?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Lenin's Legacy
description:
Lenin’s Legacy is a fast-paced solo or two-player game about the power struggle between Stalin and Trotsky in the early days of the USSR, starting the moment Lenin’s health began to weaken after a failed assassination attempt in 1918 and culminating with Lenin’s death in 1924. Players will take on the role of either Stalin or Trotsky, playing cards from a common display (plus one hidden card each) to gain control of “issues,” such as the NKVD, Politburo, and personal access to Lenin. Cards can also be played for specific historical events, and additional Region and Politician cards may enter play each round, favoring whichever player was able to control the relevant issue in the previous round. Victory can be achieved in three different ways: control of the Army, domination of the Party, or lasting Fame after Lenin’s death. Players must therefore balance short-term gains towards each of these conditions with long-term bonuses from Regions and Politicians, while also ensuring that their opponent is not able to play the cards that will most benefit them. The result is a tense, fast-paced game where every card counts and you always have to stay one step ahead of your opponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Tug of War

name: Pixelino
description: During your journey around the world, you draw the fauna of different habitats. Of course, you need patience to observe them accurately. In this game you fill in very cute pixelated animals on laminated card sheets with erasable markers. The central interesting decision is whether to choose a lot or a little? Obviously, it would be nice to always choose more shapes and larger shapes to make faster progress, but sometimes we need smaller shapes to fill in the holes. The game is quick to learn, but can also be a serious head-scratcher. You have to pay attention to bonuses, habitats and extra objectives also.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Square Grid

name: ALLEGRA Grande
description:
In ALLEGRA Grande, based on the traditional card game „Golf“, you want to keep the score in your display as low as possible.

The deck consists of cards numbered from -2 to 13.
In each round, each player starts with 16 unknown cards facing down. The cards are placed in a grid of 4x4.
Before the game starts, each player randomly turns around two cards.
The left player from the dealer starts the game.
In each turn, we draw 2 cards (either both from the drawing pile or both from the discard pile, or one from the discard pile and one from the drawing pile; here, the order mentioned is binding—first from the discard pile than from the drawing pile) and play them one after another.
But if one player has just one closed card left in the display, he can just draw one card.
We want to reduce the score in the display and/or clear rows or columns.

In ALLEGRA Grande, with its 4x4 (or even 4x5 with 2 players) display, one can clear 4 (or even 5) of the same cards in a row or in a column. Here, you must be careful how to place the cards because you must immediately clear a set of three cards as soon as they are next to each other in a row or column—even if you wanted to collect four cards and clear them later.
To clear four cards, there first must be a gap between them, for example: „3, 4, 3, 3“.
As soon as the 4 in this row is replaced with another 3, all four threes can (must) be immediately cleared.
With 5 cards, it could look like this: „3, 3, 4, 3, 3“. Here it's the same; as soon as the 4 in this row is replaced with another 3, the complete row can (must) be cleared.

This makes chain reactions possible (as seen in the images). It is possible to clear all 16 cards through one chain reaction, but trying it is risky.

We have 3 action cards. The cards could be used as a normal card with just their value or can be activated to use their ability.
The activation just works when the action card is drawn from the drawing pile and is immediately discarded in the same turn to the discard pile. (no activation when drawn from the discard pile or opened in the display!).
After the action, one must open one closed card from the display; it could be any closed card.

The -2:
It's the lowest card, and it's just 4 times in the deck. The -2 allows you to look secretly at all the closed cards in one row or column. Clearly, the next player can now draw this -2 from the discard pile, and he probably will.

The 5:
It is the most common card; it is played 16 times in the deck. Here, one is allowed to look at one closed card secretly.

The 13:
It's a little bit more special than the others. It is the highest card and 10 times in the deck. The action is to discard one open card from the display and replace it with one card from the drawing pile, and this card must stay closed. After that action, no closed card is allowed to be turned open. This is the only possible way to get one more closed card than before. For example in the end of the game when one player has just one closed card left and is just allowed to draw one card out of this reason he can with the 13 get back one more closed card and is allowed to draw 2 cards again.

The Joker:
This card simply stands for every card, but not their actions. If the Joker is next to two identical cards, he immediately mimics them, and one must clear that set. For example „6, J, 6, 1“ the Joker mimics the sixes next to him and you must clear the three cards. So be careful where to place the Joker.

The Swap: Swap 2 cards in your display:
Instead of drawing two cards, one can also swap two cards in their own display. After that, one must open a closed card. Do it before it's too late.

The swap is also perfectly suitable to swap the Joker to the perfect place.

Sometimes one needs to do the so-called „dodging“.
This allows you to replace a card two times at the same place on the display. This also allows you to „defuse“ the action of an action card (especially the 13) when you place the action card first in the display and then again replace the action card with the other card. That means you are allowed to indirectly discard an action card and of course it just works as long as you can draw two cards.

Contrary to the first „ALLEGRA“, we play just in our own display (no column that belongs to a neighbor, and no knocking to switch a card with a player).
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Naturalia
description:
Naturalia is a board game set on an ecological tourist ship that exhibits native and endemic plants of Chile.
The players will be aspiring "exhibition masters" and will have the mission of organizing the species in the best possible way according to the captain's indications and the plants' characteristics in order to obtain the greatest amount of "charm" from their visitors while trying to overcome the obstacle of water scarcity and other events that develop throughout the game.

—description from the publisher

Naturalia es un juego de mesa ambientado en un barco de reserva ecológica turístico que exhibe plantas nativas y endémicas de Chile.
Los jugadores serán aspirantes a "maestro de exhibición" y tendrán la misión de organizar las especies de la mejor manera posible según las indicaciones del capitán y características de las plantas para obtener la mayor cantidad de "encanto" de sus visitantes mientras intentan superar el obstáculo de la escases hídrica y otros eventos que se desarrollen a lo largo de la partida.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Events, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Pulp City
description:
Pulp City is a blockbuster miniature skirmish game set in the 80s, in a fictional town called Pulp City. The vibrant setting draws inspiration from comic books, pulp books and all sorts of nostalgic sentiments while using a very modern and fast gameplay mechanics.

After a successful Kickstarter campaign in 2014, Pulp City: The Supreme Edition upgraded the game experience even more.

- Choose your team from 100+ unique Supremes (characters), there is very few restrictions standing in the way of building the team you love,
- Recruit spandex vigilantes, aliens, robots, undead or dozens of other unlikely heroes and villains,
- Test them in a Plot & Agenda driven games!

Pulp City uses a couple of unique mechanics that make the games blockbuster:

- Roles: A lot like in the video games, each Supreme covers one (or more) battlefield role: from crucial Supports through Leaders, Blasters, Brawlers, Tanks and Infiltrators to mighty Powerhouses. Right composition of the team is the key to winning the games.

- Action Points management - a team shares the pool but the pool is rebuild each round based on the number of surviving Supremes and modified through presence of Support characters,

- Supremes stack dice thanks to the simple system of combat bonuses - winning the Opposed Roll is just a first step, the more high rolls you have, the more FX (think Special Effects in the movies) you cause. From simple extra Damage to hurling your opponent 15 inches back through the battlefield.

- Smart cards system: front of a card is used to recruit a Supreme, back is used during the game and has all of the information requiered - so you will never have to flip the rulebook.

Quickstart rules are available as a free download (http://pulp-city.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/QSGQRS_digit...), each miniature comes with a card that has all of the gameplay information (online store has all cards as pdfs for you to try out for free).

Home Page: http://www.pulp-city.com
mechanics: Action Points

name: World at War: Counterattack
description:
World at War: Counterattack - A scenario expansion pack for Blood and Bridges and Into the Breach.

World at War: Counterattack recreates the American and West German counterattack into the southern flank of the Soviet thrust into West Germany. The battles occurred just after the events chronicled in Blood and Bridges, and prior to the final battles for Paris.

Nine scenarios comprise the module. Four are stand alone, another three make up one campaign, and four more build the second campaign (two of the campaign scenarios can also be played as stand-alone battles). See below for additional details on the scenarios.

The module uses a similar campaign system as the one that we employed in Battles within Battles. Winning scenarios awards the player with refit points, these points can be used to repair damaged units, buy new units, or buy unique skills for your units and leaders The system rewards the gamer who conserves his forces. Win the scenario, but decimate your forces, and you’ll lose the war…. Or at least this small piece of it.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Hexes: Hexagonal Chess
description:
Designed to be the truest, simplest hexagonal variant of chess, Hexes Chess is played on 54 hexagons rather than 64 squares. Though it uses fewer "spaces" and fewer pieces than conventional chess, the hexagonal format greatly increases the mobility of each piece.

If you are familiar with the rules of chess, you will find Hexes Chess to be logical and intuitive. Even if you are new to chess, the illustrated rules sheet will have you playing in minutes.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Solutions
description:
It’s a race against time to fight climate change. You and your friends must work together to reduce global emissions before it’s too late! As you strategically deploy various climate solutions, you will be tested on your knowledge and your ability to prioritize. You will need to think critically about each solution and discuss with your teammates in order to avoid catastrophe.

Solutions is a collaborative, discussion-based game. The solutions in this game are based on Project Drawdown: a framework of climate solutions, developed by a collaboration of over 200 scientists. Project Drawdown shows a path forward to how we can beat climate change by the year 2050. They have ranked 76 climate solutions based on how much impact they can realistically have between 2020-2050, based on technology trends, adoption trends, economics, carbon lifecycle analysis, and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events

name: ATS: The Fuhrers Bunker – Berlin Red Victory
description:
BERLIN, GERMANY, 25 April 1945: In the maze of ruined blocks both sides fought a close quarters war over each building. At the corner of Alt-Mark Strasse and Thorwaldsenstrasse a small group of desperate Germans converted a large building into an urban fortress. Soon the fortress would be put to the test as an assault detachment from the 220th Guards Rifle Regiment reached the intersection. Finding the building defended with artillery and machine guns 1st Lieutenant Vasili Chernyayev ordered the two 45mm antitank guns supporting his force to fire at the upper level windows to suppress the machine guns while his guardsmen stormed the building. Storm troops, leading the attack with hand grenades, broke into the main level of the house and killed a German crew manning a small artillery piece. Another detachment, with the help of direct mortar fire, captured a nearby building that was supporting the main position. As vicious hand-to-hand fighting broke out in the fortress the Germans launched several counter-attacks supported by tanks and self propelled guns. Intense fighting for this position raged on for the rest of the 25th before the Germans withdrew.

THE FUHRERS BUNKER is an expansion for Berlin: Red Victory that provides an additional map and 15 more scenarios to expand your Battle of Berlin action to the maximum level of immersion!

ATS FÜHRER’S BUNKER is a detailed new ATS game that tells the story of the Battle of Berlin with incredible detail. The new street-level map at 50-yards scale links to those of to expand the battlefield to an even larger size. The two linking maps connect to those from BERLIN RED VICTORYTM to create an urban battlefield unlike any in tactical-level gaming history. What’s more, the battlefield includes the location of the Führerbunker, the ultimate victory condition in an ATS scenario.

In keeping with the ATS approach you will receive a stack of small, fast-playing scenarios to get you on that gorgeous map right away. But this is also a monster game that will include a super-sized supply of counters, all you need to play a giant, all-map campaign, included with Fuhrers Bunker!

IN EACH GAME YOU GET:


Two new large linking historical game map that ties into the existing maps from on heavyweight stock;
A new ATS Campaign that plays on the entire mapped game area;
15 new Scenarios printed on 11 separate heavyweight cards;
A snazzy ziploc bag to hold it all.


ATS FÜHRER’S BUNKER includes a new Battlefield Walkaround booklet, and a pile of play aids to use with the monster scenario. Included in the booklet are the new machine-gun and Collateral Fire rules, as well as a new counter sheet of 280 die-cut counters containing the new markers you’ll need to make your Berlin wargaming 100% ATS state-of-the-art.

Are you ready to fight for the Hitler-city of the Third Reich, block by bloody block until your personal leader counter is knocking on the door to the Führerbunker, ready to enter and end World War II at long last?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Dark X-Men Team Pack
description: The Marvel Dice Masters: Dark X-Men Team Pack features the most recognizable members of this dark mirror to the X-Men, including Dark Beast, Thunderbird, Mimic, and several other antiheroes making their very first appearance in Dice Masters. Team Packs each include 24 cards and 16 dice, representing eight different characters, and can be combined with any Dice Masters boxed set.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Nekojima: Collector's Edition
description:
In Nekojima, “The Island of Cats” in Japan, an electricity network is developing to supply the various lively districts of the island. The installation of electric poles becomes more complex due to the narrowness of the territory and its curious population of cats strolling on the cables.

Nekojima is a wooden game of skill and dexterity in which you have to keep an entire installation in balance. Players take turns placing or stacking denchuu — 電柱, or electrical poles — respecting the locations without any hanging cables touching. Be careful not to be the one to bring down the structure. This game requires reflection, concentration and skill.

In competition, the player who knocks down the structure loses.
In co-operation, the goal is to go as far as possible.

The Collector's Edition include the base game, a wooden box and contains several expansions from the Kickstarter campaign as:

Torii Extension:
Obviously, nothing should touch the Torii, neither the cables, nor the poles, nor the cats.

The Lazy Cats:
Cats will land on the poles and prevent you from piling up

Tsunami expansion:
Hanging cats must face dangerous waves that disturb their tranquility. When a red flag is raised, it means the neighborhood is ravaged and the cats must seek refuge in another safe district.

More Cats:
Introduces new and more capricious cats: the calico cat, the red cat and the tabby cat.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Krimi Total Fall 7: Die Party der Intrigen
description:
General info on "Krimi Total": Murder mystery game in which players act out their role and try to solve the mystery.

Info on this particular case: A group of very young and very successful people (estate agent, bestseller author, actor, pop star, designer, professional boxer, model, exchange student) are invited to a party at a luxurious mansion to celebrate their success stories. Then one of their friends is found dead. What happened? Who is the murderer? This is what the players try to find out through discussions and deduction. The murderer is allowed to lie, all the others have to tell the truth about their characters if asked for information.

In "Party der Intrigen" there are 8 obligatory roles (can't be played with less than 8): 4 male, 4 female. One optional role, the inspector, can be either male or female.
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: 星杯传说: 跃动的幻之星尘
description: 《星杯传说——跃动的幻之星尘》 is a mini-expansion of Asteriated Grail. There are two brand new character (No.26 and No.29)and one corrected character (No.28) in the expansion.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: 上海一逸文化传播有限公司

name: Spirits of Carter Mansion
description:
Spirits of Carter Mansion is a Social Deception Microgame where you are the Spirits that Haunt the large estate.

The neighbours child has kicked their Soccer ball in through the upstairs window of the estate your spirit has been trapped in, and your fellow spirits are in turmoil as to what to do. The good spirits want to help the kid navigate the ever shifting rooms of the old house, where as the more sinister spirits are trying to sneakily lure them into the basement to never return...

Spirits of Carter Mansion is an 18 card game, where players navigate through the different rooms of the mansion, and use their unique effects to inch closer or further from their goal. In order to enter a room, you must convince the other players that your room is the best choice, and convince that you are in fact a good spirit. Beware of the treachery of the evil spirits trying to convert other players to their sinister ways, or their deceptive words, as they try and steer the neighbours child towards the basement.

Each turn players will play a card from their hand which represents a room for the child to travel into, each player then makes a case for why their room should be picked, and the chosen room is then navigated into. Evil Spirits will try and trick the group into journeying into the basement, whilst good spirits must try and maintain justice and level-headed thinking through the rooms.

The game ends once either victory condition is met, the Good players must travel, and retrieve the Soccer Ball, and return to the entrance, whilst the Evil team must journey into the Basement (however if the basement is entered with the Soccer Ball, the ball is lost in another room, and good gets another chance to continue!). If either Victory condition is met, all the players of that alignment win!

Spirits of Carter Mansion relies on clever bluffs, subtle team work, social deception and Luck for players to successfully navigate the perils of the haunted estate!
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Team-Based Game

name: ATS: Ponyri – Metalgods
description:
This is an Advanced Tobruk System expansion game that allows players to recreate squad-level action from World War II. This expansion game, like all complete games and expansion games in the Advanced Tobruk System, uses the same ruleset from the system rulebook. Gameplay is the same for all games and expansions. It also comes with a Battlefield Walkaround booklet that points out landscape and terrain features specific to the game’s maps, and a few game-specific rules to reflect the unique circumstances the title portrays. Rules additions and changes are kept to a minimum allowing players to get started right away!

In ATS, players alternate using impulses to move and fire infantry squads, armored vehicles and Heavy Weapons, to fulfill or deny completion of a scenario’s Victory Conditions. Each scenario sets the victory conditions that one side must complete to be victorious, and the opposing player must prevent. Draws are sometimes possible. The counters have the overhead view of AFVs and vehicles debuted in wargaming with Avalon Hill’s TOBRUK. Vehicles and guns come on 3/4" counters, infantry on a 5/8" counters, and status markers remain on 1/2" counters.

Each new game or expansion in ATS drops you into a historical theater, and a specific locale within to give you an up close, and sometimes eyeball to eyeball perspective, with scenarios based or inspired by historical actions, all at 50 yards per hex.

This Expansion comes with 2 large historical linking maps covering the firefights near Ponyri Station, during the Battle of Kursk, 1943. Includes 18 scenarios on the 18th Panzer Division's assault against Soviet fortified positions. Most scenarios play on one map. One "monster" scenario uses both maps.

ATS Ponyri component list:

2 linking mapsheets
18 scenarios on 11 cards
1 Battlefield Walkaround booklet
2 small countersheets (5 rows with zb obr 39 25|A H|AA in upper left corner)
1 countersheet German Personnel
1 countersheet EF1
1 countersheet ATS New Russian Personnel 1

NOT A COMPLETE GAME.

Ownership of any Eastern Front ATS complete game is required to play this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Flames of War: Eastern Front 1942-1943
description:
The Revised and Expanded edition of the 2006 book Ostfront.

A Flames of War sourcebook for mid-war conflicts on the Eastern Front. Includes a brief historical overview of the Eastern Front ca. 1942-1943, but is primarily composed of listings of organization/composition, special rules and point values for units within the German, Finnish, Hungarian, Italian, Romanian and Soviet forces participating in this theater.

Per design notes from the Flames of War website:
'Following from North Africa, Eastern Front is a major revamp of Ostfront, one of our mid-war compendia. Like North Africa it brings our old books up to our latest standards with the new company organisation diagrams, complete listings rather than modifications for variants, and better overall organisation. It has also undergone a comprehensive re-pointing to bring all of the forces into line and incorporate the last four years of experience.'
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Cult: Asmodée
description:
Adds a Cult Sheet for Asmodeus (Asmodée in French), included in the French first edition of the game and later from conventions.



Text

Sceau d'AsmodéeRituel : Vous placez un Prêtre disponible d'Influence au moins égale à 5 sur la Fiche de culte.

Mettez une Pièce de monnaie sur un Lieu dépourvu de Pièce de monnaie dont let numéro est le plus petit.



ObsédéSacrifice : Une Pièce de monnaie placée par vous sur le Lieu actif est remise dans la réserve.

Renvoyez toutes les cartes Privilège visibles sous leur pile, puis révélez-en 3 nouvelles sur les emplacements prévus. Vous pouvez prendre gratuitement une de ces cartes si c'est une Personnalité.




Forme trompeuseRituel : Vous placez un Prêtre disponible d'Influence au moins égale à 5 sur la Fiche de culte.

Piochez 2 cartes Privilège. Si vous piochez une Personnalité de cette façon, retournez la Fiche de culte côté Aspect de lumière.



Casser le sceauSacrifice : Une Pièce de monnaie placée par vous sur le Lieu actif est remise dans la réserve.

L'Influence de votre culte sur le Lieu actif est égale à 40. Piochez 1 carte Miracle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Worker Placement

name: Family Plot: Heroes Expansion Deck
description:
The SUPER HERO Expansion Pack is a SUPER HERO-THEMED Expansion pack with all-new Hero family, Action, Modifier, Reaper, Angel and Family Tree cards! Don't miss out on all the HERO goodness!!!

This pack contains 20 ALL-NEW cards which can be folded directly into your core deck and also allow you to add another player to your game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Mindbug: First Contact – Jazz Dog Promo Card
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

Card description:
At the end of your turn, if an enemy creature blocked this turn and is still in play, take control of it.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Adventure Tactics: Side Quest Guide Book 2 – Beyond the Tower
description:
This book contains six bonus encounters, each one created by a special guest designer. These encounters are outside of the main Adventure Tactics campaign, and you can experience them in one of three different ways:

• As a one-shot adventure with brand new heroes
• As a side-quest with your main party of heroes
• As a progressive challenge for brand new heroes
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: CATAN: Starfarers  –  New Encounters
description:
CATAN – Starfarers – New Encounters adds three exciting new scenarios with unique rules to CATAN - Starfarers for an even more epic race to explore the galaxy. This set of three separate scenarios adds new plastic pieces with space amoebas and pirate capsules, a new lost-people sector, game boards and tokens that bring the scenarios to life in epic sci-fi fashion.

Discover a lost civilization
The council chose you to resume the search for the long forgotten "Lost People". You must prepare for the long search and be thorough if we hope to find them.

Defeat a galactic threat
The infamous pirate leader Hog Kahm has returned! Defeat and question his accomplices to uncover Hog's location and bring him to justice.

Encounter mysterious new lifeforms
A pair of giant space amoebas have been detected in our system. Find out more about these mysterious creatures and stop the chaos before it's too late.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Ancient World: The Sacred Cave
description:
A downloadable mini-expansion created for Kulkmanns' G@mebox SPIEL14-reports.

Rules: When a player sends a citizen here, he may pay 1 coin to temporarily gain 1 sword. He may then immediately draw the top 3 Titans and attack one of them. This temporary sword can count for additional Titan attacks in the round.

Although technically compatible with The Ancient World (Second Edition), this tile and two others like it are not included in the latter edition because other new elements in the game cover the same ground in better ways.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: The Ancient World: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
Two District cards not included in the box. Provided to backers of the 2014 Kickstarter campaign.

One District allows a player to build Empire cards immediately when using the Explore action. The other provides extra income, and a two card bonus when using the Explore action.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3050 Upgrade
description:
Technological Renaissance

General Aleksandr Kerensky and three-quarters of the Star League Defense Force departed human-occupied space more than two hundred and fifty years ago, only to return in 3050 as the Clans: a society dedicated to the highest warrior ideals and bent on conquering the Inner Sphere. With their superior technology and OmniMechs, they almost proved unstoppable, before their defeat at Tukayyid and its fifteen year truce. The year is 3070, and while the Truce of Tukayyid has expired, the Jihad rages. The Inner Sphere 'Mechs hastily upgraded with field modifications to counter the Clans are proving their worth, as notable pilots rise to become heroes and new, more time tested variants - sporting weapons right out of R&D labs - make their presence felt, while the Clan OmniMechs continue to prove they are still the cutting edge of military technology.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3050 Upgrades fully updates this venerable product, fleshing out the history of each design, including notable MechWarriors/pilots, as well as providing fresh illustrations. Additionally, all the 'Mechs, vehicles and aerospace fighters originally found in the now out-of-print Technical Readout: 2750 are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Demon Ship
description:
Grab your blaster and battleaxe and stomp into the depths of the Demon Ship. A solo micro tabletop game written by Malev!

You are the Survivor, the last remaining crew member on a Spaceship caught in an interdimensional portal. Demonic creatures now prowl every corner of the ship, threatening to stop you from escaping, but that’s handy for you because you are awesome and those Demons invaded the wrong vessel.

Can you restore power to the ship, engage the emergency protocols (and the self-destruct sequence) and escape before it all goes to hell? Demon Ship is an approachable, fast paced micro game that takes up minimal time and space. Using unique mechanics, basic D6s and a handful of miniatures, this game challenges players to use their wits and a fair bit of luck to blast their way out of the doomed Demon Ship.

The starter box contains:

1 x 45 page Demon Ship rule booklet
Free PDF included
1 x Token Sheet
1 x Resin Survivor Miniature
2 x Resin Blade Demon Miniatures
1 x Resin Gun Demon Miniature
1 x Resin Frog Demon Miniature
1 x 6"x6"x2" Game Box


NOTE: You will need to provide 9 D6 dice.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flames of War: Battle of El Alamein – War in the Desert
description:
El Alamein is your introduction to the exciting world of Flames Of War, the world's most popular World War II miniatures game.

Flames of War has now reached its 4th Edition and is bigger (and smaller) than ever! With a new Rulebook that focuses on the Mid-war (1942 - 1943) depicting battles in the desert, also the book is slimmer than previous editions but retains all the tactical challenges that you have come to expect from Flames of War.

Accompanying the book is a massive range of new miniatures, accessories and paint sets.

Contains:

1x Plastic Panzer IV
1x Plastic Panzer III
1x Plastic Grant
2x Plastic Crusaders
2x Plastic Tank Commander Sprues
Flames Of War 4th Edition Mini Rulebook
1x Flames Of War 'Start Here' Booklet
2x Terrain Cards
6x Dice
8x Unit Cards
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Great War at Sea: Remember the Maine
description:
Game description from the publisher:

When the American battleship Maine exploded in Havana's harbor, U.S. president William McKinley demanded that Spain withdraw from Cuba and ordered the U.S. Navy to blockade the Caribbean island. Spain declared war two days later, sending an ill-equipped fleet to the Caribbean to back up its four-centuries-old claim.

The fighting lasted less than four months, with Spain suffering a smashing defeat. It would take three-quarters of a century for Spanish democracy and constitutionalism to recover from the "Disaster of '98." The United States, meanwhile, had entered the world stage as a Great Power, completely changing the outlook of Americans both at home and abroad.

Great War at Sea: Remember the Maine is a complete boxed game in the Great War at Sea game series, based on the Spanish-American naval war in the Caribbean Sea. There are 45 scenarios covering all the battles and operations that took place, and many that could have taken place. There are also battle scenarios for the actions in the Philippines. All of the pieces necessary to play the game are present: a 34 x 22-inch map of the central Caribbean basin, a 24 x 24-inch tactical map, 100 "long" double-sized ship pieces and 80 standard-sized pieces, all of them laser-cut and mounted.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Ultimate Magic Add-On Deck
description:
Whether you're an arcane or divine spellcaster, you need the magical boon cards included in this exciting new player deck for the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game! Loaded with spells and magic items galore, the Ultimate Magic Add-On Deck can be used with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game character or Adventure Path. Or you can play with the character included in this 109-card box: Enora, the iconic arcanist!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: The Balthazar Stone
description:
Can you unlock the ancient chest, find the Balthazar Stone and break the ancient curse?

Join Elsa Winslow on her journey to Sharktooth Island. To solve the mystery, you must unlock an ancient treasure chest, find Balthazar’s Stone and break its ancient curse.

Similar to an escape room game, this mystery presents you with a wooden chest locked a metal combination lock, and leaves you to work out how to open it and find and solve the mystery.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Expansion
description: Sword & Shield is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Collection Sword & Shield. The set introduces Generation VIII and Pokémon-V in the card game.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Kennen Sie Traxenbichl ?
description: In this game there is a huge map and some postcards. On these postcards are pictures from towns. But not easy stuff like the Eiffel Tower in Paris. No it is really hard stuff. Nobody has a clue. Now on every round (time is limited by a sand clock) a card is read out loud. There are more or less good tips on the cards about how to find the place. The first one who finds the place wins the game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Starmada X: Brigade
description:
Starmada X: Brigade is a source book for The Universal Game of Starship Combat, providing background and starship designs for seven different factions, each taken from Brigade Models' excellent line of starship miniatures.

The 72 different ship classes included in this book have each been designed by players of Starmada. They present a wide variety of philosophies and strategies, illustrating the flexibility of the most comprehensive starship construction system available in any space combat wargame.

Brigade includes the complete rules for Starmada X X, allowing you to start blasting your opponents into just so much space dust right away!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Race Condition
description:
Race Condition is a card game that allows competing players to modify a shared computer program represented by playing cards.

Game cards and counters are arranged on a table top to represent the order of and relationship between instructions, the current instruction, and the values of variables. Competing players take turns modifying the computer program until one of them achieves his or her objective of setting a variable to a particular value. Players accomplish their goals by appending instructions to the program, and by performing special actions such as inserting, deleting, or moving instructions. As the players modify the program, it advances, modifying variables and potentially moving players closer to or further from their objectives.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Occult Adventures Character Deck 1
description:
Description from the publisher:
