Fought in inhospitable terrain and terrible climatic conditions, United States as well as Commonwealth troops from Canada and The UK launched an offensive that General Bernard Law Montgomery hoped would finally bring them over the Rhine and a war-ending victory.

Scale:
1 hex represents 1.5 miles across
1 turn represents 2 days of real time
The game consists of 15 turns.

Military formations are:
1) Infantry are either battalion, regiment, brigade of kamprgruppe.
2) Armour is in brigades or regiments.
3) Air units mark were airstrikes occur.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Schutze Games

name: Supermarina II: The Second Part of the Mediterranean War – Volume IV in Larry Bond's Command at Sea Series
description:
Part II of the Mediterranean Naval War; July, 1941 to August, 1942.

While Rommel's Afrika Korps was capturing the attention of the world, its fate was being decided in the Mediterranean sea. No matter how brilliantly the Field Marshal and his troops performed, the struggle could not be won without the supplies and equipment necessary to fight.

Supermarina II, Volume 4 in Larry Bond's Game: Command at Sea portrays the apex of the struggle for naval supremacy in the Mediterranean, the vital supply link for both the Axis and Allied sides in North Africa.

Containing two dozen new scenarios, Supermarina II shows the full range of operations that were the naval war in the Mediterranean Sea. Covering the period from July of 1941 to August of 1942, Supermarina II details everything - from U-boat attacks on battleships and aircraft carriers, to all out big-gun fleet engagements between battleships and cruisers.

There are several scenarios that are highly suitable for solitaire play, a campaign scenarios depicting the many vicious Malta convoy battles, including Operations Harpoon, Pedestal, Vigorous and Halberd. Also the classic surface engagements of First and Second Sirte, as well as the battles of the Malta striking forces.

You must own Supermarina I to play this module.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Astromachia
description:
Astromachia is a starship combat simulation boardgame for two or more players. Normally, each player controls one ship, but experienced players should be able to fly three or four ships without too much difficulty.

Astromachia is distinguished from other games in this genre by three features: fast, highly interactive play; realistic Newtonian movement; and a strong sense of three-dimensionality.

Players alternate taking very simple actions, such as maneuvering, angling shields, or firing a weapon. This prevents long waits for a chance to do something.

Movement follows Newton's laws of motion. A ship doesn't always move in the direction it is facing. Furthermore, if a ship gets going too fast in one direction, it has to turn around and fire its engines to slow down.

Astromachia is fully three-dimensional. Ships can fly at different altitudes, and can move up or down as easily as moving north, south, east, or west. (These directions are with reference to the local star system, not to a planet.) A ship can have any of 24 different orientations, and is damaged differently depending on whether the damage is coming from the fore, aft, port, starboard, dorsal, or ventral side.
mechanics: Action Points, Simulation

name: Ultraforce
description:
This is the third product from the AutoVentures line – a series of auto-combat adventure modules by Aaron Allston.

This module includes some maps, Battlecars cards and a fairly extensive quick combat system (much improved from the one presented in Hell on Wheels.) Full games stats are included for Battlecars, Car Wars and Highway 2000, allowing the game to be played with any of these systems, or by itself using the provided quick combat system.

Like the other modules, Ultraforce includes a background of the world of 2012, (including this time a focus on the Ultraforce team and the American Southeast) and an adventure designed to be game-mastered against one or more players playing the Ultraforce team. Lots of extra background information is provided so this could be used as a starting point for a much larger campaign. Two complete scenarios are provided, pitting the Ultraforce teams ATVs and hybrid aircraft/motorcycles against a variety of opponents, eventually pitting them up against a giant Juggernaut.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Transportation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Verlorene Siege
description:
Players play the campaign of German-Soviet war in 1941-45. Verlorene Siege (Lost Victories in German) consists of 528 pieces , a 59 x 84 cm map(printed in Japanese) and 30 pages of rules(in Japanese). Western part of Russia to eastern part of German is printed in a map. Turn length is a month and units are corps or armies. Player numbers are one or two and playing time is from four hours.

Solitaire Suitability:High(on a scale of Low-Medium-High)
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The Battle of Marathon 490 B.C.
description:
Another in the series from the "Age of Battles" line of games, with the excellent components and production values as the previous ones. There are translations for the Rules in English(from Russian), as well as their superb MINIS included, and the many other 'notable' Terrain 'features' with these. A very decent approach to bringing the 'Army Men' boxes into gameplay, as most of US are desirous for them to become more actively involved.

One of the six Age of Battles: Napeonic Wars – Rulebook (3rd Edition) Ancients table-top miniatures gaming system using 1/72 scale miniatures.

Game Components:

Two sets of miniatures
45 Greek Infantry (8005)
42 Persian Infantry (8006)

8 Regiment Cards
8 Regiment Stands
4 sheets of paper table-top terrain
1 D20 dice
2 Rulers (first edition are cardboard, second edition are plastic)
1 Pen
1 Angle Pattern
1 Turning Template
1 Rule Book
1 Scenario Booklet with character sheets
Trees (first edition are cardboard, second edition are plastic)


Zvezda 8203
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The Card Game
description: The Carddass Masters G Neon Genesis Evangelion Card Game is a trading card game set in the world of the Japanese animation Neon Genesis Evangelion. Each player, using the cards he has on hand, tried to achieve the Consummation of one of the main characters in the Evangelion universe: Shinji, Rei, Asuka, Misato, Ritsuko, or Gendou. Although the game is playable with two players, three to five players is best.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Waterloo 1815
description:
This game is a simulation of the battle of Waterloo.

400 counters
One turn = 20 minutes
One hex = 200 meters
6 pages rules book (+scenarios and historical background)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Piquet: Forgotten Heroes
description:
Forgotten Heroes provides a complete package to allow you to recreate the Vietnam War. The rules will work equally well for those who want to depict the early Search and Destroy days of the war against the VC and for those who want to recreate the desperate days of the 1975 collapse. In general, the Vietnam War was fought at the company level, with the platoon of 2 - 4 squads (representing anywhere from 20 to over 40 men) being the basic maneuver element. Previously, this scale has been neglect by most miniatures rules dealing with the Vietnam War, which have focused on the individual's perspective. Forgotten Heroes enables the you to command a full infantry company (of 3 - 4 platoons) or more, and the accompanying assets, in a way no other Vietnam War era rules set has done before. It is only in this Scale that the gamer can really recreate the village sweeps, helicopter insertions into hot LZs, assaults on bunker complexes, VC convoy ambushes, riverine actions, and fire base assaults, that typified the major actions of this conflict.

Forgotten Heroes includes rules for the unique aspects of the Vietnam War. These rules include the following: VC/NVA tunnel systems, riverine craft, civilians, caches and stores, rules of engagement, booby traps, ground surveillance radar, command detonated mines, night combat effects, and many more. Forgotten Heroes also includes special event cards that can be added to the normal sequence decks, such as Chieu Hoi, DiDi Mau, General Visits Front, Hearts and Minds, Media Circus, the dreaded FUBAR, and more.

Forgotten Heroes bas been designed to be as accessible as possible to both a newcomer to the Vietnam War and he gaming veteran. The rules include information on the varied equipment used in the war and full TO&Es for the US Army, US Marine Crops, ARVN, Australians, Viet Cong, and NVA. Two introductory scenarios are included, as a bonus supplement, rules are provided for the First Indochina War including sequence decks, equipment and weapon lists, and TO& Es for the French and Viet Minh.

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Mighty Midgets: Scenarios & Rules for Small Craft in WWII – An Expansion for Command at Sea
description:
From the back of the box: During World War II, battles involving battleships and aircraft carriers overshadowed the daring exploits of motor torpedo boats and motor gunboats. However, these Mighty Midgets performed invaluable services, venturing out night after night to attack enemy naval, air and ground forces. They operated in every major theater of the war, from the warm waters of the Pacific and the Mediterranean, to the frigid fjords of the Barents Sea. This module contains 31 historical scenarios featuring small craft (American PT, German S boats, etc.), including interdependent scenarios in a campaign setting. A special role-playing section has been included that allows players to take on the role of a squadron commander, creating battle plans that depend on the skill and morale levels of his crews for victory or defeat.
New data and modifications to the Command at Sea (CaS) game system (small craft damage, impulse movement, etc.) are introduced in this module. To scale down the CaS system to a level that covers damage by light weapons as small as .30 and .50 caliber machine guns took some tinkering, but the scenario design team of Dave Schueler and Bill Madison, along with the rules/data team of Chris Carlson and Larry Bond were up to the challenge. This module is a great addition to the CaS library and significantly expands the engagements that players can now re-create.

Contents
-New rules for operating small ships
-Thirty-one new scenarios
-A Motor Torpedo Boat campaign
-New data for small ships
-Data for ships not presented in earlier modules

Note: This module is not a complete game in itself. You must have the standard rules to Command at Sea and the Rising Sun Data Annexes, second edition or later, to play all the scenarios.

Expands (all are required):

Command at Sea
The Rising Sun: Command at Sea Volume I
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Great Battles of World War Two: Volume I – The Canadians in Europe
description:
From the

Bruce McFarlane's 4th miniatures guide-book covering large battles.

Each stand represents a company with maneuver elements being battalions.

The scale and scope of the game allows multi-divisional actions simulating weeks not minutes.

There is no game out there like Great Battles of World War II.
Canadian History, Organization, Weapons and Tactics.

A simple yet revolutionary rules set; 8 Scenarios
Dieppe, Agira, Ortona, Juno Beach, Falaise (Totalize I, Totalize II, Tractable) & Hochwald
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Benelux Rails
description: A web-published variant of the well-known Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games. This game takes place on a much smaller map than the traditional games in the series and is therefore limited to only 2-3 players.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Swarm: A Collectible "Board" Game
description:
Swarm is a turn based abstract strategy game where opponents strive to take over the Hive, or board by eliminating other swarms. Game pieces move across a number of hexagonal spaces determined by the number of pieces in the stack (called a swarm), and stack and unstack upon landing on specific spaces.
Opponents are eliminated by landing on their spaces, or "stinging" them. 2-player, 3-player, and 6-player boards are currently available. There are many board variations, but only three are currently in print. There are also a variety of spaces which have different properties to enhance game strategy.

Home Page: http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/swarmplayer/
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: ATS: Surprised Outside of Strass
description:
This is an expansion for use with any Advanced Tobruk System game containing US and German forces. The Hurtgen Forest is the setting for SURPRISED OUTSIDE OF STRASS and an all new 24” x 18” map brings you to the shattered village of Strass and its outskirts. It is December 1944 and the men of the 3rd Infantry Battalion of the 330th Infantry Regiment, 83rd Infantry Division are advancing out of the dark, damp Hurtgen Forest..

Includes four brand new scenarios that play on a 24" x 18" historical map, Battlefield Walkaround, and ALL AFV CARDS needed for play.

Expands:

Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Master Europa 101: Eastern Front
description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module covers the games "Fire in the East", "Scorched Earth", and "Urals". It contains 8 new counters for use with the new logistics system.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Le Grandi Manovre
description:
Le Grandi Manovre - Nozioni di Arte Militare

The Great Maneuvers - Knowledge of the Military Art. A full color 4 fold map representing a battlefield with elevations, tactical and operational targets as well as HQ and supply points. Extremely advanced use of terrain and units.

There are multiple lead miniatures representing different artillery, tank, air units, cavalry, infantry and armored cars. A chart of terrain and movement values is the center piece of the game (included on the inside of the box top) and this appears to be a true wargame created right before the advent of WWII.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid

name: TARSIS
description:
This game takes place in the 4th century BC in the renowned civilization of Tartessos, in southern Iberia, During these times the Tartessians were ruled by the legendary king Arganthonios.
Each player will take the role of an Aristoi, a wealthy noble ruling over lands and villages where craftsmen, farmers and stockbreeders lived.
The goal of the game is to achieve the highest recognition by collecting luxury items that will increase the Aristoi’s social prestige. These items were mainly obtained by exchanging with the Phoenician traders the products and commodities the Aristois obtained through their lands and workers.
The game finishes as soon as the Tartessian culture is absorbed by Carthage. At that given time only the most educated and wealthy Aristoi will survive –namely, the ones with the most luxury items in their possession.

The game is played in a series of rounds. Each round has three major phases, with some additional trading and taxing phases.
The three main phases are:
- Auctioning occupations and lands
- Collecting commodities and products
- Auctioning luxury items

Awards
2009 Accesit (2º place) - Fira JugarxJugar
2008 Finalist Concurso de diseño de juegos E-2008
Festival internacional de Juegos de Cordoba 2008


Nos encontramos en la mítica civilización de Tartessos, cerca de la ciudad fenicia de Gadir (Cádiz). Estamos en el reinado del mítico rey Argantonio en el siglo VI antes de cristo.
Cada jugador representa un Aristoi - rico terrateniente - que domina una serie de terrenos y poblados y que tiene artesanos, agricultores y ganaderos a su servicio.
El objetivo de cada jugador es conseguir el mayor reconocimiento ante su rey mediante la posesión de objetos de lujo que aumentan su estatus social, Se consiguen intercambiandolos a los comerciantes fenicios por materias primas y productos que producen sus terrenos y artesanos.
El juego termina cuando la cultura cartaginesa absorbe a la cultura tartesia, sobreviviendo la familia más culta y con más poder, ganando el jugador que sume más puntos en sus objetos de lujo.

El juego se realiza por turnos, siguiendo una secuencia de juego, con dos fases diferenciadas, y acciones entre ellas de comercio, impuestos, etc.
Las principales son las
- Subasta de nuevos terrenos y artesanos
- Cobro de materias primas/productos
- Subasta de objetos de lujo

Premios
2009 Accesit (2º lugar) - Fira JugarxJugar
2008 Finalista Concurso de diseño de juegos E-2008
Festival internacional de Juegos de Cordoba 2008
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Trading

name: Railway Rivals Map M: London and the Midlands
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers England from London in the South up to Wolverhampton derbu and Lincoln on the north - roughly the bottom half of Map B. Like Map B it is pretty wide open, with small hills well spaced out, so it is a good starter map. Two in seven runs are special runs to map edges.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Dice Rolling
publishers: Fairmount Gaming Simulations Co., Rostherne Games

name: Nuklear Winter '78
description:
The former German territory, transformed into a wasteland by the nuclear holocaust that ended the Second World War in 1946, is the hostile setting of a new conflict between old enemies clenched in a struggle for the future of mankind.

Surviving Nazi leaders and Wehrmacht forces resurface in 1978 from underground shelters to rebuild an empire from the ashes of the world. Oblivious of the climatic, technological and political changes inflicted by more than 20 years of nuclear winter, they are about to face the mysterious Black Hand - elusive, abhorrent masters of the wastes, and the combined might of the modern, highly mechanized and versatile NATO alliance.

Nuklear Winter 78 was a free print & play, tactical, platoon level simulation. The 15 campaign-linkable scenarios for 1-3 players depict the triumvirate struggle for power around Wewelsburg in the former central Germany, now a barren wasteland known as the Zone. The game contains:

one rulebook (24 pages)
one playbook (20 pages)
one single sided map
two countersheets (280 counters)
three player aids







News 2/3/2010



Nuklear Winter is no longer a Print & Play game as it is in re-development to be produced as a game for Lock 'n Load Publishing, LLC. under the title Nuklear Winter '68





Re-implemented as Nuklear Winter '68.
categories: Fantasy, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid

name: San Quentin Kings: Folsom Blood
description:
Folsom Blood:
Players experience the history of Folsom State Prison, California's second oldest prison after San Quentin. Known for it's harsh conditions, gang leaders must now avoid injuring their members. The political pull of the warden and lawyers may become a problem, or could work in a leader's favor. Also, throughout Folsom's infamous history many notable prisoners have served time, Timothy Leary, Sonny Barger, and Charles Manson are only a few. Player's must aim to earn their respect.

An expansion for the base game San Quentin Kings, need base game to play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Blast City Games, Past Into Print Publishing

name: BattleTech: The Falcon and the Wolf
description:
From the back of the book:

For years, the bitter rivalry between the warriors of the Wolf Clan and the Jade Falcons simmered. Then in June of 3057, growing political tensions among the fearsome invaders erupted in a bloody war of attrition. From the mountains of Colmar to the icy wastelands of Morges, the armies of these ancient enemies clashed in a dramatic duel to the death.

The Falcon and the Wolf is a BattleTech scenario pack that describes the epic Trial of Refusal between the Wolf and Jade Falcon Clans described in the BattleTech novel Bred for War. Filled with historical notes and personal accounts of the Trial, game scenarios, and special Clan rules, The Falcon and the Wolf provides everything the BattleTech player needs to recreate the battles of this major intraClan conflict.

User comment:

Although there are only 12 scenarios in this scenario pack, it was the first strictly Clan vs Clan scenario pack produced by FASA. While it doesn't add any new equipment or 'Mechs to the game, it does function as an update on the strengths and locations of the various units from the two Clans, which adds some utility to this sourcebook beyond the scenarios themselves.

This scenario pack is currently out of print, and isn't available from the current licence holder.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: stern Wissensquiz: die sechziger Jahre
description: This quiz game is for 2-4 players or teams. The questions are all about the sixties. The nice twist in this game is that all players including the player who asked the question put a token (with the answer they think is the correct one) in the middle. Than they are all revealed and the questioner gets points according to the number of righ answers. 4 correct answers gives him 1 point, 3 give 2 points, 2 give 3 points and 1 correct answer gives him 4 points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Perdition to King George!
description:
Perdition to King George! (PKG) is a study of two hypothetical events in the history of the Jacobite Movement: the plots to overthrow the Georgian regime of Britain by landing Swedish, or alternatively, Spanish troops in Britain.

The famous Swedish monarch, Charles XII, was sympathetic to the Jacobite Cause, and in the years 1717-1719 was not that far away, fighting the Danes in Norway. Rumours have it he was preparing a base of operations for an invasion of England or Scotland with 12,000 men; James Edward Stuart, the Old Pretender, would be set up as a puppet king. In the event, Charles XII was killed in 1718 and the plots came to nothing, but what if he had not died?

With the death of the Last Viking, the Jacobites were forced to look for another backer, and found it in Spain, where the shifty Cardinal Alberoni was engineering a war against France that would ultimatey drag in the Empire and the English. (It should be noted that the Jacobites' traditional supporter, France, now under an insecure and anglophilic Regent, the Duc d'Orleans, was uninterested in helping them. Indeed, d'Orleans offered a brigade of French troops to help England stave off the threat of a new Spanish Armada!) In the event, the Armada was wrecked, but a small independent party of Jacobites and Spanish soldiers did land on Scotland's rugged west coast, even fighting a battle with loyalist troops before surrendering.

Either invasion could have succeeded. King George I of England took the blame for most of the country's ills following the late War of the Spanish Succession. He relied too much on his Whig friends, which on the one hand gave Parliament more power over royal affairs than ever before, and on the other, encouraged many who would not otherwise have done so to support the Jacobite Cause of restoring the Stuart dynasty. Furthermore, Scotland had suffered a political union with England in 1707, and many in that country were unhappy. The Swedes and or the Spanish would be seen as liberators (the Swedes with the advantage of their Protestant faith, the Spanish with the advantage of closer ties to James Stuart, Scotland's "true" king).
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Captain's Log #10
description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Special Tactics Issue

Featured Scenarios: The Orions engage in a tractor pull over an alien derelict. The scout Crockett duels with a Romulan Frigate. Romulan fighters attack a Gorn squadron. Klingon PFs track a Federation saucer. Klingon and Kzinti squadrons battle in an Ion Storm. The Coalition and Alliance battle in the last stages of Operation Cavalry.

Also features: Tactics, New Hydran SSDs, Federation & Empire Q&A, Fiction, info on Doomsday edition of SFB, & a preview of the Prime Directive RPG.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: The Harvest
description:
Each player is running their own vineyard. You are attempting to grow grapes and sell them to increase your wealth and also undertake research to improve your knowledge so that you are able to grow each grape harvest more efficiently.

The game is card based and during each turn you typically play a card from your hand and then draw another card from the draw pile.

The game goes over a number of rounds. Each round is ended when one of the players undertakes a grape harvest. The person who harvests is able to gain wealth while their opponent has the potential to improve their knowledge.

The winner is the first person to either 12 points of wealth (with at least 4 points of knowledge) or 6 points of knowledge (with at least 5 points of wealth).
categories: Card Game, Farming, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Raiders & Privateers-2
description:
[from the introduction]

The late 2230’s and early 2240’s saw the institutionalization of raiders throughout the know galaxy. Human raider bands created shell corporations to, at one and the same time, conceal and support their activities. Within the League, these methods were sometimes adapted to the local politics. The Vree Guild of Salvage, once a respectable institution, has become a front for several pirate groups. Several Brakiri corporations, seeing the value in having a small military force whose activities they could plausibly deny, are believed to have created whole dummy divisions supporting the activity of raiders in exchange for occasional “favors” from those raiders. In contrast, raiders operating out of Drazi and Centauri space continue to follow their centuries old traditions of working on the fringes of society where they have long been accepted, if disreputable, institutions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: The Twelve Doctors: The Key to Time
description:
The Key to Time is an unauthorised, non-profit, and non-collectable mini-expansion for The Twelve Doctors: Doctor Who Card Game.

The expansion consists of the following cards:

The Key to Time play-area card (shared victory condition)
Ribos play-area card (new planet)
Black Scrolls of Rassilon play-area card (new gadget for the Master)
The Doctor's Recorder play-area card (new gadget for the Doctor)

Master's Deck:
Ogri - Stones of Blood
Swampies
Black Guardian
The Captain (of Zanak, the Pirate Planet)
Meglos
Android of Tara
Rassilon's Gauntlet
Sontaran Robot
Warriors of the Deep
Myrka

Doctor's Deck:
White Guardian
Mentalis - War Computer
Mentiads
Drax - Renegade Timelord
Idris - The Doctor's Wife
Astra - Princess of Atrios
Lady Christina de Souza
Bessie

The actual Key to Time provides a new shared victory condition: if either player manages to get five 'Key' cards into play and keep them there, then they will immediately win the game. However, even if they do not manage to assemble the fabled key, cards such as the two Guardians of Time are scarily powerful even in their own right.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management

name: The Great War: Over the Top
description: Over the Top contains a full year-by-year overview of the 1915-18 period, new Battalion-level army lists for British Empire, French and German forces, and a new army list for the American Expeditionary Force, including the Devil Dogs and US Tank Companies. It also contains detailed rules covering such actions as assaulting a trench line, or leading a hand-picked party on a trench raid, as well as background missions to set miniature wargames within the larger backdrop of some of the greatest actions of the First World War.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Module D1 – Veterans Master Ship Chart
description:
From in the book:

The is the actual, complete, Master Ship Chart (plus a couple of important annexes) which is used by Amarillo Design Bureau and the Star Fleet Staff for internal checking and development.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Salamaua '42
description:
Salamaua '42 is a solitaire simulation of the Australian commando raid of 29 June 1942 on the north coast of New Guinea.

The Australians must cause as much damage to the Japanese defenders while minimising their own casualties.

The action is regulated by a series of tables and the level of success is determined by the amount of risk the commandos are willing to take. The roll of the dice also makes the outcome unpredictable.

CONTENTS:
1 x colour map
180 x counters, mounted and ready-to-use
2 x double-sided player aid cards
1 x set of rules
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Rally Round the King:  Armies & Campaigns 3000 BC to 1500 AD
description:
With Rally Round the King, you can fight large fantasy battles by themselves or wrapped in an easy-to-use Campaign System. But what if you want to fight Roman Legions against Germanic invaders? Or Norman Knights versus Saxon Huscarls?
What about a good historical set of rules? Look no further!

Just drop the fantasy rules from Rally Round the King, add this supplement, and you have a historical mass-battles game. We've included over 145 historical armies from 3000 BC to 1500 AD, each with a Basic Army, and using Recruiting Rolls to work with the Campaign System from Rally Round the King. No Dragons, Trolls, or Elves, just Egyptian chariots, Roman legionaries, and 100 Years War longbowmen.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: GOOBERS! Escape from Chano III
description:
Quick, Easy, Tactical Play! : LOTS OF CHIP GOOBERS : Player Interaction out the WAZOO

Description:
Goobers, the most vile beings in the vast universe did it again. The planet Chano III has been a victim of the Goobers constant littering, wasting, burping, & farting. This is just what the Goobers do, find new planet's inhabit them ,then party party party until its core can't take anymore and begins to implode.

Now luckily for the Goobers, they have a ride off this rock. Now unluckily they have expanded a bit sense they arrived. There's just never enough room for all the Goobers to fit back in the escape ship!!

Well, that's where you come in, you have the unpleasant responsibly of getting as many of the 18 Goobers you are burdened with with on that ship.

There are 6 different Goobers of 3 different colors at your unfortunate disposal. Each of the 6 have there own well ~special~ talent that you must best utilize to see your way to victory.
Now remember you don't have a very long time before the ship will take off into the great outer space, so you must work diligently.

The player who receives the least negative points (there are no positive points in a world where Goobers are involved) by the time of blast off is the one who will be most responsible for the destruction of the next world the Goobers land on (also known as the winner of this game).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence
publishers: Hands Down Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Dust Tactics: Allies Heavy Support Walker – "Long Tom II / Mobile HQ / Skysweeper"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Dust Tactics: Allies Heavy Support Walker is the Allies' latest piece of versatile VK-powered hardware and it has three configurations: the Long Tom II, the Mobile HQ, and the Skysweeper. The Long Tom II is equipped with a fast-reloading artillery weapon, allowing this walker to strike repeatedly from a distance. The Mobile HQ is a command vehicle that lets Ally command squad units come aboard and use its equipment to enhance their abilities. Meanwhile, the Skysweeper blasts enemy planes out of the air!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: First to the Line
description:
First to the Line captures many of the strategies, tactics, and drama of road bicycle racing in a simple card game, as players control a set of riders in the race as they try to overcome the terrain and their opponents.

The game is broken into ten rounds. Each round a random terrain card is revealed, such as mountains, winding roads, or cobbles. These cause riders in play to fall behind based on their strength on that terrain, and also enable special cards to be played. A player's turn each round consists of drawing cards into their hand and then playing cards to deploy riders, make breakaway attempts, attempt to chase down the breakaway, or impose mishaps like flat tires on opponents. Within the simple and fast playing mechanics, the game enables players to deploy strategies familiar to cycling fans: Climbers make valiant breakaway attempts in the mountains, sprinters attempt to hold on for the finish line dash, and domestiques attempt to support them both as their director sportifs shepherd the team toward victory.

The first edition of First to the Line is produced as a full-color deck of standard sized playing cards featuring hand drawn art. It does not ship with a box.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: James T. Kirk Promo
description:
Name: James T. Kirk
Cost: 9
Type: Character
Characteristics: Federation | Human | Male | Captain
Flip Effect: All players gain 1 Commander.
Effect: You may trash a Basic Character in your hand. If you do , you get +3 XP.
Stats: +2 | +3 | +3 | - |
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: Montgomery Scott Promo
description:
Name: Montgomery Scott
Cost: 7
Type: Character
Characteristics: Federation | Human | Male | Lt. Commander
Flip Effect: All players may trash 1 card in their discard area.
Effect: Remove up to 3 damage from your flagship. This card gets +X Attack where X is the amount of damage removed.
Stats: +2 | +1 | +1 | +2 |
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Pocket Footy
description:
Pocket Footy is a dice game based on Australia Rules Football. 7 custom made dice represent players and actions on the field to simulate a fast, action packed game of Aussie Rules.

It's light, quick and simple to play. 7 dice, 1 bag and instructions - that's all you need!

The 7 dice represent 4 key playing positions, the Umpire who adjudicates who has possession of the ball, a Contest die that determines who wins the ball in open play and the Pass Percentage die that determines if a pass has been successful.

The aim is to get the ball down to your Forward positions and kick a goal.

Aussie Rules football is a fast game and possession changes hands a lot. This game too is fast and hectic with players swapping dice as possession is won & lost.

After 4 quarters of play, the winner is the player with the highest total of goals and points.

It is a dice game, so luck is involved. There is the option to play some advanced rules that allow for re-rolls and a push-you-luck mechanic.

Please enjoy it for a fast, light filler that Aussie Rules fans will love!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Murder in the Dark
description:
Murder in the Dark is a parlor game played with 6 or more people.

Played in the dark, a randomly selected "murderer" attempts to commit at least one murder without being noticed. For, if he's noticed, the (also randomly selected) detective may have enough clues to lead to a proper accusation.

GAME PLAY:
First, establish the play area. Usually this is played in a house, but it can be played anywhere that is dark enough. You will want to establish areas that are off limits if any.

Prepare a deck of cards, one per player. The player who secretly, and randomly, selects the ace of spades is the murderer. The one that selects the King is the detective. All others are civilians.

Once these cards are secretly looked at, and replaced, a countdown is done, and the lights are turned out.

At this point all players may wonder about freely. Some may hide, some may go out looking for evidence. As the murderer, you may walk up to someone and say "You're dead". Once they've heard this they're dead, but they may also scream before they've been killed. A "dead body" can be lead wherever the murderer would like to place them, and they must stay there until the end of this phase.

One may also, regardless of the role, touch someone and ask "are you dead?". This is the only time a dead person may speak, "yes" they would say. At this point "body body body!" is yelled. Someone turns on the lights, and now we try to discover who the murderer was.

All gather in a common area. Those who are dead indicate as such, and where they were found is established. It is best for the dead to sit away from the main area. It is VERY IMPORTANT that the dead not speak at all, or give any indication who killed them.

If the detective has been killed, then the murderer has won. Otherwise, the detective will start asking questions of the living. Some play that the detective may only ask "yes" or "no" questions. The murderer may lie about anything, and also make false accusations. Once the detective has an idea who the murderer is, they formally accuse them, the murderer may not lie at this point.

If they're wrong, the lights go back out, and play continues. The dead are still dead. But, of course, now the murderer knows the detective's identity.

If they're right, the murderer has lost.

ALTERNATE PLAY: Some play with more than one detective, which is a good idea if the group gets above 8.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Hail Caesar: Britannia
description:
In 43AD Aulus Plautius led the Roman legions to the edge of the known world: to the mysterious land of the Britons. TheEmperor Claudius demanded a victory, and what better way of doing it than to bring this savage nation under the Roman yoke.

Rome commanded huge armies of professional soldiers with the infrastructure needed to feed, transport, equip and command them. Opposing this mighty military machine was a mere patchwork of tribes and wild barbarian warriors. Refusing to yield to the conquerors, one man emerged as the champion of the Britons: Caractacus! Defeated in open battle, Caractacus turned to guerilla warfare: raiding and ambushing enemy troops on the march. No Roman could defeat him; in the end it was treachery that overcame the Briton’s greatest champion: the treachery of Queen Cartimadua of the Brigantes.

It was another Queen of the Britons who, ten years later, led the greatest rebellion of all against Roman rule: Boudica, Queen of the Iceni. Years of resentment and oppression boiled over into a war that almost drove the Romans from Britain altogether, burning London and humbling even the mighty legions.

This then is the story of the Roman invasion of Britain, from the Claudian Conquest and wars of Caractacus until the defeat of Boudica and the destruction of the druids upon Mona. Included in this supplement is a map-based campaign game recreating the invasion, as well as historical scenarios covering the wars of Caractacus and the Boudican revolt.

A copy of the Hail Caesar rulebook is required to use this supplement.
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: ATS TT El Alamein: The Battle of Ruweisat Ridge
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) revisits the North African desert in this ATS TT edition. The all new collection of squad level scenarios depicts the fierce fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and the British 8th Army in the vicinity of Ruweisat Ridge, firmly between the Mediterranean Sea and the Qattara Depression in Egypt, 1942.

The game includes all the color-die cut counters you need to play the scenarios, a brand new map, and a new set of scenarios that all play on the historical map. You will also find the usual Battlefield Walkaround and the latest ATS TT variant rules.
Ownership of the standard ATS rules, play aids and informational counters is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Locke & Key: Timeshift Key Foil Promo Card
description:
Foil promo card for Locke & Key card game.

During the game you can play last each round, but your tiebreaker position is unchanged.

The Timeshift Key Promo card is added to the Key deck and played as per the standard rules of the game.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Locke & Key: Moon Key Foil Promo Card
description:
Foil promo card for Locke & Key card game.

During the game, at the start of your turn, you may look at the top card of the strength deck.

The Moon Key Promo card is added to the Key deck and played as per the standard rules of the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Wiraqocha: Scrolls of Quezacoatl
description:
Wiraqocha: Scrolls of Quezacoatl is a mini-expansion for Wiraqocha consisting of four scrolls. During set-up, place the scrolls with the artifacts on the four temples. (Each scroll bears the color of a temple.) When an explorer conquers a temple, he can take the scroll with the artifact.

Later in the game, a player can use a scroll as a die with the value indicated on the scroll — but only for conquest; a scroll cannot be placed in defense on a tile. When a player uses a scroll, it returns to its matching temple.

If during phase 1, a player has an explorer on a temple where a scroll appears, he can take it. If the explorer leaves the temple for any reason, the player keeps the scroll until he uses it. A scroll can be stolen in a base camp as an artifact or a somnium crystal.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #6
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #6 is composed of 3 expansions:

Global Mogul: Entrepreneur
This expansion adds 10 tiles with special abilities that players receive at the beginning of the game. Each player received 1 tile and it is either random or picked in reverse turn order.

Urbania: Catty Corner
This expansion adds 5 tokens (1 per player) that allow a player to, once per game, renew diagonally instead of orthogonally. It also has alternate rules for building renewing.

Automobile: Chicken – 2 Player Variant
6 Tiles
mechanics: Unspecified

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Storm Golems
description:
The storm golem is a type-2 attack system, supplied with either a sonic gun or a set of reaper blades and a nanoblaster. Although the nanoblaster is a short range weapon, the exceptional accuracy of the storm golem and the nanominition’s capacity to follow the movement of its target, make it a really efficient weapon at medium range. The sonic gun, based on the double vibration effect, disembowels and shatters its targets with great ease.

Thanks to these qualities, the storm golems have imposed themselves as one of the standards among autonomous attack systems.

Thanks to the combination of the nanoblasters and the sonic gun, the storm golems prove to be exceptionally versatile units, capable of facing any kind of threat, ranging from light armored vehicles to infantry.

Contents:
• 4 storm golems (nano blaster/reaper blades)
• 1 storm golem (sonic gun)
• 1 storm golem leader (nano blaster/reaper blades)
• 3 cards
-6 miniatures
-3 reference cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Mathable Domino
description:
Mix between Mathable and Dominoes. Domino tiles may be placed next to the domino placed in the middle of the table to complete any equation (+, -, x, ÷) so that one of the two numbers on the domino placed is the result of the equation formed by the two adjacent numbers, regardless if the two numbers of the equation are from the same domino or two different dominoes.

The player who gets rid of their dominoes first is the winner.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Mage Wars: Storm Drake Hide Promo Card
description:
This promo card was given as Gen Con 2013

Storm Drake Hide

Equipment
Cost 6 Mana

Mage gains Armor +2 and the Lightning -2 trait.

Non foil stamped version was released in the Forcemaster vs Warlord Expansion (3 copies)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Laputa
description:
After global nuclear war, the earth covered with thick nuclear dust couldn't be ideal for human or any life, and the situation become worse every year in spite of many efforts to recover it by survivors. The chosen scientists group of global survivors on the earth had ambitious plan to manage a big city to float in the sky above the nuclear dusted cloud. Eventually one city was successfully floated in the sky after many trial and errors, by new technology about utilizing nuclear energy and earth's magnetic field. That city was named as 'LAPUTA', according to the name of the project...

[Object]
On the game board, LAPUTA which consists of 7 areas is floated on the sky. The Sky is devided as 3 regions to defend LAPUTA efficiently. Players have to defeat the rebel fleet and protect LAPUTA. Distinguish yourself in battle and rise to the next Admiral.

[Game Play]
The game consists of 8 rounds, and each round has 3 phases as following:
1.Placement of commanders: Commanders are actual executers who can deliver or perform your orders. Their roles are decided according to what place they put on.
2.Performing actions: Commanders on the board perform actions according to their places and roles. There are total 7 kinds of action according to 7 different places.
3.Enemy appearance and battle: Enemy fleets are emerging on the side of board and battle starts. There are 3 regions of sky(A,B,C) and battles can be happen on any region, sometimes multiple at the same time. Score evaluations are followed after each battle.

[Scoring]
After 8th round, sum up following scores:
- Current score(generally gained from battle)
- Fleet score
- Track & Commander score
- Mission card score

This is not a cooperative game, but you often need to cooperate with others at the battles for victory.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: War of 1812 Battle Collection
description:
The War of 1812 battle collection is similar to the French and Indian War Battle Collection.

War of 1812 contains 12 separate battles with die cut counters terrain chart, rules and scenarios booklet.

This game pack may also be used as a scenario guide for miniature war gaming.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Cauldron of the Gods
description:
Players take the role of a god in a friendly competition to reach the Glory goal set by the crowd, directing their champion in a wide array of arena-style games: Classics like King of the Hill, new modes like Shrine of the Wind, all played out via a simple rock-paper scissors mechanic with direct conflict resolved by a simple die roll without player elimination and the arenas sorted into easy-to-grasp zones.

The game features three different modes: Basic, designed for new or young players and quicker, simpler gameplay; Advanced, a more strategic mode where each player truly takes on the role of a God with resource management and asymmetric powers to twist the fates of their pawns in the arena; and Intermediate, which introduces the Advanced mode concepts and the active role of the player as one of the all-new pantheon of Gods in the Cauldron!

As part of the mission of Civilized Animal Productions to emphasize the role of games not just as a way to build relationships, relax, and have fun but also to teach the young, Cauldron of the Gods offers plenty of opportunity to discuss history and culture in the form of the Gods, emphasize sportsmanship by eliminating the other players as 'enemies' by using a system of proxy conflict and painting the game as a competition, and help curb cheating or disengagement by using a directly personal approach to conflicts between players and adopting a story-like, cinematic expression of the actual fighting. The game has frequent moments of tension between peaceable moments, which can be used to defuse negative behaviors and infuse positive approaches without interrupting the flow of the game. The Advanced and Intermediate modes of play are more complicated and this may be daunting to the younger range of players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Neverborn (Wave 1)
description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Neverborn featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Ars Victor: First Wave Promo
description: Ars Victor: First Wave Promo is a set of four promo tiles for use with Ars Victor. The front side contains tokens for Warlords and Fanatics, while the back of the tokens are Bannermen and Champions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Miracle at Dunkerque: The British Withdrawal from France, May-June 1940
description:
In May of 1940 the German army invaded Holland, Belgium and France. In a matter of a few weeks they rolled up the combined armies of Belgium, France and Great Britain. The BEF (British Expeditionary Force) and other nearby Allied forces were forced to retreat toward the French coast, resulting in about 400,000 men being surrounded near the town of Dunkirk. Rescue operations commenced to evacuate these forces to England and Winston Churchill, the new Prime Minister of Great Britain, was hopeful that perhaps 30,000 men could be rescued from the trap. Admiral Sir Bertram Ramsay was put in charge of “Operation Dynamo”, the goal of which was to send ships of all sizes and shapes to evacuate these beleaguered soldiers from the beaches of France and Belgium. Through skill, efficient planning and poor German coordination (along with some fortuitous luck), the operation was able to rescue an incredible 330,000 men from the pocket. A true military miracle had been performed and by doing so, the future of the Second World War was forever altered.

Miracle at Dunkerque is essentially a solitaire game, but also includes a two-player option. It is meant to recreate the tense situation within the Dunkirk perimeter during those last eight days in May and June 1940. The game design aims to capture the spirit of the difficult decision-making challenges faced by Allied commanders as they attempted to extricate the remnants of Britain’s last field army from certain capture or death. Historically-based Event Cards drive the action and create varying circumstances each turn. The besieging German forces (army, air and naval units) are controlled by these cards, which are specifically designed to place constant pressure on the player. Allied Player Actions must be allocated each turn for the defense of the perimeter, the creation of evacuee units and the loading of these evacuees from the beaches and moles to available ships and then sailed onward to the safety of England. You obviously cannot save all the Allied units, so you must choose who stays to fight and who shall attempt to escape in order to continue the struggle against the Nazis another day.

Miracle at Dunkerque is designed by Hermann Luttmann and developed by Paul Fish. Chris Hansen provides additional development and playtesting support. This is the same team that put together the popular game, A Spoiled Victory. However, Miracle at Dunkerque represents a significant enhancement and expansion of that original design concept. The map is more extensive, the player now controls actual naval units that travel back and forth across the English Channel (hopefully loaded with evacuees), more combat units are provided to both sides and the air campaign is now represented. And of course there is the priceless added value of the incredible Legion Wargames production team. But just as importantly, the game system has been honed and polished so that despite the extra detail and chrome, this larger, deluxe edition of the game will play just as quickly as the original did.

The ultimate goal of the Miracle at Dunkerque game design is to provide a different kind of gaming experience for the player – one that is both an evacuation management game and a tough, nail-biting perimeter defense and fighting withdrawal wargame. In any case, we hope that you find it a challenging, unique and fun game that gives you the feel for the nearly impossible position in which the Allied troops found themselves and the true extent of the miracle that occurred on the beaches of France that spring of 1940.
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Smithereens: Variant
description: Published in Command Magazine 22 (Antietam: Burnished Rows of Steel), Smithereens Variant is an expansion for Smithereens, with new rules for pro Axis Yugoslavians and Nazi secret weapons. Also add 12 new counters for play this expansion
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Malifaux: The Torch and The Blade – Sonnia Creed Box Set
description: Burn the Witch. Sonnia creates a lot of fire and punishes Magic users. She is one of the few Guild Masters who can summon minions as well as pillars of flame. Can do obscene amounts of damage by catching enemy models under her blast templates. Arcanists: Tremble.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Pony express
description: Pony Express is a game for the younger audience. Task is to deliver mail on specified places as soon as possible. Points are collected in two ways. The first way by reaching finish line (first gets 12 points, second 10, third 8 ...). Another way is to deliver as many mails. Each mail brings 1 point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Ouroboros Dragons
description: You are a legendary Ouroboros Dragon circling the earth with your tail. You keep moving forward, changing or consuming your opponents tails (and sometimes even their heads.) Create an unbroken tail of your color around the earth or be the last dragon left to win the game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Der Fall Marlies Reinhold
description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

This case is set in the Berlin of the golden 20s. The producer of a silent movie is hosting a press dinner behind the scenes to present the newest star actress, Marlies Reinhold, to the public. Celebrities and press representatives are waiting for Marlies' entrance when the host appears alone, reporting he has just found Marlies murdered. Since the set had been closed to anyone but the people present at the dinner all day long, one thing is certain: The killer is among those present.
mechanics: Role Playing

name: ORIGINZ: The Superpowered Card Game
description:
Become a Superpowered Hero or Villain; team up with friends and battle in this complete, multi-format card game for 2-8 players.

Originz features a 'deck is your life' mechanic and a consistent energy resource.

Play with one of 12 pre-constructed decks out of the box, or customize your own deck.

264 cards, 12 dividers and one 1 rulebook included. No tokens or trackers required!

"A rift in the space-time continuum has altered the very fabric of reality...

Magic is real.  Mutations are common.  Aliens have invaded. 

Governments have dissolved - their military forces have scattered. Nobody is safe.

The world has been changed forever, but your origin story has just begun. You’ve survived the apocalypse and emerged with incredible superpowers.

Many see you as their last hope – a savior….a hero. Others fear you - branding you as a villain who seeks only power and glory.

It is time to show them who you really are…it is time to take a stand.

There is nothing left to do, but fight!"
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Real Time Tower Defense
description:
The Darkness looms and your master is the only one who can banish it. It will take him 4 days. You, his apprentices, must defend him till he has finished casting his spell or be forever plunged into darkness. Your only hope is to build the powerful arcane defenses handed down to you by your master; Powerful towers. Time is of the essence.

Real Time Tower Defense is a real time co-operative boardgame for 2-4 players that plays in under 60 minutes. In what is a true tower defense game, players (the Apprentices) build towers to defend their base from the hordes of mindless monsters besieging them and survive 4 “Days” (Having at least 1 Team Health left without going below 1 at any point during the game). The game is played in real time, increasing the tension, giving players just enough time to do what they need to without overwhelming them. The game is run to a sound track which prompts players through the game (much like Space Alert or Escape but somewhere in between). There is a break between each “Day” giving players time to plan for the next while the difficulty of the game increases. Players also gather resources and build their towers in real time using a sand timer, meaning there are two aspects of the game competing for attention. Forget about one of these aspects and you will lose the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Print & Play, Real-time, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Worker Placement

name: Coloma
description:
Pan for gold in this unique worker placement game!

Welcome to the town of Coloma! Players play the role of gold miners that have arrived in Coloma, Montana in 1848 upon hearing of the chance discovery of gold in the surrounding area. As one of the first prospectors to arrive you have a head start on the swarm of fortune seekers heading west and a great opportunity to become some of the biggest Gold Mining Tycoons in America!

During the early stages of the game the players have no workers and must Placer Mine the rivers by themselves, panning for small deposits of gold. By the end of the game the players may have built a street of buildings in the town of Coloma funded by a successful gold mining operation in the mountains, employing a team of hopeful workers to produce dozens of gold bars and amassing a fortune!

What makes the game unique is the mechanic that allows players to simulate gold panning using the game box and the double sided 'Alluvium' chits.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Red vs White vs Blue: A Russian Civil War 1918-1922
description:
Red vs White vs Blue is a block wargame about the four year long struggle in Russia after the 1917 October Revolution. One player controls the Red (Bolshevik) forces, the other the Whites (anti-Bolshevik, a collection of different factions). One unique aspect of the game that there are also Blue blocks: these represent the Separatist forces (e.g. the Baltic Republics) that want to remain neutral and independent.

Unit types include Infantry, Cavalry, Tanks, Armored Trains, specialized White units (Cossacks, Volunteers, Czechoslovak Legion, Baltic Germans, Finns etc.) and several leaders for all three sides.

Both players have their own deck of 16 action cards, from which they draw 7 and use 5 per turn. The cards govern the players' actions (e.g. Comintern, leader activations, recruitment, terror). The game is 10 turns long.

The game has a fully playable VASSAL module! You can download it from here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VsyFa2c6fmKo_DSyNi2-BqRcZgC...

COMPONENTS
1 map of Russia
70 blocks
32 action cards
4 markers
1 rulebook
several dice

The game is PnP, which means that the components are freely downloadable! Please note however, that the blocks and the dice are not included, you have to supply these yourself.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Dwarves of Runegard Reinforcements
description: Expansion for the Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Dwarves of Runegard faction. It includes new types of cards.
mechanics: Variable Phase Order

name: Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Gray
description:
From the published:

Picking up the story from C.S. Navy: Plan Blue, Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Gray looks at naval operations in the Second War of the Rebellion as the outnumbered Confederate States Navy along with its British, Canadian and Imperial Mexican allies battles the much larger Union fleet.

In Plan Blue, we covered the early months of the war that followed the Confederacy’s surprising declaration of war against the United States. U.S. Navy Plan Gray sees action taking place in both the North Atlantic theater (on the map from U.S. Navy Plan Red) and in the Caribbean (on the map from U.S. Navy Plan Gold). The Confederates have managed to keep their communications to Britain open, but now the North threatens the economically-vulnerable southern flank of the Confederate Empire in places like Cuba, Santo Domingo and Panama.

The Union fleet adds powerful new warships: additional members of the New York, Nevada and Pennsylvania classes, fast battle cruisers, torpedo battleships (actually proposed in the real world!), some obsolete torpedo rams (the proposed improved version of the useless Katahdin), and the "small battleship" alternative armed with four 16-inch guns (also a real proposal).

The economically-weaker Confederacy tries to even things up with deadly but fragile torpedo cruisers and some small coast defense ships. The Imperial Mexican Navy is there to help out, with a dreadnought and some other foreign-built ships. And there are small contingents from the minor Caribbean powers, Denmark and the Netherlands.

U.S. Navy Plan Gray is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series, based on battles that never happened. It is not a complete game: Ownership of U.S. Navy Plan Red, U.S. Navy Plan Gold, Jutland, C.S. Navy: Plan Blue and Confederate States Navy is necessary to play all of the ten scenarios included.

Plan Gray includes 80 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 60 "long" pieces representing major warships and 20 square ones representing smaller craft.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Cardboard Tube Samurai
description:
This is a promotional playable character for the Krosmaster series of games, released at PAX 2015.

This character has his name in red, which indicates that he is only meant for fun and non-competitive play. He won't be legal in tournament, and won't be available in the online version of the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: World At War: The Texan War of Independence
description:
In late July of 1985, two months before the dramatic events depicted in America Conquered, a brief but bloody and consequential war was fought: The Texan War of Independence. It marked the first time in 120 years, since the Civil War, that Americans took up arms against each other.

The circumstances were desperate. The United States had been struck by nuclear weapons. Many cities—Washington, D.C., New York, Los Angeles and others—had been annihilated, but none in Texas. Texas stood strong. Initially, Governor White of Texas sent convoys of relief supplies to the imperiled areas of the country, but soon learned that the convoys had been intercepted by a skilled and tactful, but unknown, enemy. President Saunders, upset that Texas would withhold aid to the rest of the country, sent military forces to Texas to intimidate its single-minded Governor in to resuming the flow of aid. Governor White responded by sending the Texas National Guard to the border, to meet and stop them.

As these unnatural enemies fought against one another, like brother against brother, a new threat loomed. Both Texas and the United States itself needed to confront the post-nuclear world. They could do it independently or together.

The Texan War of Independence contains four gripping scenarios. Forty new counters bring four formations of Texans to the front lines. The fearless Texans ride toward all enemies in Abrams and M60-A3 tanks, and their well-armed infantry are highly mobile, with plenty of M-113s and Dragon support weapons at hand. Texas had once been its own republic. In the Texan War of Independence you’ll find out if it happens again.

The Texan War of Independence is a World at War series expansion module; to play it, you will need to own America Conquered.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Homo Sapiens
description:
(wrong description below - the game is similar to trivial pursuit and asks all sorts of questions to players)
There are 60 cards with 12 different animals and 5 cards with humans.
Each player gets His/Her own animal. Shuffle the cards and start drawing Your cards. If You draw and show the animal You represent be the first to shout the sound of this animal to get the card as a point. If the human is drawn the first player who shouts homo sapiens gets the card as a point.

If all cards are played the player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bucks, Bullets & Flowers
description:
Welcome to Chicago. Don’t smell the gunpowder in the air or the scent of perfume coming from the whorehouses or the aftershave of the mobsters hanging around the corner.

Stay alert, grab your bucks before your enemies beat you to it, build your gang fast and better than all the rest. Because the next thing you smell could be the flowers on your grave.

The game is based by an innovative system of play called "confronts": each mobster, according to his skills to do an action, must confront the power of the Gang (coming from influence tokens) with all other powers in the same district.

Each of the players plays a Boss of a Gang on Chicago or the Police Chief at the beginning of the 1920. To rule the city, as Boss, you must command your mobsters as pawn to earn money coming from robbery, run clubs and assassinate enemies. If you represent the Law, instead, you must fight the crime with your policemen, closing the clubs, capturing mobsters and also try to send one of the Bosses to jail.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Diceplomacy
description:
The theatre of Europe is about to go up in the flames of war. You are the leader of your people. Use your diplomatic skills and luck of the Iron Dice to secure victory.

Diceplomacy is a simple, yet strategic dice game of war and diplomacy with the flavour of World War 1.

The game has the war, alliance-making, secrecy, bluffing, and luck, etc. that people love from complex strategy games, but in Diceplomacy you only need 1 die per person, it is easy to learn, and a game takes only about 20 minutes.

Quick game overview:
Each player rolls one die, to determine their Power, and keep their die hidden.

On your turn, you can do 1 of the following 4 things: Declare war on another player, propose an alliance with another player, cancel all alliances, or reroll your Power die

If you declare war on another player - the one of you with highest Power scores a Victory, and the other a Defeat.

The goal of the game is to get 3 Victories.
If a player is defeated 3 times, he is out of the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Negotiation, Political, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Space Miners
description:
This is a Micro-game with 18 cards some cubes and some dices!

In the game each player control their pack of robotic miners and send them to planet to work and back with resources ( The Victory Points ).

This game is a simple and eficient Area Control, Action Select and Dice Selection in a small package.

Each round consists of two phases. The first is to roll and select, the first in turn rolls the dice and select 3 of them for you and passes the rest to the next player. In the second phase the players used the dice selected to prepare actions in the mother ship and / or send your miners to planets paying the landing value so that the miner can land on the planet that will mining until there is the scoring event that calls the miners back to the player.



Game Components
18 Cards
13 six-faced dices
24 cubes ( 6 of each color )
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Nuna Aranway
description:
Nuna Aranway is a board game for 2-4 people where each player controls an 'ayllu' (quechua for 'family') of the ancient Andes, in the context of the Chavín culture. The ayllu of a player is represented by tokens, which are his or her character tokens.

The game consists of 10 rounds, which stage the four seasons of one year: spring, summer, autumn and winter. In each round, players designate one action for each character token of his or her ayllu. The actions available for a character of a given ayllu are indicated in the general board (a board shared by all players) and in its player's personal board (a board for that ayllu only).

Through the actions decided by each player, an 'ayllu' obtains enough food for each season, plays the cards in its player's hand -which develop technologies and new traditions-, and specializes artisans, warriors or holy priests of Wari, the god-demon of Chavín. Specializing a character token improves and unlocks certain actions. Players may attack one another -warriors are good at this-, or even force others into hunger through a time manipulation known as Intihuatana (to tie the Sun), which is available to priests only. Artisans are the only characters able to build advanced structures and draw new cards, while regular characters are the only that can fish or plant new crops.

When the four seasons of the game end, the player with the highest "Development Score" wins. This score is increased by cultural (construction and tradition cards), spiritual (nuna points) and military development (control points) of each ayllu, and is decreased due to hunger.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Aventuria Abenteuerspiel-Box: Verlockender Köder Promo Card
description:
This is the second promotion card for the Aventuria card game. It was available through german Geek! magazine #22.

It is an equipment action card reading "You are only allowed to exhaust this card when an opponent uses a fate point. Exhaust the card: The opponent loses 1 health."
For usage in adventure mode, it additionally reads "When an opponent rolls a 1-5 on his action throw, you may exhaust this card. Exhaust the card: The opponent loses 1 health."
The cost to play this card is 1 stamina.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Arcade: Reinforcements – The Artillery
description:
The Artillery is a new type of unmovable ground unit that has a massive firepower and a strong armour.

During the setup phase, agree on the number of units of each type that each player will control. Set up the board, units, and cards as usual, including the Artillery Units.

Artillery have 6 endurance points, so when setting up the cards, place a disc on the number ‘6’ of every Artillery card. They also have a strong armour (indicated by the shield icon).

The Artillery has some special rules.

Components:

- 3 terrain tiles of 1×5 squares each
- 20 square Destroyed Floor cards
- 6 Artillery Units in 2 colours (unassembled)
- 6 Artillery targeting tokens in 2 colours
- 6 Artillery cards in 2 colours
- 6 black discs
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Robotech RPG Tactics: Zentraedi Artillery Battlepods
description:
From the publisher:

Prepare for invasion with Robotech RPG Tactics! Take command of the deadly mecha fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force, the Zentraedi Armada, or the Malcontents. Robotech RPG Tactics is an epic 6mm scale battle game where players control whole armies from the Robotech universe. Take to the battlefield to crush your friends in a dynamic tactical game where the outcome is always hanging in the balance. Give your Zentraedi legion greater firepower with these artillery and support Battlepods; four figures total. 4 Zentraedi Support Battlepods, each of which can be made into any of the following: Gluuhaug-Regult, Light Artillery Battlepod, Serauhaug-Regult - Heavy Artillery Battlepod, Telnesta-Regult, and Experimental Particle Beam Battlepod.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Objection! The Card Game
description:
A Game of Luck, Laughs, and Ludicrous Legalities

A crime has been committed, and it’s up to the justice system to determine which team is innocent—and which is guilty!

Each team is comprised of Lawyers that ask questions, and Witnesses who give corresponding answers. Unanswered questions mean even more negative points, and sometimes even the squeakiest clean Witness must divulge a shocking secret!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Take That

name: The Colonists: The Alliance of the Six Cities
description: The Scenario is based on the second era. The game board is split into six cities. Jumping from market to market you can reach different cities and try to complete tasks to win the game after 5 years.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – New Guinea
description: In 1942, Japanese forces invaded the island of New Guinea and started a bitter, three-year campaign against allied Australian and American forces. Fought in dense jungles and across rugged mountaintops, the grueling fight pushed men to their very limits and forced commanders to adopt new strategies and tactics for the harsh island terrain. Filled with new rules, scenarios, and unit types, this supplement for Bolt Action provides players with all of the information they need to set their games in this unforgiving battlefield.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Masked Men
description:
Warrior Monk Masahiro has vowed to fight the injustices of the Japanese clans. He and his followers battle the power of the samurai, taking the armoured face-plates of their fallen enemies as badges of victory.

The stealing face-plates idea has no historical grounding, but we thought it was a cool idea that might well have happened. Perhaps more importantly it demonstrates what a different look you can create by changing the heads.

Warrior Monks meanwhile are an established part of the history of the period and had many conflicts with the ruling samurai clans. Like the other new metal character models Masahiro has his own character card (costing an extra point or two to recruit), or you can simply use one of the standard samurai cards (yes, even though monks weren’t samurai!).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Sequens118
description:
Inspired by series such as "Dexter" or "Criminal Minds”, Sequens118 is a game of detectives and killers that immerses you in a police thriller plot straight out of the cinema. In a recreation of the atmosphere of a crime series, the tension increases as the police corner the murderers.

The game consists of capturing the greatest number of cards, as long as they relate to the character chosen by each player, taking care not to give too many clues so that other players cannot find him or her.

Being able to switch between the role of killer and detective at any time assures engagement until the end, even having been unmasked.

The game supports 2 to 8 players. All the tiles are common and the information is always in view of all players.

The rest is cunning, collaboration, debate, ... and a lot more head-scratching than you might think.

---

Inspirado en series como “Dexter” o “Mentes Criminales”, Sequens118 es un juego de detectives y asesinos que te sumerge en una trama de suspense policial, propia del cine negro.
Buscando crear el ambiente de este tipo de series, la tensión aumenta a medida que el cerco policial va acorralando a los asesinos.

El juego consiste en capturar el mayor número de fichas, siempre que éstas tengan relación con el personaje que haya elegido cada jugador, cuidando de no dar demasiadas pistas para que el resto de jugadores no puedan descubrirlo.

Pudiendo alternar entre el rol de asesino y el de detective en todo momento, la tensión está asegurada hasta el final, incluso habiendo sido descubierto.

Permite partidas desde 2 a 8 jugadores. Todas las fichas son comunes y la información siempre se encuentra a vista de todos los jugadores.

El resto es picaresca, colaboración, debates,… y es mucho más de darle a la cabeza de lo que aparenta.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition
